title: Amazon PPC Consultant (Project-based)
description:
ABOUT US

SWOOC Games is one of the fastest-growing game companies in the US since 2015,  doing 8 figures in sales annually and being featured on the INC 5000 twice. We are seeking a dedicated and committed candidate that is looking for a long-term position with room to grow with our company.



For a candidate with the drive to learn and grow, this truly is an amazing opportunity. We are recruiting, training & building a team for long and successful careers with our company. Our ideal candidate is committed to growing together with us, and in turn, we will give you all the tools and support to succeed and grow in your career.



Are you passionate about:

•  Think Big

•  Learn & Grow

•  Focus on the Future

•  Be Fueled by Innovation

•  Take Ownership

•  Be Respectful



Then, you've found the right place! Our team values these qualities and seeks individuals who are enthusiastic about making an impact.



This opportunity may not be the perfect match if:

•  You're just looking for any gig to try

•  Adapting to USA working hours doesn't fit your schedule

•  Providing exceptional customer service isn't your strong suit



For more information, visit us at 





ABOUT THE ROLE

We are searching for an experienced Amazon PPC Consultant to work with us on an ongoing project basis. As part of the SWOOC Games Team, your mission is to reduce and maintain target TACOS while driving continued growth on Amazon through expert-level PPC strategies. Own all advertising initiatives to maximize ROAS, protect margins, rank key SKUs, and increase total revenue while minimizing wasted ad spend.



•  Develop and execute a full-funnel Amazon PPC strategy (Sponsored Products, Brands, Display, Video).

•  Build, optimize, and scale PPC campaigns based on ACOS/TACoS targets and profitability.

•  Create Updated Strategies for daily, weekly, and monthly optimizations: bid changes, search term harvesting, negative keywords, campaign structure improvements, etc.

•  Analyze PPC performance and prepare weekly reporting with actionable insights and recommendations.

•  Collaborate with the Listing Team, Supply Chain, Finance, and CEO for pricing, inventory, and launch plans.

•  Maintain clean campaign architecture and naming conventions for easy tracking.

•  Stay updated on Amazon Ads algorithm changes, best practices, and competitive landscape.



This position will work directly under our CEO. We are looking for someone who can plug into our workflow and offer their expertise to execute and suggest improvements.



ABOUT YOU

The ideal candidate must have the following knowledge, skills, and work experience. 



•  Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent experience

•  Amazon Advertising certifications preferred

•  5+ years proven experience managing Amazon PPC at scale

•  Deep expertise with Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, and Sponsored Display

•  Experience managing 50+ SKUs and 8 figures in sales.

•  Proven track record in achieving and maintaining low TACOS.

•  Key Competencies: Analytical Thinking & Data Interpretation, Strategic Decision-Making, Detail-Oriented, Problem-Solving, Teamwork, Communication

•  Expert-level Amazon PPC Console and Bulk Files (required)

•  Advanced MS Excel & Google Sheets (VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, pivot tables, data dashboards)

•  Proficiency in Helium 10, Data Dive

•  Strong analytical and reporting skills

•  Excellent written and verbal communication.

•  Ability to drive sales, product ranking, impressions, and conversions.

•  Knowledgeable in all aspects of advertising on Amazon.

•  Internet & tech savvy.



SALARY 

•  Salary is negotiable and depends on experience.



If you feel you are a great fit for this position, please reply to this job post with your updated resume and a sample work/portfolio of successful past projects. 



SWOOC Games team is looking forward to meeting you!

title: Listing and Transaction Coordinator (Real Estate)
description:
Schedule: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST (1-hour lunch break)

Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week)



About Shoreline Transactions

Shoreline Transactions is a real estate support specialist and transaction coordination company. We provide transaction coordination, real estate assistant services, and ongoing operational support to real estate agents. Our goal is to keep agents organized, compliant, and focused on growing their business.



We are currently seeking a highly motivated, resourceful, and dependable Real Estate Virtual Assistant who is looking for a long-term role with room for growth. This position plays a critical role in supporting all aspects of the business and is ideal for someone who enjoys taking ownership, staying organized, and growing alongside a company.



Position Overview

The Real Estate Virtual Assistant will serve as the full-time VA for Shoreline Transactions, handling listings, transactions, closings, and marketing support. This role covers all aspects of the business, so flexibility, strong real estate knowledge, and attention to detail are essential.



This is a dedicated full-time position. No other side jobs or freelance work are permitted.



Key Responsibilities

1. Transaction & Closing Management

2. Manage all active transactions from contract to close

3. Coordinate with agents, clients, lenders, title companies, and other parties

4. Ensure deadlines are met and files remain compliant

5. Upload and manage documents in transaction management systems

6. Listing Management

7. Input and manage listings

title: AI Video Editor Needed — High-Precision Long-Form Ads (German Market)
description:
Overview



We are launching a subscription-based digital product in the relationship / self-improvement niche for women.



We are looking for a top-tier AI video editor who can recreate long-form video ads with extremely high accuracy based on provided reference videos and transcripts.



?? This is NOT basic video editing.

?? This is NOT creative freestyle work.



This role requires precision, structure-matching, and strong execution skills using AI tools.



If you are excellent with AI avatars, AI voices, scene composition, pacing, and German localization — this is for you.





What You’ll Be Doing



-Recreate long-form video ads (3–9 minutes) based on provided reference examples

-Use AI avatars (podcast-style, stage-style, talking-head formats)



Match:



-Tone

-Pace

-Scene structure

-Camera framing

-Emotional delivery

-Replace all elements with clean, original AI-generated assets

-Sync visuals perfectly with provided full ad transcripts

-Produce native-level German ads using a specific translation prompt we provide

-Deliver ads that closely match the structure, rhythm, and flow of the reference videos



We provide:



-Reference video examples

-Full transcripts

-Clear creative direction

-Translation prompts

-Feedback loops & iteration system





Required Skills (Very Important)



You must have experience with:



-AI avatar tools (e.g. Synthesia, HeyGen, D-ID, Colossyan, or similar)

-AI voice generation (German)

-Long-form ad editing (not just short UGC)

-High-accuracy recreation from references

-Clean pacing & storytelling flow

-Proven experience producing German ads



Bonus if you have:



-Direct response / performance ad experience

-Experience with digital products or subscription offers

-Experience working with structured creative systems





What We Care About Most



? Execution accuracy

? Ability to follow instructions precisely

? Speed & reliability

? Willingness to iterate based on feedback

? Long-term collaboration mindset



We do not care about:



-Fancy effects

-Artistic ego

-Over-editing



Performance and clarity > aesthetics.





Test Project (Paid)



We will start with:



? 1 paid test ad recreation



If successful:



-Ongoing work

-Multiple ads per week

-Long-term collaboration

-Potential to grow into a lead AI editor role for this brand



How to Apply (Important)



In your proposal, please include:



-Which AI tools you use (avatars, voices, editing)

Examples of:



-AI avatar videos

-Long-form ads

-Confirmation that you can:



-Recreate ads closely from references

-Produce content in German

-Your availability per week



Applications without examples will be ignored.



Final Note



This is a serious execution-focused role with long-term potential.

If you can deliver consistently at a high level, there is significant upside and volume of work.

title: Expert Landing Page Designer
description:
Our team is looking for a funnel Builder with copywriting and graphic design skills for a full-time position.



If you meet these criteria, enjoy working independently, and have a very good sense of organization and attention to detail, we'd love to hear from you.



We require at least 1+ years of hands-on experience in crafting sales funnels, along with an understanding of online buyers' psychology and selling principles in the dropshipping/e-commerce space.



Your main task is to combine attractive visuals with copywriting to captivate our audience and increase our sales.



##TASKS:



- Gather data from our product testing sheets to pick out important info.

- Create a customer avatar: Understand their needs, desires, and pain points.

- Use our ready-made templates to put together new funnels that sell.

- Craft marketing texts that sell using copywriting principles and ChatGPT.

- Edit images using Photoshop or Canva to make them look good and match the product vibe.

- Get the funnel translated into other languages using Deepl translator.



##EXPECTED RESULTS:



- Create and finish 2 funnels in Funnelish per day

- Achieve targeted KPIs such as 3,5% conversion rate



##REQUIREMENTS:



- Fluent in English, both spoken and written.

- Knowledgeable in e-commerce/dropshipping.

- Understands copywriting, marketing, and sales principles.

- Strong internet connection and a fast computer.

- At least 1 year of experience as a funnel builder.

- Available for a full-time job (40 hours/week).



##TECHNICAL SKILLS NEEDED:



- Proficient in photo editing tools (Canva or Photoshop).

- Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS.



##PERKS / CAREET ADVANCEMENT:



- Work from home.

- Bonuses for each winning funnel created.

- Opportunity to develop your skills and competencies.



##HOURS: Full-time work (8 hours/day)



##RATE: $5.00/ hour + bonuses



##HOW TO APPLY:



1. Double-check that you meet the requirements and technical skills for the position.



2. Change the subject line to “I Want to Work for You [Insert the very first letter of the first name of the Formula 1 driver that won the Dutch GP of 2021].”



3. At the top of your message, write 4-5 sentences to introduce yourself and tell us why you'd like this position and why you're a good fit (please don't write more then that)



4. Add a link to your resume/portfolio and/or an example of funnels you've designed before.



5. Include the word “mangga” at the very end of your response. Why? This lets us see who's actually paying attention.

title: Trademark Paralegal
description:
R.J. Pierce Law Group, P.C. is looking for a skilled Trademark Docket Paralegal to join our growing firm! As a member of the R.J. Pierce law team, you will be an essential part of the overall operational strategy that drives our business forward.



As a Trademark Docket Paralegal for our firm, you will work under the direction of a supervising attorney and will assist in the administration of trademarks, managing client trademark case files, filing trademarks, and conducting research on behalf of the trademark attorneys. Our paralegals interact regularly with firm attorneys, contractors, and clients.



ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Monitors, reviews, and extracts information from USPTO

Identifies and communicates pertinent deadlines to lawyers, paralegals, and clients on a daily basis

Works with our attorneys and paralegals to ensure all deadlines are satisfied by assessing correspondence and proof of filings.

Programs, runs, prints, and distributes docket reports to attorneys and staff.

Prepare and distribute docket reports as requested by attorneys and legal teams to ensure that all deadlines are met. Maintain direct contact with attorneys, paralegals, and clients to ensure daily docket deadlines are satisfied.

Preserve and audit the docket database, including entering, clearing and updating filing due dates and reminders.

Notify clients of the status of their trademarks

Maintain a thorough knowledge of the docket database to create specialized reports and make appropriate changes as necessary.

Auditing trademark files on the docket and updating our CRM system

Coordinate client communications and create automations in our CRM system

Maintain knowledge of trends, developments, and legislative rulings impacting all IP procedures and regulations.

Assisting the legal team with conducting and analyzing trademark clearance searches; retrieving, analyzing, and reporting the status of registrations and performing other tasks as necessary relating to the administering of the trademark process, when necessary

Create Trademark opinion letters that include legal analysis, advice, and recommendations on whether a proposed trademark is available to use and/or register

Manage multiple client-facing databases containing pending and completed matters for each client

Assist with the preparation, filing, and maintenance of trademark applications at the USPTO

Organize, maintain, and update files and docket information related to clients' trademark status

Write Cease-and-Desist letters

Create automations within our CRM

All other tasks as assigned





EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS REQUIRED:

Associate's degree or certificate in paralegal studies preferred but not required (Years of experience will be taken into account in the absence of formal education.)

2-3 years of experience as a paralegal in the Trademark Law industry preferred

Proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint

Candidates must possess strong communication, organization, research, writing, and analytical skills.

Ability to work and communicate with a team in an online collaboration platform.

Strong listening and interpersonal skills

Ability to work on several initiatives simultaneously within compressed time frames, while still maintaining effectiveness

Must have proficient computer and technical skills

Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to prioritize and work proactively with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environment

Effective rapport-building and relationship management skills

Demonstrated ability to be resourceful, innovative, and creative

Demonstrates high emotional intelligence and problem-solving skills

Must be team-oriented, possess a positive attitude, and work well with others

Experience or familiarity with electronic filing with the USPTO is a plus





PLEASE MESSAGE ME WITH A LINK TO YOUR RESUME.

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a part-time or full-time strategic, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to lead and execute our social media and digital marketing efforts from start to finish. This is not a “post-and-go” role. We are looking for someone who can think strategically, execute consistently, and manage the full lifecycle of marketing initiatives with direction and vision provided by the owner.



You will take ownership of social media, content planning, and digital marketing execution while collaborating closely with the founder to ensure everything aligns with the brand’s voice, goals, and standards.



Key Responsibilities

- Lead and execute social media strategy across platforms (Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok, etc.)

- Create and manage monthly and quarterly marketing calendars

- Develop and schedule content aligned with brand goals

- Create the concept and edit short-form videos (Reels, TikTok-style content)

- Design graphics using Canva (brand-aligned templates, posts, stories)

- Support SEO initiatives (blog formatting, keyword optimization, SEO audits)

- Update and maintain the company website using WordPress (Elementor)

- Repurpose content across platforms to maximize reach

- Track performance metrics and suggest optimizations

- Stay organized and ensure deadlines are met consistently

- See projects through from concept to execution to completion



Required Skills & Experience

- Proven experience managing and executing social media for a brand or business

- Strong understanding of digital marketing strategy, not just posting



Experience with:

- Canva

- Video editing (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or similar)

- WordPress (Elementor specifically)

- SEO fundamentals (on-page SEO, keywords, metadata, blog optimization)

- Ability to follow brand guidelines while also offering thoughtful ideas

- Strong organizational and time-management skills

- Excellent written communication in English

- Comfortable working independently and taking ownership

- Experience executing content calendars without constant supervision



Nice-to-Have (But Not Required)

- Experience working with creative brands, luxury brands, or event/wedding based businesses

- Familiarity with Instagram analytics, Pinterest analytics, or similar tools

- Basic understanding of
 marketing or funnels



What We’re Looking For

This role is best suited for someone who:

- Thinks strategically but enjoys executing

- Takes initiative and ownership

- Is organized, proactive, and reliable

- Can manage multiple tasks without missing details

- Enjoys seeing projects through from start to finish

- Is open to feedback and committed to high-quality work



Trial Period

Final candidates will be invited to participate in a paid 7-day trial involving clearly defined tasks. This allows both sides to confirm fit, communication style, and working rhythm before moving forward.



How to Apply

Please include the following:

1. Provide a video (3 minutes or less) answering the following questions:

     - An introduction of yourself

     - If you are given a general goal (e.g. “increase inquiries derived from Instagram from 10 to 30 per month”) but no step-by-step instructions. Walk us through how you would approach this from planning to execution

     - What is your process to ensure the content your create matching the brand and audience of the brand you are working with?

     - How do you keep yourself organized and ensure tasks are completed on time when working remotely?

     - Describe your experience with video editing, Canva, SEO, and WordPress (Elementor)

2. Complete and submit this form:

title: Senior Tax Return Preparer (Part-Time, Year-Round)
description:
Senior U.S. Tax Return Preparer (Part-Time, Year-Round)



A U.S.-based tax firm is seeking an experienced Senior U.S. Tax Return Preparer to support individual and business tax preparation on a part-time, year-round basis.



This role is intended for a seasoned tax professional who can prepare returns independently, handle routine client communication, and work during U.S. business hours.



Key Responsibilities

• Prepare U.S. individual income tax returns (Form 1040) and related schedules

• Prepare U.S. business tax returns, including:

o Form 1120-S (S Corporations)

o Form 1120 (C Corporations)

o Form 1065 (Partnerships)

• Handle routine client communication, including follow-ups, document requests, and basic tax questions

• Ensure accuracy and compliance with current U.S. IRS regulations

• Follow firm workflows, documentation standards, and deadlines



Required Qualifications

• 5+ years of U.S. tax return preparation experience

• Strong experience with Forms 1040, 1120-S, 1120, and 1065

• Hands-on experience with CCH Axcess Tax (required — no training provided)

• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

• Strong attention to detail and professional written communication skills



Workload & Hours (Important)

• Year-round, part-time role with variable hours

• Typical range: approximately 5–25 hours per week

o Fewer hours outside tax season

o Increased hours during tax season (approximately February–April)

• Candidates must be comfortable with fluctuating weekly workload



Availability & Compensation

• Ability to work during U.S. Eastern Time business hours

• Please include your hourly rate in your application

• Please confirm your weekly availability, especially during tax season



Position Details

• Fully remote

• Part-time, year-round

• Long-term opportunity as the firm continues to grow



How to Apply:

Please
 the following all together to: 



Please include all of the following with your application:

1. Resume

2. A brief self-introduction video (2–3 minutes preferred)

3. Your hourly rate

4. A summary of your tax return preparation experience, including the types of returns you prepare (1040, 1120-S, 1120, 1065)

5. Your experience with CCH Axcess Tax (years used, level of responsibility)



Applications missing any of the above information may not be reviewed.

title: MEDICAL FRONT OFFICE ADMINISTRATOR
description:
Full-Time | 40 hours/week | 8:00 AM–5:00 PM EST (required) Location: Philippines (remote)



About Us Atlanta Lactation is a warm, all-female U.S. healthcare team working with moms and babies. Our team works exclusively with breastfeeding mothers, and we are looking for someone who will thrive in that environment.

We are a fully remote practice with 10 office locations, serving families across metro Atlanta and beyond through home visits, telehealth, and in-office appointments. We also help families access breast pumps and breastfeeding supplies.

Our communication style is kind, informal, and clear. We value consistency, long-term relationships, and collaboration with a hands-on owner who is easy to work with.



Why This Role Is Worth Your Attention

 - You'll work directly with a supportive owner — not through layers of management

 - Real autonomy and trust once trained

 - A friendly, supportive team that genuinely likes working together

 - Meaningful work helping families during one of the most vulnerable times in their lives

 - We support breastfeeding moms — including our own tea
mbers

 - The work is fast-paced and the days fly by

 - Pay increases available based on performance and longevity

 - This is a challenging role. It's complex, detail-heavy, and requires strong judgment. But if you like staying busy, solving logistics puzzles, and helping people — you'll love it.



ROLE SUMMARY

We are hiring one Front Office Administrator to handle patient communication, appointment booking, intake tracking, and provider scheduling.



A key part of the job is routing home visit appointments. You'll use Google Maps to evaluate patient addresses, compare drive times, and build efficient daily routes for multiple IBCLCs (lactation consultants) traveling across metro Atlanta.



This role requires native-level English clarity, accent, pronunciation, strong judgment, and comfort working in a high-volume clinical setting.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Communications in Spruce: Manage inbound calls, texts, and messages

 - Scheduling in IntakeQ/PracticeQ: Schedule home, office, and telehealth appointments IntakeQ/PracticeQ following established workflows and insurance rules

 - Google Maps to route home visits efficiently:

...Enter addresses accurately

...Compare drive times and geographic proximity

...Fit appointments logically around existing visits

...Prevent backtracking and build efficient daily routes

...Reassign or escalate when routing is unclear

 - Build cohesive, accurate schedules for multiple IBCLCs across 10+ locations

 - Track patient intake form completion and flag for billing team the patients needing insurance verification

 - Explain basic insurance coverage to families (copays, coverage status, next steps)

 - Communicate with families warmly, clearly, and professionally

 - Identify urgent messages and escalate appropriately

 - Maintain high accuracy and attention to detail

 - Uphold HIPAA compliance and protect patient confidentiality



SCHEDULE

Full-time, 40 hours/week

Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM Eastern Time (1-hour lunch)



TRAINING AND ONBOARDING

- Expect ~4 weeks of training before working independently

 - Training timeline is flexible with additional weeks available for training if needed — this is a complex role and we want you to feel confident

 - You will have ongoing support even after training



TIME OFF AND HOLIDAYS

 - Paid Christmas, New Year's Day, U.S. Thanksgiving off. We typically work the other US Holidays

 - Unpaid time off for Philippines holidays available with advance notice

 - We are understanding and flexible when tea
mbers are sick



SKILLS AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

 - Native-level English clarity and accent

 - Strong spatial reasoning and mapping ability (comfortable using Google Maps for routing decisions)

 - High accuracy with addresses and geographic comparison

 - Strong organizational skills and comfort with fast-paced workflows

 - Reliable judgment and ability to learn complex scheduling and insurance procedures

 - Tech-savvy with ability to navigate multiple systems simultaneously

 - Stable internet connection, quiet workspace, noise cancelling headset



EXPERIENCE

 - Prior experience working with a U.S. medical practice as healthcare VA or medical front office background

 - Basic understanding of U.S. insurance (copays, coinsurance, referrals, coverage distinctions) 

 - EMR experience

 - Dispatching, routing, or field-service scheduling experience strongly preferred

 - Experience supporting clinicians who perform home or mobile visits strongly preferred



COMPENSATION

 - Hourly Rate: Starting at up to $7.00 USD/hour, based on experience and English proficiency

 - Approximate Monthly (40 hrs/week): Up to $1,213 USD/month

 - 13th Month Pay: Provided (pro-rated during first year)

 - Pay increases available based on performance, typically reviewed after 90 days and annually



HOW TO APPLY

 - Please apply through OnlineJobs.ph only and include:

 - Links for your most current resume and 1-minute voice introduction message or video introduction sharing why you think you're a good fit

 - Your available start date

 - Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered

title: Outbound Sales Call Representative
description:
NOW HIRING: Sales Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation & Appointment Setting)

Remote – Philippines-Based | Supporting U.S. Sales Team (MST Hours)



High Valley Enterprises is looking for a motivated, organized, and results-driven Sales Virtual Assistant based in the Philippines to support our growing sales team in the United States. This role is focused on lead generation, cold calling, and setting qualified appointments for our Mountain Standard Time (MST) sales representatives.



We are seeking someone who is confident on the phone, experienced in sales outreach, and skilled at working through large geographic areas in an organized and strategic way.



HOURS & SCHEDULE:

• Calls must be made between 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM Mountain Standard Time (MST)

• Monday–Saturday work schedule

• No calls on Sundays

• This schedule will require night shift hours in the Philippines



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Make outbound cold calls to potential customers across targeted U.S. regions

• Generate and organize leads using available tools and systems

• Set qualified appointments for U.S.-based sales representatives

• Track calls, contacts, and results in an organized and consistent manner

• Work through assigned territories in a structured and methodical way

• Communicate regularly with the sales team regarding scheduled appointments and lead quality



REQUIREMENTS:

• Minimum 1+ year of outbound sales call experience (required)

• Strong English communication skills with a clear, confident phone presence

• Experience with cold calling and appointment setting

• Experience with lead generation tools and research methods

• Ability to target and work through large areas in an organized and efficient manner

• Self-motivated, dependable, and comfortable working independently

• Strong organization and follow-through skills



PREFERRED QUALITIES:

• Experience supporting U.S.-based sales teams

• Familiarity with CRM systems and lead tracking tools

• Consistent performance in meeting call or appointment-setting goals



This role is essential in helping our team grow by creating opportunities and setting high-quality appointments for our sales representatives in the field.



Please apply directly through OnlineJobs.ph and include details about your sales experience, lead generation tools you’ve used, and your background in cold calling and appointment setting.

title: Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.











B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.







You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

Can take payments through Wise

PH or similar time zone



$300/month + bonuses for 2-3h a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video: 



Google drive:







Please complete the following steps:

- Download the files and import into your video editing software

- Find the “good” takes of the footage and stitch together seamlessly 

- Add overlays and additional effects to the edited footage

- Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing (duration of each scene), cropping, etc.

- Message me with a link to the re-created video

title: WordPress SEO Website Developer
description:
About the Role



We build high-converting local service websites that rank in Google Maps and generate inbound calls for home service businesses across the U.S.



You will be responsible for deploying, designing, and optimizing WordPress websites using proven templates that we reuse across multiple cities and industries (emergency services, HVAC, restoration, roofing, etc.).



This is a production-focused role where speed, accuracy, and SEO structure matter more than creative freelancing.



Your Mission



Build and launch SEO-optimized local service websites that:



Load fast



Convert visitors into calls



Follow local SEO best practices



Match our ranking framework



You will not be guessing — you will follow structured systems and checklists.



Key Responsibilities

Website Deployment



Install and configure WordPress sites



Use page builders (Elementor / similar)



Deploy template-based service websites quickly



Optimize layouts for mobile-first performance



Graphics & Visual Work



Create simple but professional service graphics



Optimize images for speed



Add icons, trust badges, and visual conversion elements



SEO Implementation



Set title tags and meta descriptions



Implement heading structures (H1–H3)



Add schema markup



Optimize internal linking



Upload geo-tagged images



Structure service pages + location pages



Conversion Optimization



Place call buttons correctly



Implement CTA blocks



Ensure phone numbers are clickable



Add trust signals



Technical Optimization



Improve page speed



Optimize Core Web Vitals



Compress images



Configure caching plugins



Required Skills



Strong WordPress experience



Elementor or similar builder proficiency



Understanding of on-page SEO



Basic graphic design skills (Canva / Photoshop)



Experience optimizing page speed



Ability to follow structured systems



Nice to Have



Local SEO experience



Schema implementation knowledge



Experience building lead generation websites



Understanding of Google ranking factors



Performance Expectations



You will be expected to:



Launch 3–5 complete websites per week



Maintain quality and SEO standards



Follow SOPs precisely



Work efficiently with minimal supervision



Who This Role is NOT For



Designers focused only on aesthetics



Developers who move slowly



Freelancers who prefer unstructured work



Why This is a Great Opportunity



You will be part of a growing international SEO company building a network of digital properties. Stable work, long-term growth, and consistent projects.

title: CRM & Data Support Virtual Assistant
description:
We are an Australian based real estate marketing and automation agency seeking a CRM & Data Support role. This role focuses on data collection,  lead research, plus routine admin and CRM hygiene to keep our systems organised and accurate.



I’m looking for someone who is detail-oriented, follows processes carefully, and completes tasks end-to-end with minimal supervision.



Key responsibilities

- Lead research and list building (real estate focus): agents, principals, property owners, suburbs, addresses

- Data enrichment: adding missing details, verifying contact information, removing duplicates, standardising formats

- CRM hygiene: tagging, pipeline updates, contact clean-up, importing/exporting CSVs, and basic quality checks

- Research tasks: accurate information gathering with clear notes and sources

- Admin support: maintaining naming conventions, file organisation, and updating tracking sheets



How we work (non-negotiables)

- You can work independently and follow instructions precisely

- You check existing SOPs/processes before asking questions

- You work inside our tools: Notion, Google Drive, Slack and GoHighLevel

- You communicate clearly and ask specific questions when clarification is needed (with context)



You provide daily updates:

- Start of Day (SOD): what you will work on

- End of Day (EOD): what you completed, links, results, and blockers

- Time tracking is accurate and recorded at a task level



Quality standards

- 90%+ error-free work consistently

- Strong attention to detail (names, addresses, phone numbers, formatting)

- Tasks completed fully before submission

- Quick self-check before submitting work



What success looks like

- You use a standard checklist for repeat tasks

- You identify and report issues early (duplicates, missing data, unclear requirements)

- You suggest improvements that increase speed or accuracy (without changing core processes without approval)



Requirements

- Experience in lead research, data collection, list building, or data enrichment

- Strong English comprehension and clear written updates

- Reliable computer and internet connection

- Confidence using Google Workspace apps: Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail

- Experience with GoHighLevel or real estate



Trial step

- Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid trial assignment so I can assess accuracy, speed, and how well you follow instructions and report results.

title: Amazon Marketplace Operations VA
description:
Role overview

We are a multi-channel consumer packaged goods ecommerce brand with Amazon as our primary revenue driver. We are hiring an Amazon Marketplace Operations VA to own day-to-day Amazon execution, protect revenue, and continuously improve listing performance.

This role is part-time to start and is ideal for someone who is comfortable operating inside Amazon Seller Central, enjoys improving systems, and knows how to use data and tools to make listings perform better over time.



What you’ll own day one



Amazon operations

Day-to-day management of Amazon Seller Central

Listing maintenance, variation management, and SKU hygiene

Case management and follow-through (inventory issues, listing issues, reimbursements)

Inbound shipment support and inventory coordination



Listing optimization and performance

Use Helium 10 to improve keyword coverage and search visibility

Identify indexing issues, keyword gaps, and listing red flags

Support conversion improvements through:

Title and bullet refinements

Backend keyword optimization

Image sequencing and listing structure feedback

Track listing changes and monitor performance impact



Amazon ads support

Monitor PPC performance regularly

Make careful, incremental optimizations without breaking winning campaigns

Pull reports and surface insights clearly



Revenue protection and profitability

Proactively track lost or damaged inventory

File and follow Amazon reimbursement cases through resolution

Maintain basic SKU-level profitability snapshots and flag issues



Reporting

Pull and organize monthly reports from Amazon and other sales channels

Consolidate data into clean, reliable spreadsheets



How this role can grow

As the core Amazon foundation stabilizes, this role can expand into:

Supporting other marketplaces (Shopify, Walmart, Etsy, TikTok Shop, 
)

Coordinating freelancers for listing images and A+ content

Assisting with international Amazon marketplaces (UK, Germany)

Taking on broader ecommerce operations ownership





What we’re looking for

Prior hands-on experience managing Amazon Seller Central

Strong working knowledge of Helium 10

Experience improving listings for both search visibility and conversion

Comfort with spreadsheets and reporting

Clear communication and strong follow-through



Nice to have (not required)

International Amazon experience

Experience managing freelancers

Looker Studio familiarity

SOP documentation mindset

title: Creator Community Success Manager
description:
Company Overview

The client runs a creator-led growth business that helps consumer brands scale through storytelling, creator partnerships, and social commerce. The business works closely with creators, especially moms and lifestyle creators, turning them into long-term partners, case studies, and revenue drivers for brands.

This role supports the creator side of the business, ensuring creators are onboarded, activated, supported, and retained without the founder becoming the bottleneck.



Core Responsibilities (Primary Focus)

1. Creator Onboarding and Setup

Onboard creators as official partners once they say “yes”

Ensure creators are properly set up across platforms, including:

Amazon Influencer Storefronts

Instagram Creator Marketplace or brand partnership tools

Confirm creators have the correct links, assets, briefs, and tracking

Make sure nothing stalls after a verbal agreement

Track onboarding status so creators do not fall through the cracks



2. Creator Enablement and Coordination

Act as the day-to-day point of contact for active creators

Coordinate campaigns, drops, collaborations, or charity initiatives

Communicate timelines, expectations, and deliverables clearly

Follow up on missing assets, late deliverables, or stalled communication

Help turn top creators into repeatable case studies or training examples



3. Community Engagement and Retention

Maintain a consistent, supportive presence inside the creator community

Encourage participation, progress, and 
ntum

Help creators reach early wins (first post, first sale, first campaign)

Identify creators who are stalled and proactively re-engage them

Support community events, AMAs, or live sessions with coordination and follow-up



4. Internal Follow-Through and Leverage

Own creator-related follow-ups so the founder is not the bottleneck

Keep creator initiatives moving even when leadership is busy

Maintain simple trackers for:

Creator status

Active campaigns

Outstanding tasks or blockers

Surface patterns, questions, or friction points to leadership



Growth Responsibility (Nice-to-Have, Trained Over Time)

5. Creator Outreach (Secondary, Trained)

Learn and execute a repeatable creator outreach process

Support outreach across platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, and creator communities

Use provided scripts, systems, and tracking

Gradually help source new creators to bring into the ecosystem



Required Skills and Traits

Strong written communication and follow-through

Highly organized and comfortable tracking multiple moving pieces

Warm, professional, and confident working with creators

Comfortable nudging people, following up, and keeping things moving

Able to work independently with light direction

Comfortable in an early-stage, evolving environment



Nice to Have

Experience working with creators, affiliates, or influencers

Familiarity with Amazon Influencer, Instagram partnerships, or affiliate models

Light outreach or partnership coordination experience

Basic understanding of ecommerce or brand collaborations

Some Social media management experience may translate to additional work

light canva graphics support for presentations, hand outs, simple posts

title: GoHighLevel Expert Needed
description:

Project Overview



This funnel includes:



1 main sales page

2 upsells (OTO #1 and OTO #2)

Stripe checkout

Correct upsell logic

Custom domain connection

Basic workflows set up correctly



You must be comfortable building multi-step funnels in GoHighLevel and ensuring everything works cleanly from start to finish.



Scope of Work



Build 1 long-form sales page in GoHighLevel

Build 2 post-purchase upsell pages

Set up Stripe integration

Configure upsell / downsell logic correctly

Connect and verify a custom domain

Ensure all buttons, links, and CTAs route properly

Set up basic workflows (purchase confirmation, access delivery)



Ensure full mobile responsiveness



Apply light styling to match provided design references

This is an execution-only role. Strategy, copy, and visual direction will be provided.

Final, approved copy for all pages

Visual assets and design references

Clear, section-by-section layout instructions

Funnel flow and upsell logic



You will not be expected to create copy or strategy.



What I’m Looking For



You are a good fit only if you:

Have proven experience building funnels in GoHighLevel

Are comfortable with domains, Stripe, and workflows

Have a good eye for layout (spacing, hierarchy, contrast)

Pay close attention to details (buttons, links, logic)

Build funnels that work correctly the first time

Communicate clearly and proactively



I’m looking for someone who can own the build, not hand it back partially finished.

Not ongoing support (unless agreed later)



Budget

You can execute cleanly with minimal revisions



Please do not apply if this budget does not work for you.



Future Opportunities



If this project goes well:



There will be additional funnels

Optimization and iteration work

Potential long-term collaboration



I value reliability and clean execution and prefer to work with the same person repeatedly.

title: Part-time Bookkeeper
description:
Who We Are -



Hello; my name is Casandra Armstrong and I am the President of Carrington Tax & Accounting Services. We are an accounting and tax firm based out of Phoenix, AZ (United States). 



We are a small, but growing company and are experiencing quite a bit of growth.  This has pushed the need for us to hire you, our newest tea
mber.   



We help small businesses, just like ours, maintain, manage, and grow their businesses by ensuring accurate financials, processing payroll for their employees, tax preparation and strategy. We ensure we can take as much off the owner’s plate as possible while building trust within our working relationships. 



You’re probably wondering if you would be our first Filipino tea
mber? 



Actually, no. We currently have 4 tea
mbers who are from the Philippines like yourself.  We have 3 bookkeeping specialist and a tax specialist that are based in the Philippines as well. In addition to them, our operation manager and payroll specialist are US based. 

 

If you’re wondering what you would be doing? 



The job title is Bookkeeping Specialist.  I am looking for someone who can perform detailed bookkeeping for several small business clients well as assist in payroll processing. Your primary duties as a bookkeeper would include document processing, data entry, account reconciliation, ledger management, and financial report processing. Your duties as a payroll assistant will include assisting our payroll manager with designated assignments, client follow up for approvals, processing after deadline, as well as report management. Because we are a small business, we all assist each other in departments. We are QuickBooks based, so a QuickBooks background is required. However, we will also train on processes. 



 

So, why should you join us over anyone and everyone else? 



If you would like… 

1) a steady pay check with the chance for bonuses based on performance,  

2) the opportunity to work from home without a boss breathing down your neck,  

3) a team environment where you work with others to share the work, and  

4 ) if you want to work for a stable, growing U.S. firm,

…then this is a job you will enjoy and excel at. 

 

Are we for real? 



You don’t have to take my word for it.  



Here is what Emmely says about working on the team: 





Here is what Miraluna thinks about working with us:





And finally, Julie’s opinion of us:





 

How to know if you’re qualified for this opportunity? 



We are looking for someone who has bookkeeping experience, complete understanding of debits and credits, assets and liabilties, inter-company transfers, problem solving skills, fluent in English speaking and writing with the experience of speaking directly with US clients, and most importantly someone who can work with little to no direction and meet deadlines. We do not expect you to know it all as we will train you in your position with everything you need to know about our clients and our field for you to be able to excel at your job.  



I do need you to be a good leader- someone who can effectively manage him or herself at the job as well as manage others; someone who has extensive attention to detail, can manage and meet deadlines, follow processes and provide ideas for enhanced processes, problem solve and troubleshoot on their with little to no direction, handle client payroll emergency’s or last minute requests, be able to effectively resolve issues with upset clients. Intermiediate bookkeeping/accounting experience, and QuickBooks experience is required. 



I also cannot teach you to have a good attitude and to be self-motivated.  These are things you must demonstrate in the interview process.  



A successful applicant must be able to demonstrate: 



* A can do attitude, and the ability to work without constant supervision 

* Be able to speak in conversational English and write in passable English as well  

* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Dropbox, QuickBooks, and general ability to use windows based software  

* Have or be willing to obtain Internet fast enough to allow for virtual meeting such as zoom and VOIP phone calls without degradation 

* Working microphone and Internet video camera 

* Workstation with 2 monitors

 

So, what are the working hours? 



As I stated before, our company is based in Phoenix, Arizona so we would require you to work during the US business hours, Monday to Friday 8:00pm to 5:00pm Arizona Time 



Although this position is currently part-time, we are looking for someone with the ability to go full-time when needed or work additional hours during busy times. Full-time is expected within 12 months of being hired but is not guaranteed. 



What about pay?



We are serious about hiring someone and are looking to fill this position ASAP.  I also want this to be a real job that can meet your financial needs.  Therefore, pay is negotiable but know I want you to be happy and satisfied working here, and a good pay scale is part of that.

 

What about the 13th Month? 



Wondering if we pay the 13th month?  Unfortunately, we do not. However, we do offer other benefits such as pay time off, holiday pay, and sick time for Full-Time positions. These benefits begin to accrue after your 90 days probation period of a full-time position. 

 

What happens next? 



Since our jobs are so popular we generally get deluged with applicants.  So, I have designed a multi-part interview process to make the process as simple and efficient for all parties.  

 

The first part of the interview process is designed to examine your English-speaking & writing skills, personality type, internet speed and ability to follow directions.  Please realize the initial application process will take a time commitment on your part of roughly 10-20 minutes.  Since this job is intended to be well paying, I hope this time commitment is acceptable to you.  Please be advised that those who submit incomplete applications will be passed over.



If you make it through this first round, we will talk via video chat to answer any questions you may have as well as get to know you better. If this goes well, I will invite you to meet some other tea
mbers, as well as call your references to see if there is still a good fit.



We will then ultimately hire someone.





How to Apply 



Therefore, to submit your application for the job, please complete all of the following and
 them to me at the reply to
 address provided for this ad or 
 if the other
 address is down.



1. Please send me all the following to emmely at carringtontax dot com

a. Your resume

b. Link to your onlinejobs.ph profile and,

c. Names with your relationship for 3 people I can contact whom would say good things about working with you. This could be a priest, former employer, bank manager, school teacher, but no more than 1 of these people can be a family member.



2. Please also complete the tests at the following link and provide a copy of your results:









Please be advised that incomplete applications will be ignored. I know this sounds harsh, but this is a detailed job and I need to know you can follow directions.

Eventually manage callers, texting, and lead flow

Truly learn the real estate investing industry



???? Daily Performance Expectations (Non-Negotiable)

You will be expected to consistently hit:

1,000+ dials per day

100+ real conversations per day

2–3 qualified leads per day

This is a high-activity, high-accountability role.

If those numbers scare you — do not apply.



???? What Makes You a Fit (Very Important)

You MUST have:

Strong English communication (clear, confident, professional)

Ability to handle objections calmly (angry sellers, confusion, skepticism)

Comfort improvising when scripts don’t fit the situation

Strong problem-solving instincts

Extreme attention to detail

Willingness to take ownership of results

We’ve had issues in the past with people who:

Freeze when something unexpected happens

Only complete assigned tasks and stop

Need constant supervision

Avoid responsibility

We are intentionally filtering those people out.



???? Growth, Leadership & Culture

This is not a dead-end position.

If you perform:

You will grow into a Senior Caller

Then into a Team Lead / Manager

Then into training and managing future hires

Potentially overseeing texting, lead management, and operations

We believe in:

Internal promotion

Training leaders

Building long-term careers

A team culture built on growth, accountability, and mutual respect

We want people who want to change their life, not just clock in.



???? Compensation

Competitive base pay $5.00/ Hour

Performance-based bonuses - Closed deal bonuses, performance incentives, etc.

Raises tied to results and leadership, not tenure

Top performers earn more and grow faster.



? Final Filter (Read Carefully)

Do NOT apply if:

You are afraid of rejection

You dislike cold calling

You only want a short-term job

You need to be micromanaged

You are not interested in leadership

Apply ONLY if you are:

Hungry

Coachable

Confident

Driven

Ready to be great



???? How to Apply (Important)

To apply, send:

A short written introduction explaining why you want this role

A 1–2 minute voice recording answering:

“Why would you be one of the best cold callers on our team?”

“Where do you want to be in your career in 2–3 years?”

Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.

title: Quality Control Specialist - Real Estate Media ($7/hr - Detail-Oriented)
description:
QUALITY CONTROL SPECIALIST - REAL ESTATE MEDIA



About Us:

We're a rapidly growing real estate media company serving professional agents in the US market. We pride ourselves on fast delivery and exceptional quality through systematic workflows.



The Role:

We're looking for a detail-obsessed Quality Control Specialist who LOVES catching errors that others miss. This is NOT a creative editing role - this is systematic quality checking with minor photo editing.



Your job: Upload media from dropbox for edit, review edited property photos, catch every small detail (trash cans, crooked angles, blown highlights, etc.), make necessary corrections, and ensure perfect delivery to clients.



What Makes This Role Different:

- This is systematic, repetitive work - you'll follow the exact same process 30+ times per month

- We value ACCURACY over speed - perfection is the standard

- You'll work independently during graveyard shift (12pm-8pm US Central)

- Checklist-based workflows - we have documented processes for everything

- Long-term stability - quality control won't be automated anytime soon



What You'll Do Daily:

- Review processed property photos for quality issues

- Check every photo systematically using detailed QC checklist (verticals, white balance, unwanted objects, exposure, etc.)

- Make corrections in photo editing software when needed

- Upload final images to client delivery platform

- Track orders and schedule deliveries

- Flag any issues that need escalation



You're a Great Fit If You:

? Actually ENJOY repetitive, systematic work (not bored by routine)

? Take pride in catching small details others miss

? Prefer following established processes over "creative freedom"

? Are more interested in perfection than finishing fast

? Like working independently without constant interaction

? Want a stable, long-term role (2+ years)



You're NOT a Good Fit If You:

? Need variety and creative challenges

? Prefer speed over accuracy

? Get bored doing the same process repeatedly

? Need lots of social interaction

? Want to "improve" or change established processes



Requirements:

- 2+ years experience in real estate photo editing OR e-commerce product photo QC

- US real estate market experience strongly preferred

- Advanced Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom skills, or similar softwares

- Experience with cloud-based delivery platforms (HDPhotoHub, Aryeo, or similar)

- Comfortable with photo editing workflows

- Internet: 100+ Mbps upload speed with backup connection

- Equipment: Reliable computer, quiet workspace

- Schedule: Available 12pm-8pm US Central Time

- English: Professional written communication (B2+ level)



What We Offer:

- Pay: $7/hour (significantly above market for detail-focused work)

- Hours: 15-20 hours/week initially, potential to grow to 40 hours/week

- Schedule: Graveyard shift premium rate

- Growth: As we scale your hours increase

- Stability: Long-term role with growing company

- Training: Comprehensive onboarding with documented processes

- Tools: We provide access to all necessary software platforms



Compensation Structure:

Starting at 15-20 hours per week at $7/hour. As business grows, hours increase proportionally. Opportunity to transition to per-project compensation once fully trained and efficient (higher effective hourly rate as you gain efficiency).



---



APPLICATION QUESTIONS (CRITICAL - DO NOT SKIP):



Please answer ALL questions thoroughly. One-word or vague answers will not be considered.



1. DETAIL-ORIENTATION

Tell us about a specific time you caught a small error that others had missed. What was the error, how did you spot it, and what was the impact if you hadn't caught it?



2. REPETITIVE WORK MINDSET

This role involves doing the exact same QC process 30-40 times per month. How do you feel about highly repetitive, systematic work? Be honest - this helps us both find the right fit.



3. QUALITY CONTROL CHECKLIST

Describe your quality control process step-by-step. What specific things do you check for in each photo before delivering to a client? (List at least 6-8 specific items)



4. REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE

Describe your real estate photography experience:

- How many years?

- What market(s)?

- Typical volume per day/week/month?

- Types of properties?



5. TECHNICAL SETUP

- Internet upload speed: ___ Mbps (test at 
)

- Backup internet available? (Yes/No)

- Computer specs: ___



6. PROBLEM-SOLVING APPROACH

You're reviewing a property and notice an issue you haven't seen before. Walk us through your exact process for handling this - step by step.



7. LEARNING NEW TOOLS

How do you approach learning new editing tools and softwares?



8. WORK STYLE ASSESSMENT

Answer honestly (we want the real you):

- On a scale of 1-10, how much do you ENJOY finding small errors in photos? (1 = hate it, 10 = love it)

- On a scale of 1-10, how comfortable are you with doing the same task repeatedly? (1 = need variety, 10 = prefer routine)

- On a scale of 1-10, how important is speed vs. accuracy to you? (1 = speed matters most, 10 = accuracy matters most)



9. AVAILABILITY & COMMITMENT

- Earliest start date: ___

- Are you comfortable working Philippines graveyard shift long-term (1-2+ years)?

- Do you have any other work commitments that would



10. PORTFOLIO & PROOF

- Link to your real estate photo editing portfolio (before/after examples preferred)

- OnlineJobs.ph DISC assessment (please complete if you haven't already - takes 10 minutes)

- Internet speed test screenshot or link



---



IMPORTANT NOTES:

- We will request DISC personality assessment before interviews

- Proprietary workflows and tools shared only with hired candidate

- NDA required before training begins



This is a long-term opportunity for the right person. If you love systematic processes, catching details, and take pride in perfect work, we want to hear from you.

title: Guest Experience Director - Sierra Sol Elevated Stays
description:
Our Guest Experience Director leads the heart of our hospitality operation. You coach and support our Guest Experience Virtual Agents, champion our elevated standards, and ensure every guest and homeowner interaction reflects the warmth, attentiveness, and care Sierra Sol Elevated Stays is known for.



You’ll oversee daily workflows, maintain quality across all communication channels, lead escalations with empathy and confidence, and help shape a culture of hospitality excellence. This is a leadership role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and takes pride in creating elevated experiences for guests and homeowners.



You are a core part of our leadership team, not an outsourced call center supervisor. Your leadership brings our Elevated Promises to life every day.



The Guest Experience team will own:

• Proactive outreach and warm guest engagement that drives five-star stays

• Guest messaging and phone communication

• Workorder coordination and task follow-through

• Cleaning scheduling and day-to-day coordination with our local team and vendors



Working Hours

Our Guest Experience team will provide live coverage from 7:00am to 11:00pm Mountain Time (MDT), 9:00pm to 1:00pm Philippines Time (PHT). Each tea
mber will be assigned a consistent shift. On-call after-hour coverage (11:00pm-7:00am MDT) will be handled by an on-call rotation (separate from daily shift expectations).



As the leader for the Guest Experience team, you will work a consistent schedule aligned to our coverage windows (7:00am-11:00pm MDT) and be available for escalations during peak periods and coverage during tea
mber PTO. We will set your core hours based on the final team schedule.



Compensation and Incentives (Direct Hire)

• Base pay: $900-$1,100 USD per month (full-time, based on experience, leadership capability, and hospitality/STR background)

• Internet/tech allowance: $20 per month

• 13th month pay: Provided in December (prorated for partial years)

• Monthly Bonus: Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool (based on team review quality + individual SLA performance)

• PTO: Accrues at 1.25 paid days per month (usable after 90 days; no annual rollover)



Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool

We keep the bonus simple, measurable, and tied directly to delivering elevated guest experiences.

• Pool funding: $2.00 USD for every 5-star review received during the month.

• Quality gate: Pool funded only if the monthly average rating is 4.85+ and the review rate is 80%+.

• Distribution: The funded pool is divided equally among the Guest Experience Tea
mbers.

• Eligibility: You receive your share when monthly SLA and performance standards are met. Shares are not redistributed from non-eligible members.

• Leadership role: As the Guest Experience Director, you're responsible for supporting the team in achieving these monthly goals.



Location

These roles are fully remote within the Philippines. However, we are building our core Guest Experience team in Cebu City, and applicants located in Cebu City or nearby areas are strongly preferred.

Concentrating our team locally helps us work more closely, support one another, and build the kind of connected, collaborative culture that lets us deliver truly elevated hospitality. It also allows for optional in-person training sessions, tea
etups, and shared learning opportunities.

Exceptional candidates from other regions will still be considered.



Role and Responsibilities:



Champion the Elevated Promises (Quality & Standards)

• Lead by example in delivering warm, proactive, responsive guest communication.

• Review message threads and calls to ensure tone, clarity, accuracy, and elevated hospitality.

• Coach the team to uphold Sierra Sol’s elevated standards in every interaction.

• Support the team in meeting SLAs and monthly quality goals tied to our 5-Star Bonus Pool.

• Demonstrate calm, empathetic communication during escalations and model elevated hospitality under pressure.



Team Leadership & Coaching

• Provide daily support and real-time guidance to Guest Experience Agents.

• Run weekly 1:1s focused on tone, communication, efficiency, and problem-solving.

• Provide shadowing, feedback, and continuous coaching.

• Help build a positive, supportive team culture rooted in hospitality, care, and growth.

• Oversee shift scheduling and ensure full coverage across peak periods (including weekends).



Guest Experience & Operations

• Monitor queues, ticket volume, and coverage to ensure fast and warm responses.

• Solve escalated issues with confidence, empathy, and well-considered judgment.

• Ensure smooth handoffs and detailed documentation for local field teams.

• Own quality control across guest communication, workorder clarity, and task follow-through.

• Support the team in delivering concierge-level stays across all markets.



Property Listing Management & OTA Updates

• Oversee and quality-check all property listings in Guesty and across all OTAs (Airbnb, Vrbo, 
, etc.).

• Ensure every listing is accurate, consistent, and reflects our elevated hospitality standards.

• Lead seasonal updates: amenities, photos, descriptions, policies, access notes, and market-specific highlights.

• Audit listings regularly for clarity, tone, accuracy, and brand alignment.

• Work with Agents to correct gaps, improve listing quality, and add new information from inspections, field reports, or homeowner updates.

• Partner with leadership to optimize listing content for search visibility, guest clarity, and better pre-arrival communication.

• Ensure every property description enhances the guest journey, reduces friction, and helps set the expectation for a five-star stay.



Local Knowledge & Expertise

• Own the knowledge base for all New Mexico homes and markets: Santa Fe, Taos, Angel Fire, and Red River.

• Maintain deep understanding of seasonal rhythms, weather and road impacts, and guest expectations unique to each area.

• Stay up to date on restaurants, local events, activities, and experiences to ensure the team can provide personalized, concierge-level recommendations.

• Ensure the Guest Experience team knows home layouts, amenities, quirks, access instructions, and “good to know” details through Matterport walkthroughs and photo reviews.



Tools, Systems, and Processes

• Become an expert in Guesty, Breezeway, RingCentral, and internal SOP systems.

• Coach the team on efficient, accurate, consistent use of all tools.

• Identify workflow gaps and propose improvements that strengthen the guest journey and team performance.

• Provide weekly reporting on SLAs, trends, and opportunities

• Identify recurring issues and implement practical improvements to reduce friction and improve reviews



Manager Success Measures

• The guest journey feels warm, seamless, and elevated.

• Message response times and phone SLAs are consistently met (messages within 15 minutes; calls within 30 seconds).

• The team feels supported, confident, and connected.

• Escalations are handled calmly and resolved with care.

• Workorders and tasks are clear, complete, and closed-loop. No missed workorders.

• Monthly average rating stays above 4.85+ with review rate above 80%+.

• The team embodies Sierra Sol’s elevated hospitality every day.

• A team culture that feels like hospitality, not a help desk.

• Comfortable leading day-to-day operations inside Guesty, Breezeway, and RingCentral.



How to apply

Please submit the following:

• Resume/CV

• 3-minute video recording introducing yourself and describing your leadership style and experience

• Speedtest.net result (screenshot)

• Short written samples: How would you respond or lead in the following situations?

1) A guest arrives on a Saturday evening and messages: “The house is freezing and we can’t figure out the heater. Also, the place doesn’t look clean.”

2) One of your Guest Experience Agents has been missing response-time SLAs on weekends and seems overwhelmed. How would you approach this as their manager?

3) These three issues come in at the same time: (1) “We can’t get into the home, the door code isn’t working.” (2) A cleaner calls to say they’ll be 30 minutes late for a turn. (3) “There’s a leak under the kitchen sink.” In what order would you address them, and why?

Suggested
 subject line: "Guest Experience Director - [Your Name]"

title: Website Developer
description:
Job Title: WordPress Website Developer (Execution-Focused)



Job Type: Part-Time / Per Project (Potential for Ongoing Work)



Job Overview:

We are a growing marketing agency looking for a reliable WordPress Website Developer to build websites based on detailed video instructions. You will not be responsible for strategy or design direction — we will provide step-by-step walkthrough videos showing exactly how each site should be built. Your role is to execute efficiently and accurately.



Responsibilities:



Build WordPress websites based on provided video instructions



Set up pages, themes, and plugins as directed



Ensure sites are responsive (mobile-friendly)



Follow layout, spacing, and formatting guidelines precisely



Perform basic on-page setup (menus, images, links, etc.)



Test functionality before handoff



Requirements:



Strong understanding of WordPress (themes, plugins, page builders)



Experience building full websites in WordPress



Ability to follow detailed instructions exactly



Good attention to detail



Reliable communication and timely delivery



Basic understanding of website structure and layout



Preferred (Not Required):



Experience with Elementor or similar page builders



Basic knowledge of SEO structure (URLs, headings, image optimization)



Experience working with marketing agencies



Compensation:



Paid per project (rate depends on experience)



Opportunity for consistent ongoing work



To Apply:

Please send:



2–3 WordPress websites you have built



What page builders you are experienced with



Your expected rate per website

title: Walker Media Rockstar Internship Program (RIP)
description:
Non-Paid, Elite 4-Month Remote Internship | 10 Hours/Week | 



Limited Slots



Important—read this first:

This is a non-paid internship.



In fact, if this were packaged as a professional training program, you would normally pay to participate.



Why? Because what you gain here goes far beyond what most people get from:

- College classes

- Online courses

- Free tutorials

- Entry-level internships that keep you busy but don’t build credibility



This program is designed to give you real-world experience, professional proof of work, and agency-level training—the things employers actually care about.



Be honest—how long have you been applying with no success?

- Weeks?

- Months?

- Dozens (or hundreds) of applications with no replies?



If you’re capable, motivated, and willing to work—but keep getting ignored—this isn’t because you lack talent.



It’s because you lack verifiable professional experience and positioning.



That’s what this internship fixes.



Why This Internship Is Different



This is not an internship where you “help out” or wait to be told what to do.



This is a professional training ground where you:

- Work on real projects with real standards

- Learn how modern digital agencies actually operate

- Use AI strategically (not lazily or irresponsibly)

- Build proof of work you can confidently show employers



By the end of this program, you won’t just say:

“I learned this in school.”



You’ll say:

“Here’s what I built. Here’s how I think. Here’s the impact.”



That’s the difference between being overlooked and being taken seriously.



More Valuable Than Most College Classes (Here’s Why)

Most college courses:

- Teach theory, not execution

- Don’t expose you to real deadlines or standards

- Don’t prepare you for how work actually happens



This program:

- Trains you under an active media agency

- Forces you to think, deliver, and communicate professionally

- Gives you real experience, not simulated assignments

- Helps you graduate with confidence, clarity, and credibility

Many interns finish this program with more practical experience than years of coursework alone.



Who This Program Is For

This is for Filipinos who:

- Are tired of being “qualified but ignored”

- Want experience, not just certificates

- Are serious about long-term career growth

- Are coachable, disciplined, and dependable

- Want to stand out in agencies, corporate roles, or freelancing

- If you’re looking for easy money—this is not for you.

- If you’re looking to invest your time to change your trajectory—this might be exactly what you’ve been waiting for.



What You’ll Learn

- AI-powered strategy and content creation

- Social media & platform development

- Public relations and professional writing

- Business development fundamentals

- How to think like a professional—not a task-taker



All under the guidance of the Walker Media Leadership Team.



Program Details

Duration: 4 months

Time Commitment: 10 hours/week

- 2 hrs live training & meetings

- 4 hrs reading & guided journaling

- 4 hrs real-world practicum projects

Format: 100% remote

Acceptance: Very limited & competitive



The program ends with a virtual graduation, certificate, and portfolio-ready experience.



Learn More (Required Before Applying)

Full program details:





Please review carefully. This program is selective by design.



IMPORTANT – PROOF YOU READ THIS

To be considered, you must include this exact phrase at the top of your application message:

“I’m ready to invest my time to earn my place as a Walker Media Rockstar Intern.”

Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.



If you’ve been stuck waiting for someone to “give you a chance,” this program helps you earn one instead.



Apply intentionally. Show up seriously. Change your future.



************************************************

Frequently Asked Questions (Please Read Carefully)

Is this internship paid?



No. This is a non-paid internship.

However, this is not free labor. This is a structured, mentored professional training program.

If this experience were offered as a private professional accelerator or certification program, you would normally pay to participate. Instead, you are investing time and effort in exchange for:

- Real-world experience

- Professional proof of work

- Direct training under an active media agency

- Career-ready skills that employers actually value



Many participants finish with more practical experience than years of coursework alone.



Why would I join an unpaid internship?



Because experience is the currency that gets you hired.

Most people remain stuck because they:

- Have skills but no proof

- Have knowledge but no execution

- Have motivation but no positioning



This program gives you verifiable experience, structure, standards, and credibility—the things that move you from “applicant” to “top candidate.”



If you’re only looking for immediate income, this may not be the right fit.



If you’re focused on long-term career growth, this can be a turning point.



How much time does this really take each week?



The commitment is 10 hours per week:

2 hours – live virtual training & meetings

4 hours – reading and guided journaling

4 hours – real-world practicum projects



This is designed to be manageable alongside other responsibilities, but it does require consistency and discipline.



What if I already have a job or freelance work?



That’s fine—as long as you can honor the 10-hour weekly commitment and attend required live sessions.



We care less about what else you’re doing and more about:

- Reliability

- Preparation

-Follow-through



Missed meetings, late work, or inconsistent effort will not be tolerated.



What are the expectations during the program?



You are expected to:

- Show up on time and prepared

- Communicate professionally

- Meet deadlines without excuses

- Accept feedback and apply it

- Protect confidential information



This program operates with agency-level standards, not student standards.



Will this help me get hired after?



This program does not guarantee a job.



What it does give you is:

- Real experience you can confidently speak about

- Proof of work you can show employers or clients

- Strong professional habits and communication

- A clear upgrade in how you present yourself

That combination dramatically improves your chances—if you do the work.



Who should NOT apply?



Do not apply if:

- You are looking for easy money

- You struggle with deadlines or accountability

- You are not open to feedback

- You cannot commit 10 hours per week

- You expect to be “hand-held”

This program is demanding by design.



Who SHOULD apply?

Apply if you:

- Are tired of being overlooked

- Want real experience—not just certificates

- Are serious about your professional future

- Are willing to invest time to gain credibility

- Want to raise your standard and expectations



FINAL REMINDER – REQUIRED TO APPLY

To prove you read and understood this post, you must include this exact phrase at the top of your application message:

“I’m ready to invest my time to earn my place as a Walker Media Rockstar Intern.”

Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.
