title: Account Executive
description:
NOW HIRING: Virtual Assistant Account Executive

High Valley Enterprises | Remote (Philippines-Based Preferred)



High Valley Enterprises is growing, and we’re looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant Account Executive based in the Philippines to support our roofing and restoration operations. This role is ideal for someone who is experienced, proactive, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where accuracy, communication, and follow-through matter.



This position supports a U.S.-based team operating on Mountain Standard Time (MST). Candidates should be willing and able to work hours that substantially overlap with MST business hours. While this will require night shift hours in the Philippines, there is some flexibility. The full 8-hour shift does not have to perfectly align with MST; if it works well, the final 2–3 hours of the shift may be worked after 5:00 PM MST.



HOURS OFFERED:

• 30–40 hours per week depending on seasonal workload fluctuation

• Busy season is typically March–November, with the highest demand for hours during this time



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Conventional estimating

• Xactimate estimating (required)

• Insurance supplementation support

• Invoice preparation and collections follow-up

• Basic bookkeeping tasks

• Product and material research

• Job reconciliation and cost tracking

• Cost control support across projects

• Event coordination and organizing

• Customer follow-up calls for quality assurance

• Requesting and managing online reviews



REQUIREMENTS:

• Required: Proven experience using Xactimate for estimating

• Required: Minimum 2 years of construction industry experience

• Roofing industry experience is a strong bonus

• Strong English communication skills (written and verbal)

• Professional phone presence and confidence speaking with U.S.-based customers

• Experience with insurance claims and supplementation is preferred

• Strong organizational and multitasking skills

• Detail-oriented and dependable

• Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote setting

• Willingness to work night shift hours with partial overlap during Mountain Standard Time business hours



This role plays an important part in keeping our jobs accurate, organized, and running smoothly from start to finish while helping us maintain strong customer relationships.



Please apply directly through OnlineJobs.ph and include your resume, relevant work history, and details about your experience with Xactimate and the construction industry.

Key Skills

title: WEBSITE DEVELOPER/DESIGNER
description:
About Lush Esthetica

Lush Esthetica is a modern cosmetic clinic focused on results-driven treatments, safety, and professionalism. All treatments are performed by trained professionals, and our brand is positioned as modern, refined, and premium — clean aesthetics with strong credibility.



We are looking for a website designer who understands modern web design trends and can combine them with strategic conversion thinking to create a website that doesn’t just look good, but drives bookings and sales.



The Role

You will design and build Lush Esthetica’s new website with a strong focus on modern, minimal, and high-end design, while structuring the site strategically to guide visitors toward action.

This role requires someone who thinks beyond visuals — someone who understands user behaviour, trust-building, and conversion optimisation in a competitive aesthetic industry.



Key Responsibilities

Design and develop a modern, clean, and high-end website aligned with the Lush Esthetica brand

Create a strategic site structure focused on conversions, bookings, and lead generation

Apply modern UX/UI principles with clear hierarchy, whitespace, and intuitive navigation

Implement strong CTAs, trust signals, and social proof in a non-salesy, premium way

Ensure a seamless mobile-first experience

Optimise for fast load times, SEO-friendly structure, and performance

Collaborate on content structure and messaging to maximise clarity and conversions

Integrate booking systems, contact forms, and analytics if needed



What We’re Looking For

Proven experience creating modern, conversion-focused websites

Strong understanding of sales psychology and user journeys

Ability to justify design choices based on conversion and UX principles

Clean, minimal, and contemporary design style

Experience with Webflow, WordPress, Shopify, or similar platforms

Independent, structured, and detail-oriented



Nice to Have

Experience within the aesthetic, beauty, or medical industry

Knowledge of SEO, CRO, or analytics tools

Understanding of brand positioning for premium services

What Success Looks Like

A modern, high-end website that reflects trust and professionalism

Clear messaging that instantly communicates value

Strategic CTAs that naturally guide users to book or enquire

A scalable website structure that supports long-term growth



How to Apply

Please include:

A short introduction

Portfolio examples of modern websites with conversion focus

A brief explanation of how you approach design + strategy for conversions

title: LinkedIn Ghostwriter for Psychology + AI Marketing Launch (Immediate Start)
description:
Hi,



I'm Stef Becker, founder of Pi9 Purpose Intelligence®. I'm launching Pi9 AI — a €997 course that teaches solo coaches, therapists, and consultants how to market themselves on LinkedIn without losing their soul.



This is NOT generic "LinkedIn tips" content.

This is psychology-informed, purpose-driven marketing for conscious professionals who HATE traditional marketing tactics.

I'm looking for a Filipino ghostwriter who can help me launch this in the next 50 days.



What Makes This Project Different:



Most LinkedIn courses teach:

"Post 5x/day and go viral"

"Use these AI prompts to hack the algorithm"

"Scale to 7 figures fast"



We teach:

"The world NEEDS what you've been hiding"

"Purpose is a GIFT—you have a RESPONSIBILITY to shine"

"Marketing isn't vanity, it's STEWARDSHIP"

We extract clients' "Voice DNA" (using Enneagram psychology) FIRST, then calibrate AI to write in their authentic voice.



Tagline: "We tune the signal before we amplify it."



The Role:

I need someone who can:



Understand nuanced concepts: Enneagram psychology, Voice DNA, transformation work, purpose-driven messaging

Write in a "challenger" tone: Direct, respectful, no fluff (NOT motivational guru style)

Work FAST without sacrificing quality: 50-day sprint = tight deadlines

Be coachable: I give detailed feedback, you iterate quickly

Think strategically: Not just execute—help me see what's working/not working

Your Target Avatar: "The Invisible Expert"



You'll be writing for solo practitioners who:

Are brilliant at their craft (coaches, hypnotherapists, consultants)

Can transform lives in one session

HATE marketing (it feels icky, like selling out)

LinkedIn = either totally silent OR sounds robotic when they try



Their Pain (7-Layer Invisibility Crisis):

Tried ChatGPT ? sounded robotic ? gave up

Posted manually ? no engagement (didn't speak to PAIN) ? gave up

Profile looks like 2012 CV ? no trust

Post 3x/week ? 12 views ? algorithm buried them

Flannel shirt selfie ? looks like hobbyist, not $5K expert

Competitors crush it with video ? don't know where to start

Know organic is dead ? LinkedIn Ads feel overwhelming



The Emotional Pain:

"I'm squandering my purpose by staying invisible. Someone out there needs what I offer and can't find me."



What You'll Write:

Week 1-2 (Launch Prep):

7 LinkedIn posts (spiritual hooks, pain agitation, solution focus)

Sales page copy sections (hero, problem, solution, CTA)

5
 nurture sequence



Week 3-7 (Launch Phase):

3 LinkedIn posts per week

Ad copy for LinkedIn Ads

DM scripts for warm outreach

Social media captions (if needed)



Week 8+ (Post-Launch):

2-3 LinkedIn posts per week

Student testimonial/case study writeups

Module descriptions for course content

Ongoing
 campaigns



The Tone (CRITICAL to Understand):

NOT:

? Motivational coach: "You can do this! Believe in yourself!"

? Corporate jargon: "Leverage synergies for optimal outcomes"

? Guru-on-throne: "I have the secrets, follow me"



IS:

? Challenger: Respectful but direct ("Here's the truth...")

? Fellow practitioner: "I've been there, here's what actually works"

? Intellectual rigor: No fluff, no hype, respect their intelligence



Example Posts:

? GOOD:

"You tried ChatGPT. It sounded robotic. So you gave up.

Here's why: Garbage in, garbage out.

You handed AI a blank slate. No context about your voice. No data about your psychological patterns.

Pi9 AI is different. We extract your Voice DNA FIRST—using the Enneagram (your psychological blueprint).

THEN we teach AI to write like YOU.

Not louder. Not robotic. Just authentically, unmistakably YOU.

Bridge the AI Marketing Gap: 
"



? BAD:

"Unlock your LinkedIn potential with AI! Transform your profile today and watch the magic happen! You CAN do this! ?????"



Key Language to Use:



USE THESE TERMS:

Voice DNA / Voice Sovereignty

Garbage in, garbage out

We tune the signal before we amplify it

Bridge the AI Marketing Gap

Full-Stack LinkedIn Operating System

Purpose is a gift / responsibility to shine

Marketing = stewardship

Invisible Expert

Marketing paralysis



NEVER USE:

10X your followers

Go viral

Scale to 7 figures

Hack the algorithm

"Game-changing" / "Revolutionary"

Generic motivation phrases



The Spiritual Foundation:

This is what makes Pi9 AI different from every other LinkedIn course:

The world NEEDS what our clients have been hiding.

Purpose is a GIFT. They're not allowed to squander it.

They have a RESPONSIBILITY to shine—not for ego, but because someone out there is searching for exactly what they offer.

Marketing isn't vanity. It's STEWARDSHIP.



Every piece of content must echo this truth.



Requirements:



MUST HAVE:

Excellent English writing (near-native level)

Experience writing LinkedIn content or B2B thought leadership

Ability to understand psychology/coaching/transformation concepts

Fast learner (can adapt tone after 1-2 rounds of feedback)

Reliable internet and can attend Zoom calls

Available to start IMMEDIATELY



BONUS POINTS:

Familiar with Enneagram or personality frameworks

Experience in coaching/therapy/wellness niches

Understanding of AI tools (ChatGPT, etc.)

Portfolio showing "authority" or "challenger" tone (not hype)



PERSONALITY FIT:

Self-starter (I give you a brief, you run with it)

Detail-oriented (grammar, tone, brand voice matter)

Growth mindset (you want to learn and improve)

Not easily offended by direct feedback

Excited about purpose-driven, meaningful work (not just a paycheck)



How to Apply:

DO NOT send a generic cover letter.

Instead, show me you understand the brief by completing this test assignment:



WRITE ONE SHORT LINKEDIN POST (
words):



Scenario: You're writing for a solo hypnotherapist who hasn't posted on LinkedIn in 6 months because "marketing feels icky."

Your post MUST include:

A hook using the spiritual foundation ("purpose is a gift" OR "responsibility to shine")

Reference to at least 2 of the 7 invisibility layers (their pain)

The solution as a "full-stack system" (not just AI prompts)

Challenger tone (direct, no fluff, no motivation-speak)

CTA: pi9com.ai



In your application
, include:



The test post (paste it in the
)

Link to your LinkedIn content samples (if available) or writing portfolio

Your answer to: "Why does purpose-driven marketing matter to you personally?"

Your availability (hours per week, best time for calls)

Confirmation you can start within 48 hours if hired

Compensation & Work Details:



Starting Rate:

$200/month  for 50-day launch sprint

Approximately 10-15 hours per week

Paid weekly ($50/week, paid via WISE)

After Launch (Based on Results):



If we enroll 25+ students: $300/month

If we enroll 50+ students: $400/month + performance bonus ($2 per student over 25)

Long-term ongoing work: $
/month for 15-20 hours/week



Work Schedule:

Monday-Friday, flexible hours (your timezone)

1-2 quick Zoom feedback calls per week (15-30 min)

Fast turnaround during sprint (24-48 hour delivery on posts)



Why the Starting Rate is Lower:

I'm being honest with you: I'm bootstrapping this launch. The starting rate of $200/month is below market, but here's what I'm offering in return:



Training/Mentorship: You'll learn Enneagram-based marketing and AI positioning (valuable skill)

Room for Growth: Salary increases quickly as revenue comes in (documented above)

Meaningful Work: Not boring corporate content—real purpose-driven transformation work

Performance Bonuses: Your success = my success = shared rewards

Long-term Partnership Potential: If you're great, this becomes ongoing work at better rates

If you need $300+ per month starting immediately, I respect that—but this might not be the right fit right now.



If you're willing to grow together and see the potential, let's talk.



Selection Process:

I will review applications as they come in (first-come, first-served for qualified candidates)

If your test post is strong, I'll schedule a 15-min Zoom call within 24 hours

If the call goes well, you start immediately

First week is PAID trial ($50) — if it's a good fit, we continue for the full sprint



Why Work With Me:



GOOD REASONS:

Clear briefs (you won't be guessing what I want)

Fast feedback (I respond within hours, not days)

Room to grow (salary increases as revenue comes in)

Interesting niche (psychology + AI + purpose, not boring corporate)

Respectful collaboration (I value thinkers, not just executors)

Learn cutting-edge marketing (Enneagram + AI positioning is rare skill)



HONEST CHALLENGES:

Tight deadlines during sprint (you need to be fast)

I'm direct with feedback (if something's off, I'll tell you immediately)

Starting pay is lower ($200/month) but increases quickly with results

This is NOT easy work (requires thinking, not just template-filling)



Timeline:

Apply by: Rolling basis (reviewing as applications come in)

First interview: Within 24 hours of strong application

Start date: Within 48 hours of interview

First deliverables: 3 LinkedIn posts due by end of Week 1

Questions to Ask Yourself Before Applying:

Can I write 150 words that challenge someone respectfully (without being preachy)?

Do I understand the difference between "features" and "pain-driven" copy?

Can I deliver 3-5 pieces of content per week during a sprint?

Am I comfortable with psychology language (Enneagram, purpose, transformation)?

Can I handle direct feedback without taking it personally?

Am I okay with starting at $200/month with clear growth potential, or do I need higher starting pay?

If YES to all 6, write the test post and apply now.



To Apply:

Send your application with with Subject Line: "Pi9 AI Ghostwriter Application - [Your Name]"



Include:

Test post (paste in
)

Portfolio link

Why purpose-driven marketing matters to you

Availability confirmation

First strong applicant who gets the tone right wins the job.



I'm reviewing applications as they come in. ????



Love,

Stef

If you need hand-holding, constant reassurance, or loose expectations—this is not for you.



If you take pride in anticipating needs, protecting time, and executing cleanly—keep reading.



This role is best suited for someone who prefers structure, ownership, and high standards over comfort or flexibility.



Location: Remote / Virtual

Schedule (PHT): Tuesday–Saturday | 11:00 PM – 8:00 AM PHT (1-hour unpaid break)

Schedule (CST): Monday–Friday | 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST

Compensation: Starts at ~$7/hour USD (based on experience and performance)

Type: Full-Time (40+ hrs/week)



?



About ZenHomes



ZenHomes is a lean, high-performing real estate company based in Texas. We acquire off-market properties, manage rentals, and operate with clarity, accountability, and systems.



We run a small, trusted team across the U.S. and the Philippines. We don’t do busywork. We don’t micromanage. We care about outcomes.



?



About This Role (Read Carefully)



This is a high-expectation Executive Assistant role supporting the CEO directly.



Even though the position is remote, expectations are real from Day 1: speed, accuracy, follow-through, and emotional maturity.



This role exists to:

 • Buy back the CEO’s time immediately

 • Reduce noise, errors, and dropped details

 • Execute quickly within clear guidelines

 • Improve rapidly through direct feedback



Feedback here is direct and timely because standards are high. The goal is improvement, not perfection—but repeated mistakes signal misalignment.



If something is unclear, elite operators pause and ask first. Once clarified, execution must be fast and precise.



Autonomy is earned quickly through judgment, correction speed, and consistency.



?



What You’ll Own



Immediate Responsibilities (Day 1 Standard)



Calendar & Time Protection

 • Own and manage the CEO’s calendar 2+ weeks out

 • Book, reschedule, and confir
etings

 • Enforce calendar rules with discipline

 • Prepare agendas and context so nothing is reactive



Communication & Coordination

 • Triage incoming messages and requests

 • Draft clear, professional responses in the CEO’s voice

 • Flag decisions cleanly with relevant context

 • Coordinate logistics, scheduling, reminders, and next steps



Task Tracking & Execution

 • Track tasks and open loops in Asana

 • Ensure nothing drops, stalls, or surprises the CEO

 • Prepare before asking questions

 • Execute once aligned—fast and clean



?



Earned Responsibilities (After Trust Is Demonstrated)

 • Handle tenant, guest, and vendor coordination with minimal escalation

 • Surface risks, conflicts, or gaps before they become problems

 • Reduce unnecessary interruptions and “quick questions”

 • Act as a true gatekeeper of the CEO’s time



?



Required Experience & Traits

 • 2+ years as an Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or similar

 • Excellent written and spoken English (neutral accent preferred)

 • Highly organized, responsive, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable in fast-paced, high-expectation environments

 • Emotionally steady and receptive to direct feedback

 • Loyal, discreet, and dependable



?



You Will Thrive Here If You:

 • Think in checklists, systems, and outcomes

 • Take responsibility personally

 • Dislike chaos and proactively fix it

 • Ask smart questions after attempting solutions

 • Prefer clear feedback over vague praise

 • Stay calm under pressure and don’t personalize corrections



This Role Is Not for You If You:

 • Need constant reassurance or validation

 • Guess instead of asking when unclear

 • Take feedback personally

 • Avoid accountability

 • Prefer slow, low-pressure environments



?



What Success Looks Like

 • The CEO’s calendar is accurate, structured, and protected

 • Tasks are handled without reminders

 • Errors are corrected quickly and do not repeat

 • Communication is concise, proactive, and clean

 • Trust compounds and responsibility expands rapidly



?



Why This Role Is Different

 • You get a front-row seat to how a real estate investment business is built and scaled

 • Strong performance leads to expanded responsibility, trust, and compensation

 • This is a long-term role for someone who wants to grow with a CEO—not hop jobs



?



Tools We Use

 • Google Calendar

 • Asana

 • Slack

 • Airbnb / VRBO / Hospitable

 • REsimpli CRM (preferred)

 • NordVPN (provided)



?



Non-Negotiable Setup Requirements

 • Quiet, separate, dedicated home office

 • Two monitors with an external mouse

 • Noise-canceling Bluetooth headset

 • Hardwired internet (minimum 50 Mbps up/down)

 • Backup internet and backup power



Paid Time Off (PTO) 



After completing 90 days of employment, you will begin accruing paid time off equivalent to 10 days per year, accrued monthly starting on Day 91 (approximately 0.83 day per month).

?



Application Process (Follow Exactly)



Step 1: Attach your resume



Step 2: Record a Loom video answering:

 1. Why this role excites you

 2. A time you protected a leader’s time under pressure

 3. A mistake you made—and how you ensured it never happened again

 4. How you handled direct feedback

 5. Two people who inspire you and three traits you admire most



Step 3:

 • Screenshot from Speedtest.net

 • Photo of your current home office setup



?



Trial Period



All hires begin with a 30-day paid trial period. Expect daily check-ins, real responsibility, and fast feedback.



We hire based on performance, correction speed, judgment, and character.

title: Bookkeeper & Operations Assistant (CPA Practice)
description:
We are a U.S.-based CPA firm providing Client Accounting Services (CAS) to small businesses. We are system-driven and process-oriented, with clear SOPs and defined workflows.



This role is designed to grow into a primarily bookkeeping-focused position as the firm adds more clients. As the firm continues to grow, this position may expand into a full-time role. Additionally, there is opportunity for growth into other accounting functions, including tax support and controllership services, depending on performance, interest, and firm needs.



This is a part-time role (20 hours per week) supporting both bookkeeping and firm operations. All bookkeeping work follows written SOPs and is reviewed by a U.S. CPA. No tax preparation, tax advice, or judgment-based accounting is required.



Responsibilities include:

 • Weekly transaction categorization in QuickBooks Online using prior vendor history

 • Leaving unclear transactions Uncategorized for CPA review

 • Performing bank and credit card reconciliations only after CPA approval

 • Following documented bookkeeping SOPs with no guessing or assumptions

 • Managing workflows and tasks in Financial Cents

 • Updating client statuses and tracking missing items

 • Organizing client files and folders using firm standards

 • Assisting with calendar and schedule management

 • Organizing inboxes and drafting
s for CPA review

 • Supporting general firm operations during the client growth phase



This role will NOT include:

 • Tax preparation or tax advice

 • Client advisory or accounting judgment calls

 • Creating or modifying the chart of accounts

 • Payroll, loans, equity, or owner compensation

 • Sending client
s without approval (initially)



Requirements:

 • 2+ years of hands-on QuickBooks Online experience

 • Strong understanding of bank feeds, transaction categorization, and reconciliations

 • Ability to follow SOPs and checklists precisely

 • High attention to detail and organization

 • Reliable communication and availability

 • Prior experience supporting U.S.-based clients preferred



Preferred (Not Required):

 • QuickBooks ProAdvisor certification

 • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or a related field

 • Prior experience working with CPA or accounting firms



Pay:

 • $5-8 USD per hour, depending on experience



Application instructions (required):

To apply, title your application response Falcon so we know you read the full description. Applications without this title will not be reviewed.

title: AI-Native Operations & Automation Intern / Junior
description:
Gatech is looking for a "Wizard’s Apprentice" to help us break and rebuild our processes with AI.

Are you prompting AI for fun at evenings? Well, how about getting some money for it and getting to use the best tools in the market? 



Are you young and ambitious? Not that young but still ambitious? We work hard but we have a lot of freedom. 



We are a lean, 3-person team selling high-tech access control products and software to international markets (Europe). We move fast, but we have manual processes that need to be smarter. We don’t want a traditional employee; we want someone who lives and breathes AI.



The Mission: We show you how our business works—from shipping turnstiles to closing deals with big fitness chains. Your aim is to make us obsolete. 



Explore our current workflows and find where we are wasting time.



Are you familiar with "Vibe Coding" (Cursor, Bolt.new, Lovable)? Even better, but not a must.



Automate everything using Zapier, ClickUp, and AI agents. Don't know all of these? Doesn't matter. We will pay you to learn. 



Test, break, and fix things daily.



Who You Are:



AI-Native: You use ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini daily. You know what a "system prompt" is.



High Agency: You don’t wait for a manual. You Google it, YouTube it, or ask the AI until it works.



Curious: You want to understand how a global hardware business operates.



What We Offer:



Full Access: We pay for all the AI tools you need.



Total Freedom: If you find a better way to do things, we do it your way.



Direct Impact: Your automations will be used in real global deals immediately.



Mentorship: Work directly with the founders and learn the "real world" of international trade.



How to Apply: Don't send a CV. Send us a 2-minute video or write a text to something cool you have built, automated, or "vibe-coded" recently.

title: Sales Job
description:
About the Role:

We are a fast-growing digital management agency representing high-tier influencers and elite digital creators. We are looking for a sharp, empathetic, and persuasive Account Executive to handle direct fan engagement and community management.

This isn't just a data-entry job; it’s a high-stakes sales and communication role where your ability to build rapport and close deals in real-time will directly impact your earnings.

Key Responsibilities:

-Manage real-time communication on behalf of premium creators.

-Build and maintain long-term relationships with subscribers through personalized storytelling.

-Execute strategic sales of digital products within the chat flow.

-Maintain the specific "voice" and persona of the creator you are representing.

Requirements:

-Near-native English proficiency (written).

-Experience in high-ticket sales (not necessary).

-Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle high volumes of messages.

-High emotional intelligence: you know how to read between the lines of a conversation.

The "Easter Egg" Selection Process:

We receive hundreds of applications, but we only hire those with impeccable attention to detail (a trait critical for managing our accounts). To demonstrate that you have thoroughly read this briefing, please include a specific reference in your cover letter. Since our strategy is often compared to a strategic game of chess, ensure you mention how you would reach a checkmate in a complex negotiation. Applications without this contextual reference will be automatically archived.

title: Email Marketing Specialist (Mailchimp / Email Campaigns)
description:
We are a growing service-based business looking for an experienced
 Marketing Specialist to manage and execute
 campaigns using Mailchimp (or similar platforms).



This role is not entry-level. You must already understand
 marketing strategy, segmentation, deliverability, and performance tracking. You will be working independently with clear instructions and KPIs.



Key Responsibilities



Build, schedule, and manage
 campaigns in Mailchimp (or software you have used in the past)



Create
 sequences (welcome, follow-ups, promotions, abandoned leads)



Segment
 lists based on customer behaviour and lifecycle



Improve open rates, click-through rates, and conversions



Set up and manage automations



Clean lists, manage unsubscribes, and maintain deliverability



A/B test subject lines and content



Track and report campaign performance



Coordinate with website/CRM workflows where required



Required Experience



Proven experience with Mailchimp (or software you have used in the past)



Strong understanding of:



 funnels & automations



List segmentation



Deliverability & spam rules



Analytics and optimisation



Experience working with service-based businesses is a strong plus



Clear written English



Ability to follow instructions and work independently



Technical Requirements



Reliable internet connection



Ability to work with shared logins and SOPs



Comfortable with time tracking software (screenshots enabled)



Familiar with Google Drive, Docs, and basic CRM systems



Work Details



Remote (Philippines preferred)



Part-time to start (hours can increase based on performance)



Tracked hours



Long-term role for the right person



To Apply



Please include:



Your Mailchimp experience (years + examples) (or software you have used in the past)



Types of campaigns you’ve managed

Please send a voice note explaining your experience along with your resume/CV to WhatsApp:


Applications without a voice note will not be considered.

title: AI Video Animator Needed (Kling, Sora, Veo) to Create 20 to 30 Second Cartoon Style Ad
description:
Overview



I am hiring an experienced AI video creator to produce a short, horizontal animated advertisement (20 to 30 seconds). The concept is an ultrasound 
nt that transitions into a fast montage of a child’s future life 
nts, ending with on screen text: “FREE ULTRASOUND.”



This is not basic prompting. I need someone who can maintain character consistency, match a clean Pixar style cartoon look, generate multiple scenes, animate them smoothly, and edit into one polished clip.



Style Reference



- The style is a warm, high quality 3D cartoon look similar to the reference discussed in the
 thread.



Video Specs



- Orientation: Horizontal (landscape) for future use on large displays (billboards).

- Length: 20 to 30 seconds total.

- Deliverable: One final MP4 video file.



Scene Scope (what needs to be shown)



The core sequence is:



- Doctor touches mother’s belly while ultrasound is being done.

- Transition into a montage of the child’s future, similar to the referenced stork style ad but with the doctor and ultrasound concept.



Example montage 
nts requested (I have example scenes):



- Childhood 
nts like dad reading a story, mom teaching the child to write, riding a bike with dad.

- Kid sports 
nt (soccer).

- Teen stage (visually older than the child scenes).

- Graduation.

- Career 
nt (welder or office job type scene).

- Marriage (wedding).

- End card text: FREE ULTRASOUND.



Character notes:



- Keep the same main child consistent across scenes.

- Show clear age progression (younger child, older kid, teen, adult).

- One scene may include mom holding a baby.



Editing notes:



- Smooth transitions.

- Backgrounds can be simpler if it helps transitions look cleaner.



Tools and Skills Required



You must have real experience creating coherent multi scene videos with:



- Kling, Sora, Veo (or equivalent high end AI video tools)

- Ability to keep character identity consistent across multiple shots

- AI image generation plus animation workflow when needed

- Video editing skills to assemble scenes, control pacing, and add final text

- If you have access to the tools, great. If needed, I may provide access to certain tools depending on the candidate.



What I Will Provide: 



- The full concept and scene list

- Style guidance and references

- Feedback on drafts



Deliverables



- First draft: full 20 to 30 second clip with all scenes in order

- Final version after revisions (see below)

- Source assets or project files if applicable (optional, tell me what you can provide)



Revisions



Include 2 rounds of revisions:



- Round 1: scene timing, transitions, character consistency

- Round 2: final polish and end card text



Pay Structure



Choose one option in your application:



Option A: Fixed price for the full clip

Option B: Hourly rate with a not to exceed cap (example: 2 to 4 hours for an experienced operator)



How to Apply (must answer these):



- What AI video tools do you actively use (Kling, Sora, Veo, others)?

- Share 2 to 3 examples of AI animated videos you have made (links required).

- Describe your workflow for character consistency across scenes.

- Estimate hours needed for a 20 to 30 second multi scene montage like this.

- What is your rate: hourly and fixed price?

title: Meta Ads Video Editor
description:
At Studio Close, we partner with medical practices and doctors to build dominant digital presences through strategic content and paid advertising. We capture high-quality video content in quarterly shoots and transform that raw footage into organic posts and high-converting video ads that position our clients as the leading authorities in their medical markets. We’re now expanding our team to meet growing demand. I’m looking for an absolute expert in video editing.



Role & Responsibilities

As our Video Editor, your main responsibilities will include:

- Reviewing and organizing hours of footage

- Adding B-roll, subtitles, and appropriate music to talking head videos

- Editing multiple short-form reels for Meta ads and organic content

- Creating eye-catching, scroll-stopping content

- Managing multiple projects while meeting deadlines

- Proficiency in CapCut Pro and Adobe Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator)

- Working with a reliable internet connection and a computer capable of handling video editing software

- Comfortable communicating and collaborating through Asana and Slack





What We’re Looking For

You should have:

- Advanced English language skills

- An upbeat, helpful attitude

- 100% honesty and transparency

- Attention to detail (e.g., include your coffee order in the subject line!)

- Advanced knowledge of hooks and viral video techniques

- Advanced understanding of Meta ads

- Optional but valuable: Graphic design skills (thumbnails, social media graphics, motion graphics)

- If you cannot commit to daily output of 5–10 videos, please do not apply.



What We Value Most

- Good taste in design and content

- Timeliness and reliability

- Honesty and integrity

- Continuous desire to improve

- Asking questions and seeking clarification when needed

- Ability to follow step-by-step instructions

 A self-starter mindset and fearlessness in learning and helping





Work Schedule

- 5 videos edited per day

- Flexible hours; we care about quality and turnaround

- Observed holidays:

    * New Year’s Eve & Day

    * Fourth of July

    * Labor Day

    * Thanksgiving & the day after

    * Christmas Eve & Day





Why Join Us?

You’ll be on the ground floor of helping our clients grow amazing businesses. Having had challenging bosses in the past, I’ve dedicated my career to creating a respectful, supportive, and growth-focused environment. You’ll be highly valued, and together, we’ll push each other to improve. We’re excited to work with someone who is as passionate about video editing and digital marketing as we are!



How to Apply

Please send the following when applying:

1. Your portfolio showcasing your video editing work, including reels, ads, and social media videos

2. Your resume, with references if possible

3. The completed Studio Close Test Assignment (provided separately)

title: Sales Executive Assistant (US-Based B2B Sales Team)
description:
Sales Executive Assistant and SDR

(US-Based B2B Sales Team)



>>About Elemental

Elemental is a US-based premium drinkware brand based in CA, USA, serving B2B and promotional customers. We work with distributors, corporate buyers, and partners to deliver high-quality, custom drinkware solutions. We are building a lean, execution-driven sales team and are looking for a Sales Executive Assistant who can actively manage and close live deals, manage follow-ups, and prospect leads while maintaining a great relationship with buyers and maximizing their potential.



>>Role Overview

In this position, you will work closely with US-based Account Managers to support deal execution, prospecting, sales follow-ups to close projects, and develop new strategies to find leads for the sales pipeline. You are expected to think, validate, and communicate proactively, implement a strategy to efficiently close sales, build relationships with customers, and maximize their partnership with Elemental. If you prefer purely admin work or need constant direction, this role will not be a good fit.



>>Core Responsibilities

- Manage sales territory under the supervision of an account manager in the US.

- Assist in sales strategy execution (pricing tiers, promos, bundles) to expand sales.

- Hit the monthly quota to receive a monthly bonus

- Prepare and validate sales decks, pricing sheets, proposals, and catalogs

- Track deals, orders, and basic pipeline updates

- Send follow-up
s and support live deals with an “always be closing” mindset

- Prospect via
, LinkedIn, and occasional cold calls

- Find, qualify  leads and book meetings for Account Managers

- Follow up quickly on inbound leads and re-engage cold or stalled prospects

- Handle sales-related phone calls (inbound and follow-ups)

- Provide daily and weekly sales activity and progress reports

- Confirm data accuracy before submission

- Help maintain great relationships with customers



>>Qualifications:

- Strong verbal and written English communication skills

- At least 3 years of experience in sales support, SDR, or sales coordination roles

- Comfortable with follow-ups, prospecting, and sales-related calls

- Strong attention to detail (pricing and data accuracy matter)

- Experience working with CRM

- Can work independently without constant reminders

- Proactively asks smart questions and proposes solutions

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive. You don’t wait to be told what to do.

- Understands urgency, ownership, and accountability in sales work

- Comfortable speaking up during meetings and contributing feedback

- Fully committed during working hours (no other clients during shift)



>>Nice to Have:

- Experience in B2B sales or promotional products

- Familiarity with pricing tiers, discounts, and bundles

- Experience supporting a US-based sales team

- Competitive, goal-driven mindset



>>Schedule & Compensation

-Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM PST

-Rate: $6/hour (8 hours/day with 1-hour unpaid break)

-Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses tied to sales contribution and results



>>How to Apply

 
 with the subject line: Hydration

Include:

-Your resume/CV (PDF via Google Drive link)

-Your OnlineJobs.ph profile link

-A short video introduction (1–2 minutes) explaining:

----Your experience in sales support or SDR work

----How do you help move deals forward

----Why this role fits your strengths



>>Final note

We value ownership, proactive communication, and execution. Silence, delays, or waiting to be told what to do do not work in this role.

title: Talent Sourcer / Recruiter  (Part-Time to Full-Time) – Remote
description:
Noble Hearts HR Consulting is a boutique HR consulting and staffing firm searching for its next long-term tea
mber(s). We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented, and tech-savvy HR Assistant to support our fast-paced and mission-driven team.



This is a remote position requiring 20 hours per week, with the potential to increase to 30 hours per week based on demonstrated performance and consistency. This is not a short-term role — we are seeking individuals interested in a long-term opportunity with growth potential.



Key Responsibilities:



Assist with full-cycle recruitment support, including sourcing candidates using Boolean search techniques

Post and manage job listings across platforms such as ApplicantPro, LinkedIn, Indeed, and ZipRecruiter

Review resumes conduct initial screenings, and schedule interviews

Maintain and update candidate tracking systems (ATS)

Provide administrative support to HR Consultants and Recruiters, including calendar management, data entry, and reporting

Support employee onboarding and documentation tracking

Assist with HR compliance tasks and records management

title: Content & Social Media Growth Manager (Instagram, Youtube, Facebook)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE (read this carefully)



We are a well-established real estate team in British Columbia (Canada) with 20+ years of experience. Our goal is to grow a strong personal brand on Instagram, YouTube, and
 that builds trust, attracts followers, and generates real business (not vanity metrics). 



This is not a simple posting or scheduling job. We don’t want someone to just "post." We want a growth hacker who can turn 20 years of real estate wisdom into viral, high-conversion content across YouTube, Instagram, and
.



We are looking for someone who understands how content grows, how social media platforms work, and how to turn videos into reach, followers, and inbound leads. We are looking for one smart, creative person to manage and grow our social media presence.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITY



Your job is to grow our online presence using smart content strategy and execution across:



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (long-form + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

You will plan content, guide what gets created, package it correctly for each platform, and improve results over time.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLATFORMS YOU WILL MANAGE



 - Instagram (Reels, Carousels, Stories)

 - YouTube (Long-form videos + Shorts)

 -
 (Reels + Page content)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT YOU WILL DO (day-to-day)



Your role is to plan, improve, and grow our social media presence.



 - Plan weekly content ideas for Instagram, YouTube, and

 - Write strong hooks, captions, titles, descriptions and outlines for Reels, Shorts, and long videos

 - Help d
 what videos to create and how to structure them

 - Turn one long YouTube video into multiple short clips for IG + FB

 - Optimize titles, thumbnails, descriptions, and captions

 - Advise on on-camera delivery and content angles

 - Track performance and improve content every week

 - Suggest new content formats, series, and growth ideas

 - Help position the brand as a trusted real estate authority

 - Develop a cross-platform content calendar that balances Reels, YouTube Shorts, Long-form educational videos, and high-value Carousels

 - Take Sonny’s raw expertise and script it into engaging content that stops the scroll.

 - Identify industry and audio trends early and adapt them for a professional real estate brand

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

INSTAGRAM (must understand deeply)



 - How Reels grow (hook, retention, saves, shares)

 - How to turn views into followers

 - How Stories build trust and drive DMs

 - How to structure content that gets shared by non-followers

 - Why some reels fail and how to fix them

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

YOUTUBE (must understand deeply)



 - How to grow a personal brand channel (not viral clips only)

 - Titles and thumbnails that increase CTR

 - Structuring long-form videos to keep viewers watching

 - Using Shorts to support long-form growth

 - Writing strong titles and designing thumbnails

 - Basic YouTube analytics (CTR, watch time, retention)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 (must understand clearly)



 - 
 Reels and videos for

 - Page growth and local reach strategy

 - Understanding what content works better on FB vs IG

 - Local reach and engagement strategies

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TIKTOK (must understand clearly)



 - Grow our TikTok account using original, platform-native content

 - Plan and publish TikTok videos focused on discovery and reach

 - Write strong, scroll-stopping hooks for the first 1–2 seconds

 - Test multiple angles, hooks, and formats consistently

 - Turn real estate expertise into engaging, easy-to-understand videos

 - Repurpose long-form content into TikTok-specific clips

 - Engage with comments and turn comments into new videos

 - Track performance and improve content weekly

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GOOGLE MY BUSINESS



  - Post regular updates (listings, announcements, market insights, offers)

 - Upload new photos and short videos consistently

 - Write keyword-optimized post captions

 - Update business info (services, hours, contact details, descriptions)

 - Add and maintain products/services listings

 - Track insights (views, searches, clicks, calls, direction requests)

 - Identify top-performing posts and replicate winning content

 - Report monthly performance and improvement recommendations

 - Ensure branding consistency across all posts and visuals

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What we are NOT looking for:



 - Someone who only schedules posts

 - Someone who relies mainly on hashtags

 - Someone who copies trends without strategy

 - Someone managing 10+ unrelated clients

 - Someone who cannot explain why content works

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SKILL AND EXPERIENCE



 - Experience growing social media accounts (personal brand or business)

 - Strong understanding of short-form and long-form video

 - Ability to think creatively and strategically and content ideas

 - Comfort working with a confident, on-camera professional

 - Ability to analyze numbers and adjust content accordingly

 - You have successfully grown a brand's following and, more importantly, their engagementand lead flow.

 - You know the difference between a YouTube thumbnail that gets clicks and one that gets ignored.

 - Real estate experience is a bonus, not required.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

TOOLS YOU SHOULD BE COMFORTABLE WITH:



 - Instagram, YouTube Studio,

 - CapCut / AI Video Editing tools

 - Basic analytics and reporting

 - Google Docs / Sheets / Notion (or similar)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED



 - Increased reach and engagement

 - Growth in followers and subscribers

 - Better watch time and retention

 - More profile visits, DMs, and inbound inquiries

 - Strong, consistent brand positioning

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HOW TO APPLY



Please include:



 1. Links to accounts you’ve helped grow (with results)

 2. A short explanation of how you would grow a real estate personal brand

3. One example of a video or post you believe performed well and why



Applications without examples or explanations will not be considered.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please answer the following:



 1. Links to social media accounts you have helped grow

 2. Briefly explain how you would grow a real estate personal brand

 3. Share one video or post you worked on that performed well and explain why



Applications without clear answers will not be considered.

title: Part-Time Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Stripe Cleanup + Monthly Reporting)
description:
Part-Time Bookkeeper (QuickBooks + Stripe Cleanup + Monthly Reporting)



Remote | Philippines Preferred | Flexible Hours | Long-Term Role



About the Business



We operate two Louisiana-based LLCs:



SugarFreeMD LLC



Stacy Heimburger MD LLC



This is a physician-led business with both a clinical revenue stream (RX/hormone/GLP-1 patients) and a coaching revenue stream (membership, seasonal challenges, evergreen digital products, and 1:1 coaching).



We need a bookkeeper who can clean up our QuickBooks accounts, reconcile last year and this year, and then maintain clean books moving forward.



This is a long-term role for someone who is detail-oriented, calm under pressure, and enjoys bringing order to messy systems.



Main Goal



To clean up and reconcile bookkeeping for 2024 and 2025, then maintain clean monthly books for both LLCs with clear reporting.



Current Setup



Two LLCs (separate QuickBooks accounts)



2 Bank accounts:



Two Stripe accounts (clinical + coaching)



Business credit cards:



Transactions are imported but not reconciled or categorized



No receipt system currently (mostly credit card/bank draft paper trail)



Expenses may be mixed between LLCs and will need cleanup and proper allocation.



Key Responsibilities

1. QuickBooks Cleanup + Catch-Up (Urgent Priority)



Reconcile bank accounts and credit cards for both LLCs



Categorize transactions and create a clean Chart of Accounts



Clean up uncategorized expenses and deposits



Ensure Stripe payouts and fees are recorded correctly



Separate and allocate expenses appropriately between the two LLCs



Prepare books so they are tax-ready



Goal deadline: ideally by March 1, hard stop before tax filing.



2. Ongoing Monthly Bookkeeping



Monthly reconciliation for both LLCs



Maintain clean transaction categorization



Track contractor totals for tax prep support (1099 assistance)



Maintain subscription and recurring expense tracking



3. Monthly Reporting (CEO-Friendly)



Each month, provide:



Profit & Loss for each LLC



Balance Sheet for each LLC



Cash flow summary



Expense breakdown by category



RX margin estimate (Stripe RX revenue vs pharmacy expenses)



Revenue breakdown by business stream (clinical vs coaching)



Also provide a simple written CEO summary in plain English.



Also provide suggestions for streamlining expenses to help company grow.



4. Quarterly Tax Estimate Support



Estimate quarterly taxes (not filing taxes)



Provide summaries for tax preparer/CPA



5. Monthly Financial Review Call



Monthly 60-minute Zoom call to review reports and financial priorities



Optional Phase 2 (Future)



After business books are stable, we may add optional support for personal financial organization 



Required Skills



QuickBooks experience (required)



Bank and credit card reconciliation experience



Stripe reconciliation experience



Comfortable working with multiple LLCs



Strong attention to detail and accuracy



Comfortable cleaning up messy books and asking questions



Clear communication in English



Able to work independently and stay organized



Preferred Skills



Experience with coaching businesses, memberships, or online programs



Experience handling subscription-heavy businesses



Ability to suggest improved systems (receipt capture, reporting dashboards, etc.)



Workload & Schedule



Cleanup phase: approx 10 hours/week



Ongoing: likely under 5 hours/week



Flexible work hours (asynchronous is fine)



Compensation



Hourly during cleanup phase



Goal after cleanup: ongoing monthly support at a fixed monthly rate



We are open to a retainer structure that is fair and stable long-term



How to Apply



Please submit:



Short introduction



Years of bookkeeping experience



QuickBooks experience (Online vs Desktop)



Stripe reconciliation experience



Example of monthly reports you provide clients



Confirmation you are comfortable doing cleanup/catch-up work



Your hourly rate



Your estimated timeline to clean up 2024–2025 bookkeeping



Applications without clear bookkeeping experience will not be considered.

title: CDI Specialist (Clinical Documentation Improvement) VA
description:
Are you a detail-oriented professional with a strong clinical background and expertise in Risk Adjustment Coding and Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI)? 



Join our team to ensure the highest level of accuracy, compliance, and quality in our patient documentation and coding practices.



Key Roles & Responsibilities

As a CDI Specialist, you will play a critical role in supporting both our administrative and clinical teams. Your primary responsibilities will fall into two key areas: Documentation Management and Risk Adjustment Education/Optimization.



1. Documentation Integrity & Case Support

Chart Quality Assurance: Review clinical charts to identify documentation gaps, errors, and inconsistencies, ensuring compliance with clinical and administrative standards.



Documentation Resolution: Promptly address and resolve identified documentation issues by collaborating with Case Workers and clinical staff.



Administrative Oversight: Accurately process case-related payments and provide support for clinical supervisor activities.



Workflow Coordination: Coordinate across departments to streamline workflow and maintain alignment on case management tasks.



2. Risk Adjustment & Provider Education

Risk Adjustment Optimization: Perform comprehensive chart reviews to identify documentation opportunities for Risk Adjustment Coding improvement (e.g., HCC capture).



Provider Training: Develop and deliver ongoing training and education to Bluestone providers on accurate documentation and compliance with risk adjustment coding guidelines.



Expert Resource: Serve as the subject matter expert for clinical staff regarding coding inquiries and documentation best practices, offering guidance and feedback.



Compliance Maintenance: Stay current with coding guideline updates and assist in implementing CDI initiatives to optimize coding accuracy and disease burden capture.



Qualifications and Experience

Required: 

Certification: Relevant certification in clinical documentation improvement (e.g., CCDS, CDIP) or coding (e.g., CPC, RHIA, RHIT).



Experience: Minimum of [2] years of experience in Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI), medical coding, or a related clinical role.



Risk Adjustment Expertise: Proven knowledge and application of Risk Adjustment Models (e.g., HCC, CDPS) and related coding guidelines.



Clinical Knowledge: Strong understanding of medical terminology, pathophysiology, and clinical documentation requirements.



Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to provide effective education and feedback to providers and clinical staff.



Remote Work: Demonstrated success and experience working effectively in a remote work environment.



Preferred:

Experience with electronic health record (EHR) systems specific to our organization. 



Background in Quality Improvement or Compliance Auditing.

title: Project Manager
description:
About Us:



Rapid Restore Agency is a leading website design agency specializing in the emergency water damage restoration space.



We don’t just build "pretty" websites; we build high-performing emergency call capture systems that turn panic into profit.



We operate on a partner exclusivity basis (one client per territory), meaning the stakes are incredibly high.



Our mission is to help restoration companies dominate their local markets by delivering world-class assets with speed and precision.



About the Role:



We are looking for an assertive, detail-oriented Project Manager to act as the "Air Traffic Controller" of the agency.



In this role, you will take full ownership of the client journey from "Closed/Won" to "Website Launch."



You will serve as the bridge between the client and our internal production team (Design, Dev, SEO), ensuring timelines are compressed and assets are collected relentlessly.



Your goal is simple but demanding: deliver a world-class restoration website in under 30 days while making the client feel guided, secure, and updated every step of the way.



Key Responsibilities:



Speed to Launch: Drive every project from onboarding to launch in under 30–45 days. Eliminate "client drag" by proactively chasing assets rather than waiting for them.



Asset Collection: Secure the "Emergency Water Damage Restoration Pack" (photos, certifications, reviews) within 7 days of deposit. You must be comfortable pushing busy General Contractors to get what we need.



Quality Assurance (The Gatekeeper): Rigorously perform the Website Quality Assurance Checklist. You are the final line of defense—zero broken links, "dummy text," or mobile issues should ever slip through to the client presentation.



Client Communication: Own the "Friday Morning Update." Ensure 100% of active clients receive a status update every Friday, no exceptions. Translate technical jargon (DNS, Hosting) into simple business language.



Team Collaboration: Manage the 
 board with impeccable accuracy. Ensure no project sits stagnant in a phase (Design/Dev) for more than 48 hours without movement or an update.



Launch & Testimonials: Lead the Launch Call with high energy to resell the client on the finished product. Secure a recorded Zoom Video Testimonial on the launch call (Target: >50% of clients).



Skills & Tools Required:



Assertive Diplomacy: Capable of pushing a busy contractor to send photos without being rude. You know how to be "annoying" in a way that the client respects to get the job done.



Meticulous Eye: You spot a typo in a hero header from a mile away. You are obsessive about Quality Assurance.



Tech-Fluency: You don't need to be a coder, but you must understand the difference between a domain registrar and a DNS record.



Tool Proficiency: You are a wizard with 
, Slack, Loom, PandaDoc, and Zoom.



Process-Oriented: You don't "wing it." You follow the 7-Phase SOP religiously to ensure consistency and avoid chaos later in the build.



Compensation:



This is a performance-based role designed to reward efficiency and ownership.



Pay Structure: $1,000 per managed website launch (Estimated 15 hours + 5 hours buffer = ~$50/hr).



Potential: $4,500 per month ($54,000/year) as you scale to full capacity (approx. 20 hours/week).



Note: Hours may vary initially during the onboarding phase.



Why Join Us?



When you look at our team, you’ll see a group of people "rowing in the same boat" who value extreme ownership and high standards.



We believe that setbacks are part of the journey and that pressure forms diamonds.



You will have autonomy, support, and the opportunity to make a genuine impact on families recovering from home disasters.



If you are ready to treat business like a sport, demand excellence, and refuse to hide behind excuses, we want to hear from you.



Ready to Join a Fast-Growing Team?



If you have the skills and experience to take on this crucial role, apply using the link below.



APPLY HERE:


/build/
Note: Applying directly on this form is the only way to confirm your application. Applications submitted elsewhere may not be reviewed.

About Us

. Our work protects client brands and requires precision.

Structure

Final Note

If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Strategic Cold Email Specialist - Campaign Optimization & AI Integration
description:
Role overview

We’re hiring a high-agency Virtual Assistant to own end-to-end cold
 fulfillment for boutique, high-value clients. This is a delivery-first role: you will independently build campaigns from client brief ? live campaign ? optimization, own deliverability and technical reliability, and document SOPs so the owner can step away from day-to-day fulfillment.



Key responsibilities

• Full campaign ownership: intake, client research, ICP definition, lead sourcing, copywriting, workflow build, launch, and optimization.

• Lead sourcing & “5 arbitrages”: identify market geography, lead source, generational targeting, personal brand leverage, and timing to find best-fit prospects. Use Sales Navigator, Apify, custom directories, Google Maps, and other sources.

• Build & maintain automation: create 
 (or n8n) workflows that chain scraping ? enrichment ? AI personalization (Claude/GPT) ? Instantly.ai (sending) ? auto-responders. Train prompts/models for consistent tone.

• AI-driven personalization: use Claude/ChatGPT + structured prompts and examples to generate industry-specific, non-AI-sounding copy at scale. Manage prompt engineering and JSON handling inside 
.

• Deliverability & domain management: domain warmup, sender identities, multi-domain A/B testing, bounce mitigation, NeverBounce validation, and troubleshooting flagged domains.

• Monitoring & optimization: daily checks (reply rates, opens, bounce, domain health), weekly optimizations, A/B tests on subject lines/senders/angles, and proactive fixes.

• Auto-responder & qualification flows: configure AI-assisted reply qualification and automated Calendly booking when qualified.

• SOPs & documentation: produce repeatable playbooks (lead sourcing, copy frameworks by vertical, 
 module templates, campaign optimization playbook, troubleshooting guide).

• Client reporting & communication: weekly performance notes, meeting-ready summaries, and ad-hoc troubleshooting updates.



Required qualifications

• Proven experience building and running cold
 / outbound campaigns end-to-end (not just executing parts).

• Hands-on with: 
 (or comparable automation), Apify (or scraping tools), Sales Navigator, Instantly.ai (or Smartlead), NeverBounce, Claude, and ChatGPT.

• Demonstrable ability to write industry-specific, outcome-focused copy (biotech, recruiting, wealth mgmt., logistics, etc.).

• Experience setting up and troubleshooting multi-domain sending, warmups, and deliverability issues.

• Strong prompt engineering & workflow design skills (training models via 
 JSON prompts).

• Highly organized, proactive, and able to own outcomes with minimal oversight.

• Excellent written & spoken English.



Strong preference/pluses

• Agency or startup experience where you built systems from scratch.

• Proven track record of delivering 15–20 qualified intros in 90 days (or similar meeting-intro guarantees) for clients.

• Experience documenting SOPs and running R&D on new tools.

• Comfortable with advanced scraping sources (government filings, conference lists, directories).



Performance expectations & success metrics

• Consistently hit agreed reply/qualification benchmarks.

• Maintain healthy domain metrics and >3% target reply rates.

• Deliver clear SOPs and handover-ready documentation within the first 60–90 days.

• Owner should be able to step away from day-to-day fulfillment after 90 days.



Compensation & benefits

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses.

Fully remote with EST schedule.

Professional growth: training, career advancement, and real ownership of fulfillment responsibilities.

Paid Time Off for major U.S. holidays.



If you’re driven, reliable, and interested in being interviewed for this role, please apply directly using the link below, and we’ll move quickly to schedule your initial interview:

mbers or stakeholders who have no prior knowledge of HighLevel.

title: Property Accountant (Yardi)
description:
Property Accountant (Real Estate | Yardi)



We’re looking for a remote Property Accountant with strong real estate accounting experience and hands-on expertise in Yardi. This role is client-facing and will serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients. You’ll oversee monthly bookkeeping, manage close processes, and ensure accurate financials across a portfolio of real estate entities.

  - A real estate investment, development, or property management company

  - Property acquisitions and dispositions

  - Refinancing transactions

mbers with accounting-related questions

Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST

title: Paid Ads Specialist
description:
About Us

Eterna Animal is a rapidly growing eCommerce brand in the pet industry, selling across multiple online marketplaces. We are looking for a highly skilled Ads Specialist to join our team. This role focuses on driving conversions through paid advertising campaigns across major eCommerce platforms and Google.



Responsibilities

As our  Ads Specialist, your primary goal will be to manage and scale paid advertising campaigns to drive conversions. You will be responsible for:



Running and optimizing ads on major eCommerce platforms, including:

•
 Ads

• Instagram Ads

• Google Ads



Key tasks include:



- Creating, launching, and managing ad campaigns to drive sales and conversions

- Conducting keyword research and bid optimization for better ROI

- Monitoring key performance indicators (ROAS, ACOS, CPA) to ensure profitable campaigns

- Scaling successful campaigns and pausing underperforming ones to maintain efficiency

- Managing product-level ads and promotions in alignment with product launches

- Providing regular reports with actionable insights and performance metrics

- Collaborating with the team on product launches and promotional strategies



Requirements



Must-have:

- Proven experience running ads on platforms mentioned.

- Hands-on experience with Google Ads and conversion-focused campaigns

- Strong understanding of paid traffic, conversion tracking, and campaign optimization

- Results-driven with a focus on scaling profitable campaigns and increasing conversions

- Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple campaigns



Nice-to-have (but not required):



- Experience in the pet industry or related eCommerce field

- Familiarity with ads reporting tools



What We’re Looking For:



- A highly skilled Ads Specialist with a proven track record of running conversion-driven campaigns

- A professional who knows how to optimize campaigns for maximum ROI, not just traffic

- Someone proactive and results-oriented, who can take ownership of campaigns and drive growth

- A strong communicator, able to provide clear insights into campaign performance

- A team player who’s committed to contributing to the long-term success of the brand



How to Apply:

1. To be considered for this role, please submit the following:

2. A brief introduction about yourself

3. A PORTFOLIO showcasing your experience with the platforms listed above. Please include CONVERSION-FOCUSED campaigns you’ve managed (screenshots, campaign results, or descriptions). We want to see proof of conversions, not just ads you’ve run.

4. Your expected monthly salary or hourly rate



Note: Applications without a relevant eCommerce ads portfolio demonstrating conversion success will not be considered.

title: App Developer (Simple Streaming App Wrapper for Vimeo OTT)
description:
We are seeking a skilled App Developer to help us launch a straightforward streaming app for both Android and iOS. This app will serve as a WebView wrapper, directing users to our Vimeo OTT web experience. The project is focused on integration and publishing, without the need for custom UI, backend, or payment systems.



This is a simple, efficient build. The primary responsibility will be to develop the Android and iOS wrappers, ensure optimal WebView performance, handle app store submissions (Google Play and Apple App Store), and assist with basic testing and deployment.



Key Responsibilities:

- Develop Android and iOS app wrappers using WebView to display Vimeo OTT web content.

- Ensure smooth WebView functionality and app performance on both platforms.

- Manage app store submission processes for Google Play and the Apple App Store.

- Conduct basic testing to ensure app functionality and deployment readiness.



Required Skills:

- Proven experience in Android and iOS app development, particularly with WebView integration.

- Familiarity with the app store submission process for both Google Play and the Apple App Store.

- Solid understanding of integrating WebView apps with third-party platforms (e.g., Vimeo OTT).

- Ability to perform basic testing and app deployment tasks with attention to detail.



Nice-to-Have Skills:

- Experience with TV platforms such as Roku, LG webOS, Samsung TV, and Apple TV.

- Prior experience with Vimeo OTT or similar OTT platforms.



What We’re Looking For:

- A pragmatic developer who specializes in straightforward app builds and integration.

- Someone who can execute efficiently with a focus on simplicity and functionality—this project is about getting the app up and running with minimal complexity.

- Ideal candidates will have experience with simple wrapper apps, media app deployments, and a solid understanding of OTT integrations.

- We are looking for someone who is goal-oriented and capable of delivering results within a practical scope and budget.



How to Apply:

To apply, please provide:

1. A brief overview of your experience with WebView-based apps or OTT platform integrations.

2. Examples or links to similar simple app builds or media app projects you have completed.

3. Your estimated project rate or hourly rate.

title: Remote Sales Consumer Advisor
description:
Company Overview

We are a US-based, remote-first consumer services business that helps clients resolve and exit unwanted long-term contracts. Our marketing engine is performing well, and we are expanding the sales team to increase close volume while maintaining a high-trust, consultative customer experience.



Role Summary

We are hiring two full-time Remote Sales Consumer Advisors to support a growing inbound lead flow. This is a closing role, not a cold-calling role. You will speak with primarily older, US-based prospects, educate them on the service, answer questions, guide them through the agreement live, collect required information, and then hand the client off to fulfillment.

This is a strong fit for someone who is confident on the phone, organized in a CRM, and comfortable handling sensitive conversations with clarity and empathy.



Work Hours

Full-time, 40 hours per week

US CST hours by default

Monthly performance bonus: tiered structure based on results

Bonus is tied to cash received, not just closed deals



Key Responsibilities

1) Phone Sales and Closing

Handle inbound and assigned leads, run consultative sales conversations

Build trust quickly with an older US demographic

Clearly explain the service, process, expectations, and next steps

Confidently ask for the sale, overcome objections, and close deals

Close within a typical cycle of same day to 14 days, including follow-ups as needed



2) Contract Review and Client Commitment

Walk clients through the agreement in real time on the call

Ensure clients understand what they are signing up for

Collect required details accurately to avoid downstream fulfillment issues





3) CRM and Lead Management (GoHighLevel)

Log all activity in the CRM with clean notes and accurate statuses

Follow the team’s lead management process to avoid missed follow-ups

Upload new clients into the CRM upon close, then hand off to fulfillment





4) Follow-up Discipline

Execute structured follow-up sequences to recover leads and close within the window

Stay responsive and organized across callbacks, scheduled follow-ups, and inbound replies





5) Performance and Continuous Improvement

Participate in daily quick check-ins during ramp (approx. 20 minutes)

Review performance metrics, identify breakdowns, and apply coaching fast

Contribute feedback to improve scripts, training docs, and call flow





Success Metrics

Contact rate and speed to first response

Show rate for scheduled calls

Close rate and close cycle length (0 to 14 days typical)

Revenue collected (used for bonus calculations)

CRM hygiene, no missed leads, accurate notes, consistent follow-ups

Call quality, clarity, trust-building, compliance with process



Required Skills and Experience

2+ years in phone-based sales, inside sales, or high-ticket closing preferred

Strong closing instincts, objection handling, and consultative communication

High comfort speaking with older US prospects

Strong CRM habits, preferably GoHighLevel (or similar CRMs)

Reliable internet, quiet workspace, professional headset setup

Coachable, consistent, and able to ramp quickly with daily feedback



Accent and Language Preferences

Strong preference for a neutral, easy-to-understand English accent
