title: Technical Web Designer/Developer & SEO Specialist
description:
We need a web designer who combines creative design skills with deep technical expertise. You must design beautiful, high-converting websites AND build them with clean, optimized code.



If you can't design a full website in Figma, hunt down technical SEO errors, and hand-code custom solutions when needed, don't apply.



Core Requirements:

- Design expertise in Figma—create complete website designs and individual page mockups with proper component structure, spacing, and brand consistency before touching WordPress.



- WordPress + Elementor proficiency with custom CSS/HTML/light JavaScript skills. You solve problems with code, not another plugin.



- Technical SEO knowledge—identify and fix issues in Ahrefs, SEMrush, and Ubersuggest. You understand crawl errors, broken links, duplicate content, missing schema, heading hierarchy, canonical issues, and site architecture problems.



- Performance optimization—build lightweight sites that score 85+ on PageSpeed. You know how to lazy-load, optimize images, minimize CSS/JS, and fix Core Web Vitals without sacrificing design.



- Exceptional attention to detail—you catch misalignments, broken links, incorrect alt tags, missing meta descriptions, and layout issues before submission. Sloppy work will be rejected.



- Responsive design mastery—sites must work flawlessly across all devices and browsers. No exceptions.



What You'll Actually Do:

- Design complete websites and landing pages in Figma for med spa and B2B clients following strict brand guidelines.

- Build those designs in WordPress/Elementor with clean, optimized code.

- Audit existing sites using Ahrefs, SEMrush, or Ubersuggest—identify technical SEO problems and fix them.

- Write custom CSS, HTML, and light JavaScript when Elementor can't achieve the required functionality or design.

- Conduct thorough QA on your own work before submission. Repeatedly submitting work with errors will result in termination.



Work Schedule:

- Monday-Friday, 9am-6pm EST (required)

- Starting pay: $7/hour



Prove Your Skills in Your Application:

- Figma design portfolio—show 3+ complete website designs you created (provide Figma links or exported PDFs).

- Built website portfolio—provide 3+ live URLs of sites you designed AND built with current PageSpeed scores.

- Technical SEO example—describe a technical SEO issue you identified and fixed, including the tool you used to find it and the impact of the fix.

- Code sample—show custom CSS/HTML/JS you wrote to solve a design or functionality problem.



Disqualifiers:

- Cannot provide Figma design examples

- Portfolio sites have obvious technical SEO errors (broken links, missing alt tags, poor heading structure)

- Portfolio sites score below 70 on PageSpeed mobile

- No experience with SEO audit tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Ubersuggest)

- Cannot write custom code beyond basic CSS

- Submit generic applications with typos or without required portfolio examples



To Apply:

Send: Figma portfolio + built site portfolio (with PageSpeed scores) + technical SEO example + code sample.



Applications missing any of these will be ignored.



- Ralph Leon

Lynx Software

title: Executive Assistant to CEO (Real Estate | Night Shift | Long-Term Role)
description:
This is not a traditional Executive Assistant role.



This is a leverage role supporting a fast-moving real estate CEO who values precision, ownership, and speed.



If you need hand-holding, constant reassurance, or loose expectations—this is not for you.



If you take pride in anticipating needs, protecting time, and executing cleanly—keep reading.



This role is best suited for someone who enjoys structure, ownership, and high standards more than comfort or flexibility.



Location: Remote / Virtual

Schedule (PHT): Tuesday – Saturday | 11:00 PM – 8:00 AM PHT (1-hour unpaid break)

Schedule (CST): Monday – Friday | 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM CST

Compensation: Starts at ~$7/hour USD (based on experience and performance)

Type: Full-Time (40+ hrs/week)



---



About ZenHomes



ZenHomes is a lean, high-performing real estate company based in Texas. We acquire off-market properties, manage rentals, and operate with clarity, accountability, and systems. We run a small, trusted team across the U.S. and the Philippines and hold high standards for performance and professionalism.



We don’t do busywork. We don’t micromanage. We care about outcomes.



---



About This Role (Read Carefully)



This is a high-pressure Executive Assistant role supporting the CEO directly. Even though the position is remote, the expectations are real: speed, accuracy, follow-through, and emotional maturity are required from Day 1.



This role exists to:



Buy back the CEO’s time immediately

Reduce noise, errors, and dropped details

Execute fast within clear guidelines

Improve quickly through direct feedback



You will receive direct feedback, fast corrections, and high expectations. Feedback here is direct and fast because standards are high. The goal is improvement, not perfection—but repeated mistakes signal 
ndidates who need hand-holding, reassurance, or vague direction will not enjoy this role.



If something is unclear, elite operators pause and ask first. Once clarified, speed and precision matter.



Autonomy is earned quickly through demonstrated judgment, correction speed, and consistency.



---



What You’ll Own



Immediate Responsibilities (Day 1 Standard)



Calendar & Time Protection



* Own and manage the CEO’s calendar 2+ weeks out

* Book, reschedule, and confir
etings 

* Enforce calendar rules with discipline

* Prepare agendas and context ahead of time so nothing is reactive



Communication & Coordination



* Triage messages and communications

* Draft clear, professional responses in the CEO’s voice

* Flag decisions cleanly with context (no rambling, no guessing)

* Coordinate logistics, scheduling, follow-ups, and reminders



Task Tracking & Execution



* Track tasks and open loops in Asana

* Ensure nothing drops, stalls, or surprises the CEO

* Prepare before asking questions

* Execute once aligned — fast and clean



---



Earned Responsibilities (After Trust Is Demonstrated)



* Handling tenant, guest, and vendor coordination with minimal escalation

* Surfacing risks, conflicts, or gaps before they become problems

* Reducing unnecessary interruptions and “quick questions”

* Acting as a true gatekeeper of the CEO’s time



---



Required Experience & Traits



* 2+ years experience as an Executive Assistant, Operations Assistant, or similar

* Excellent written and spoken English (neutral accent)

* Highly organized, responsive, and detail-oriented

* Comfortable in fast-paced, high-expectation environments

* Emotionally steady and receptive to direct feedback

* Loyal, discreet, and dependable



---



This Role Is For You If You:



You Will Thrive Here If:

	•	You think in checklists, systems, and outcomes

	•	You take responsibility personally

	•	You dislike chaos and fix it instead of complaining

	•	You ask smart questions after attempting solutions

	•	You prefer clear feedback over vague praise

	•	You are calm under pressure and don’t personalize corrections



This Role Is NOT For You If You:



Need reassurance or constant validation

Guess instead of asking when unclear

Take feedback personally

Avoid accountability

Prefer slow, low-pressure environments



---



What Success Looks Like



* The CEO’s calendar is accurate, structured, and protected

* Tasks are handled without reminders

* Errors are corrected immediately and don’t repeat

* Communication is clean, concise, and proactive

* Trust compounds and responsibility expands quickly



Why This Role is Different: 

- You will have a front-row seat to how a real estate investment business is built, operated, and scaled.

- If you perform, this role grows—responsibility, trust, and compensation increase with demonstrated ownership.

- This is a long-term role for someone who wants to grow with a CEO, not hop jobs.



Tools We Use



* Google Calendar

* Asana

* Slack

* Airbnb / VRBO / Hospitable (PMS)

* REsimpli CRM (plus)

* NordVPN (provided)



---



Non-Negotiable Setup Requirements



* Quiet, seperate, dedicated home office (no background noise)

* Two monitors with a extended mouse

* Noise-canceling Bluetooth headset

* Hardwired internet (minimum 50 Mbps up/down)

* Backup internet and backup power



After 90 days of training you will be given 10-Days PTO 



---



Application Process (Follow Exactly)



Step 1: Attach your resume



Step 2: Record a Loom video answering:



1. Why this role excites you

2. A time you protected a leads' time under pressure 

3. A mistake you made- and how you ensured it never happened again

4. How you handled direct feedback 

5. Name 2 people who inspire you - 3 traits you admire most in them



Step 3: 

Screenshot from Speedtest.net

Photo of your current home office setup



---



Trial Period



All hires begin with a 30-day paid trial period. Expect daily check-ins, real responsibility, and fast feedback. We hire based on performance, correction speed, judgment, and character.

title: Bookkeeper for UK Video Agency | Xero Expert | Part-Time
description:
About Us: 

We're a UK-based video production agency working with exciting clients across multiple industries. We're looking for a detail-oriented bookkeeper who understands UK taxation and can help us maintain clean, accurate financial records.



The Role: 

This is a part-time position (20 hours/week) supporting our financial operations. You'll work directly with our director via weekly video calls and take ownership of our bookkeeping in Xero.



Your Responsibilities:

– Process supplier invoices, expenses, and staff reimbursements

– Reconcile bank transactions and maintain accurate records

– Prepare and submit quarterly VAT returns

– Process quarterly dividend payments (manual journal entries)

– Tag expenses/invoices to Xero Projects for client tracking

– Manage supplier bank details and payment schedules

– Follow up on overdue payments



Essential Requirements:

– Minimum 2 years bookkeeping experience with UK companies

– Demonstrated experience with UK VAT returns and taxation requirements

title: Turn Telegram Contacts into $5,000/Month: DeFi Protocol Needs BD Now
description:

We’re a DeFi protocol launching game-changing LP bond technology. We need Business Development partners who can introduce us to crypto launchpads, blockchain projects, and DeFi communities.





THE OPPORTUNITY:

Every successful introduction that leads to partnership earns you serious money. One good partnership could net you $5,000-10,000 in your first month.





COMPENSATION:

Monetize your network through three massive income streams: guaranteed ETH salary, instant token unlocks, and recurring commissions. We pay you to open doors you’ve already built, while we handle 100% of the closing.



Guaranteed Base Pay: You will receive $10/hour (capped at 10 hours/week),       for simply activating your network. 50% paid in Ethereum (ETH) for immediate cash and 50% in $GMI tokens, which are subject to an 18-month vesting schedule, building a long-term position in the $GMI mutli-chain ecosystem.



Performance Bonus: Every 5 successful partnership you close triggers an immediate unlock of 20% your vested tokens. This allows you to bypass the 18-month vesting period and access your earnings as soon as you deliver results.

Note: A "successful partnership" is defined by the project signing the LP Bonds integration agreement and going live on our marketplace.



Additional Commission: 

- 25% commission on ALL upgrade fees from your partnerships

- Level 2 upgrades: $40 upgrade fee, you get $10 each

- Level 3 upgrades: $80 upgrade fee, you get $20 each

- Level 4 upgrades: $160 upgrade fee, you get $40 each



-  $500 bonus when your partnerships hit 25 Level 4 bonds

-  $2,000 bonus at 100 Level 4 bonds

-  $5,000 bonus at 300 Level 4 bonds

-  Realistic month 1 earnings: $2,000-5,000

- Total 90-day potential: $20,000+



YOU HAVE:

- Existing connections in crypto (launchpads, DAOs, blockchain projects)

-
/
 relationships with project founders or marketing heads

- Understanding of DeFi/crypto space

- Hunger to earn based on results, not hours





YOU DON’T NEED:

- To close deals (I handle that)

- Any upfront investment

- Previous BD experience (connections matter more)

- Full-time commitment (work your own schedule)





THE ROLE:

Simply introduce me to decision-makers at crypto projects. I close the deals, you collect commissions. Every user from your partnerships who upgrades their bonds puts money in your pocket..

Example: ONE medium-sized launchpad partnership generating 100 L4 bonds = $8,000 for you.



Ready to turn your crypto connections into serious income?



Apply with:

- List 3-5 crypto projects/launchpads you have connections with

- Your
 handle

- Brief description of your crypto involvement



We need partners who see the opportunity and want to run with it. Start earning within days of your first successful introduction!

title: Instagram Reels Video Editor
description:
We’re looking for a high-skill Instagram video editor who specializes in Reels-style content (30 seconds to 3 minutes) and understands how to edit for retention, hooks, and engagement.



This is not basic trimming or template editing. We need someone who understands modern IG content and can make videos feel native to the platform.



You must be able to AT A MINIMU
ET THIS QUALITY AND EDITING STYLE.  Do not apply if you can’t: 



What You’ll Be Editing:

- Talking-head educational & thought-leadership videos

- Short-form to Medium-length Reels (30s–3min)

- Business / entrepreneurship / marketing style content

- Raw footage + reference examples will be provided



What We’re Looking For:

You should have proven experience editing Instagram Reels and understand:

- Fast pacing, zooms, and clean jump cuts

- Strong hook delivery (first 3-9 seconds matter)

- On-screen captions (dynamic, readable, not cluttered)

- Strategic text emphasis (words popping at the right 
nts)

- Zooms, punch-ins, motion where it adds energy (not noise)

- Clean sound design, engaging sound effect timing, and subtle music layering

- Editing styles that match high-performing IG creators



If you regularly watch, study, or edit content similar to:

- Business / creator / educational Reels

- Modern short-form content that doesn’t feel over-edited



You’ll fit well here.



Software Requirements:

You should be comfortable with at least one of the following:

- Adobe Premiere Pro

- Final Cut Pro

- DaVinci Resolve

(After Effects experience is a plus, but not required.)



What Success Looks Like:

- Videos that feel native to Instagram

- Clear, engaging pacing from start to finish

- Strong viewer retention (especially in the first 5–10 seconds)

- Consistent style that matches provided references

- This is ongoing work for the right editor. We value quality, communication, and consistency.



- To Apply (Important)

Please include:

- Links to Instagram Reels you’ve edited (required, provide 5-10.) This must be work you have done personally and must match the quality of the example video provided.

- A brief note on your experience with short-form content

- Your turnaround time per video

- Your rate per video, per minute, or per package



Applications without relevant Reel examples will not be considered.



Looking forward to working with someone who truly understands Instagram content.

title: Chief of Staff to the CEO
description:
Role summary

You will translate the CEO’s priorities into execution across a startup, an agency, and board and advisory commitments. You will run the operating cadence, decision tracking, and cross-functional follow-through. This role is about 
ntum, clarity, and accountability.



Core responsibilities



Priorities and operating cadence

 • Run weekly priorities, agenda, and tradeoff conversations with the CEO

 • Maintain a rolling 2 to 4 week outlook (deadlines, board cycles, travel constraints)

 • Produce a weekly exec briefing (what moved, what is stuck, decisions needed)



Action item ownership and follow-through

 • Capture decisions and action items from key meetings, assign owners and dates

 • Follow up with stakeholders, escalate risks, propose options and next steps

 • Keep commitments moving without the CEO having to chase



Cross entity coordination

 • Coordinate work across entities, agency operations, startup, boards, advisory

 • Ensure key deliverables are prepared for board meetings, investors, clients

 • Improve the system over time, lighter process, clearer ownership, fewer surprises



Communications support (as needed)

 • Draft high-stakes internal notes, stakeholder updates

 • Partner with EA so the CEO is prepared and briefed



What success looks like (first 60 to 90 days)

 • CEO priorities become a visible plan with owners and dates

 • Stakeholders deliver on time with fewer reminders from the CEO

 • Risks are flagged early with recommended tradeoffs

 • Board and client deliverables are consistently prepared and polished



Requirements

 • Experience in founder support, chief of staff, program leadership, or strategy ops

 • Strong executive writing and concise synthesis

 • Comfort driving accountability with senior stakeholders

 • Strong judgment and discretion

 • Pacific Time overlap



Working model

 • Must overlap meaningfully with Pacific Time

 • Tools: Notion or Asana, Slack, Google Workspace

title: Revenue Operations & Patient Growth Lead
description:
About Us



We are a high-growth health services business focused on excellent patient outcomes and maximising recurring revenue. We are seeking a strategic, analytical, and execution-oriented professional to own revenue performance across our sales funnel.

This is not a traditional sales or marketing role — you will own the numbers, insights, and processes that drive revenue growth, working directly with the founder.



Role Overview



The Revenue Intelligence & Patient Growth Lead is responsible for:

Analysing the full sales funnel from lead acquisition to patient retention

Identifying revenue leakage, retention risks, and recurring revenue gaps

Listening to sales calls and reviewing processes to pinpoint performance issues

Collaborating with the marketing manager to optimise campaigns for revenue outcomes

Designing and implementing meaningful KPIs and dashboards from scratch, including metrics such as CAC, churn, recurring revenue, funnel conversion, and retention

Recommending and implementing process improvements to maximise revenue and retention

Reporting directly to the founder and owning revenue outcomes

Working cross-functionally to ensure data-driven improvements are implemented



Important: This role does not include managing or coaching the sales team. Coaching and team development remain the responsibility of the current sales manager but you will work closely and collaboratively.



Key Responsibilities



Analyse revenue streams, sales calls, and marketing campaigns to identify opportunities for improvement

Define missing KPIs and dashboards for acquisition, retention, recurring revenue, and funnel performance

Implement process changes and track results for measurable revenue impact

Collaborate with marketing and sales to optimise campaigns and lead conversion

Translate data into actionable insights and clearly communicate recommendations to leadership



Skills & Experience



Proven experience in revenue operations, sales operations, growth operations, or revenue analytics

Strong analytical mindset with experience designing KPIs, dashboards, and revenue tracking

Familiarity with CRM and marketing stacks, e.g., Pipedrive, Keap, WooCommerce, 
/Zapier

Understanding of sales funnels, retention, and recurring revenue

Ability to execute process improvements without direct management of staff

Excellent communication and problem-solving skills



Bonus: Experience in health services, patient flow, or subscription-based service businesses



What We Offer



Flexible remote work environment

Opportunity to own revenue outcomes and retention strategy

Work closely with the founder to implement changes that directly impact business growth



Why This Role Is Unique



You are the owner of revenue performance. You will find leaks, implement fixes, and ensure our funnel and retention processes maximise recurring revenue. Your work directly drives measurable outcomes, without the responsibility of managing or coaching the team.

title: Real Estate Media Operations VA (Non-Client Facing)
description:
Job Overview



Exposure It Real Estate Media is a high-volume real estate photography and video production company serving real estate agents across the U.S. We are seeking an operations-focused Virtual Assistant to support our internal admin team with daily media preparation, tracking, and workflow execution.



This role is ideal for someone who has previous experience supporting a real estate photography company, video production company, or creative media team and understands fast turnaround environments, file organization standards, and production workflows.



This is a behind-the-scenes internal operations role. There is no direct client communication. Your work will help ensure photo and video media moves cleanly and accurately through our systems so our in-office admin team can focus on higher-level execution.



Core Responsibilities



Support daily media delivery workflows



Prepare, organize, and assist with delivering completed media



Track and log internal metrics (deliveries, edits, turnaround times, etc.)



Maintain organized internal folders, records, and documentation



Use software to complete virtual twilight and virtual staging tasks as assigned



Assist with internal scheduling tasks (non-client-facing)



Help manage and update internal systems, including Spiro



Communicate daily with leadership and the admin team to stay aligned on priorities



Assist with general administrative, organization, and operational tasks as needed



Ensure all required prep work for the upcoming week is completed by Saturday







This Role Does NOT Include



Direct communication with clients or real estate agents



Handling inbound calls,
s, or texts



Sales, upselling, or customer support





Required Experience



Previous experience as a VA or admin supporting one or more of the following:



Real estate photography company



Video production company



Creative media or post-production team



Experience working with shared file systems (Google Drive, Dropbox, or similar)



Familiarity with fast-paced, deadline-driven workflows



Comfortable working with photo and video files on a daily basis





Skill Requirements



Strong operational organization and attention to detail



Experience managing and verifying digital photo and video files



Ability to follow structured SOPs and documented workflows



Familiarity with real estate listing media (MLS photos, video tours, drone media is a plus)



Clear and professional internal communication skills



Ability to manage repetitive tasks accurately at scale



Tech-savvy and quick to learn new internal systems



Reliable internet and ability to work EST hours consistently





This Role Is a Great Fit For Someone Who



Enjoys structured, behind-the-scenes operational work



Takes pride in accuracy, consistency, and clean systems



Works well independently once trained



Is reliable, detail-oriented, and process-driven



Wants a long-term role supporting a growing company





This Role Is NOT a Fit If



You primarily work in customer support or inbox management



You prefer direct client communication over internal operations



You are uncomfortable working with photo and video files daily



You prefer highly unstructured or constantly changing roles





Compensation & Growth



$600–$700 USD per month, depending on experience



Consistent, on-time payments



Long-term opportunity with potential for growth and added responsibility



Clear expectations and documented workflows



Supportive leadership and collaborative team environment





How to Apply



Please include a short message answering all of the following:



Have you previously worked as a VA or admin for a real estate photography, video production, or creative media company? If yes, briefly explain.



Describe your experience working with photo or video files (organization, delivery prep, tracking, etc.).



Confirm you can work Tuesday–Saturday aligned with U.S. Eastern Time.



What types of operational or repetitive tasks do you enjoy most?



Applications that do not answer all questions may not be considered.

title: TikTok Ad Specialist
description:
TikTok Ads Specialist

Company: CartKaboom

 Location: Remote

 Type: Contract / Full-Time (flexible based on experience)



About CartKaboom

CartKaboom helps ecommerce brands scale fast through performance-driven marketing. We specialize in paid media that converts—especially on platforms that move quickly and reward creativity (hello, TikTok). We’re looking for a TikTok Ads Specialist who knows how to turn scrolls into sales.



Role Overview

We’re seeking a results-oriented TikTok Ads Specialist to manage and scale paid TikTok campaigns for ecommerce brands. This role is perfect for someone who understands TikTok culture, creative testing, and performance metrics—and knows how to balance data with creativity. You’ll be responsible for the full lifecycle of TikTok ad campaigns, from strategy and setup to optimization and reporting.



Responsibilities

- Build, launch, and manage TikTok ad campaigns for ecommerce brands

- Develop paid media strategies aligned with client goals (ROAS, CPA, scaling)

- Research audiences, hooks, trends, and competitors

- Collaborate on ad creatives (UGC-style videos, hooks, angles, CTAs)

- Test creatives, audiences, and bidding strategies to improve performance

- Monitor performance daily and optimize for conversions and ROAS

- Set up and manage TikTok Pixel and events

- Analyze data and provide clear performance reports and insights

- Stay up to date on TikTok trends, ad formats, and platform updates

- Inventory Management



Requirements

- Proven experience running TikTok ads for ecommerce brands

- Strong understanding of TikTok Ads Manager and campaign structure

- Experience with creative testing frameworks and scaling strategies

- Ability to read data and make confident optimization decisions

- Familiarity with UGC-style ads and TikTok-native content

- Strong communication and time-management skills

- Ability to work independently and hit performance targets



Nice to Have

- Experience managing $10k+/month ad spend

- Experience with Shopify, GA4, or other analytics tools

- Copywriting experience for short-form video ads

- Prior agency or DTC brand experience



What We Offer

- Remote flexibility

- Opportunity to work with fast-growing ecommerce brands

- Performance-based growth opportunities

- A creative, results-focused team that moves quickly



How to Apply

Please include:

- A brief overview of your TikTok ads experience

- Examples or case studies of campaigns you’ve managed

- Monthly ad spend ranges you’ve handled

- Your availability and preferred working arrangement

title: Account Manager
description:
About Us 



LecsIT is a growing managed IT services company that helps small and mid-sized businesses stay secure, productive, and confident in their technology. We focus on long-term relationships, proactive support, and clear communication—not ticket factories or one-size-fits-all IT. 



The Role 



We’re looking for an Account Manager who thrives at the intersection of relationships and technology. This role is all about owning client relationships, translating business needs into IT solutions, and making sure customers feel heard, supported, and strategically guided. 



You’ll act as the primary point of contact for assigned clients, working closely with our technical team to ensure service delivery aligns with expectations while also identifying opportunities to improve the client’s IT posture. 



Key Responsibilities 

-Serve as the primary relationship owner for a portfolio of clients 

-Conduct regular check-ins, quarterly business reviews, and strategic planning conversations 

-Translate technical concepts into clear, business-friendly language 

-Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities aligned with client goals (security, compliance, cloud, etc.) 

-Coordinate with internal technical teams to ensure smooth delivery and follow-through 

-Advocate for the client internally while protecting company standards and scope 

-Track client satisfaction and proactively address risks before they become issues 



What Success Looks Like 

-Clients feel confident, informed, and cared for 

-Renewals are smooth and predictable 

-Expansion opportunities are uncovered naturally through trust 

-Clear documentation of client needs, decisions, and next steps 



Qualifications 

-2+ years in account management, customer success, or client-facing roles 

-Experience in IT, MSP, SaaS, or technology services strongly preferred 

-Strong communication and relationship-building skills 

-Comfortable discussing security, compliance, and IT strategy at a high level 

-Organized, proactive, and able to manage multiple accounts effectively 



Bonus Points 

-MSP or IT services experience 

-Familiarity with Microsoft 365, cybersecurity concepts, or compliance frameworks 

-Experience conducting QBRs or executive-level conversations 



What We Offer 

-Competitive salary with performance-based incentives 

-Flexible work environment 

-Opportunity to grow with a fast-moving, relationship-driven IT company 

-Direct impact on client success and company growth

title: Part-Time Technical VA — n8n Automations & AI-Powered Development
description:
I run a small AI automation agency serving B2B clients. I handle all client communication, strategy, and final review. I need a skilled technical builder who can take my written specs and deliver working n8n automations and AI-powered frontends.



You will build in your own environment and deliver exported workflow JSON files and Loom walkthroughs. I review your work, plug in production credentials, and deploy to clients. This is a long-term role for someone who does great work and communicates clearly.



What you'll build:

- n8n workflows: API integrations, webhooks, data processing, AI agent chains

- Supabase backends: database setup, queries, edge functions

- Frontend apps and landing pages using Lovable (nice-to-have)

- Testing and debugging automations before delivery



Requirements:

- Proven hands-on experience building n8n workflows (not Make, not Zapier — n8n specifically)

- Solid understanding of APIs, JSON, webhooks, and HTTP methods

- Ability to export workflow JSON and walk through builds via Loom video

- Daily async updates on progress

- Comfortable using AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT) to work faster



Hours: ~20/week, flexible schedule

Pay: $300–500/month depending on experience



SCREENING QUESTIONS — Please answer ALL of these in your application. Applications without answers will not be considered.



1. Describe an n8n workflow you've built that uses an AI agent (e.g., OpenAI, Claude, or the n8n AI Agent node). What did the agent do, and how did the rest of the workflow support it?



2. Show me an output from one of your automations that you're proud of — this could be a generated
, a report, a formatted message, a dashboard entry, anything the automation produced. Screenshot or paste it and briefly explain what workflow created it.



3. Attach a screenshot of an n8n workflow you're proud of. If you cannot share a client's workflow, build a quick demo and screenshot that.



4. How do you use AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, Copilot, etc.) in your workflow building process? Give a specific example.



5. What is your monthly rate expectation for ~20 hours/week? What timezone are you in?



Bonus (optional): Have you built anything with Lovable, Bolt, or similar AI-powered frontend tools? If so, share a link or screenshot.

title: Social Media Artist – Short-Form Video, Motion, and Visual Storytelling
description:
Hi! I'm Seth. I'm a U.S.-based leadership coach and leadership researcher building a body of work at the intersection of leadership, meaning, courage, and what it means to live well.



If you want background on me before applying:





I am trying to build my personal presence online via vertical video. I will record all core videos myself. I am looking for a visual artist who can turn raw footage into short-form content that evokes awe, not just attention.



Claude Monet is my favorite painter, and Yosemite is my favorite place on earth. Why? It's because both evoke wonder through light and scale. That sensibility matters here, even if the medium is radically different (video instead of paint or granite cliffs). 



What you will do

 • Edit short-form videos (Reels / TikTok / Shorts) from weekly source recordings

 • Add captions, pacing, b-roll, and light motion graphics before cross-posting

 • Create clean, repeatable visual styles (typography, titles, lower thirds)

 • Cut and package highlights from my podcast appearances

 • Track and communicate performance metrics (views, retention, saves, shares), note patterns, and offer constructive feedback.



What I provide

 • Weekly (stream-of-consciousness and/or scripted) source recordings

 • Some direction and fast feedback as you get started (with a goal that feedback is barely needed at all since you would be the vertical video artist) 

 • Optional AI voice assets if ever needed 

 • A simple, respectful revision process



HOURS: Flexible. Start at 10–25 hours per week, with potential to grow.



?



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY – APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED FOR INSTRUCTION ACCURACY)



Applications that fail to meet any of the requirements below will not be reviewed.



0. Title



Put "Hi, I'm [Name], and I'm your next Social Media Artist."



1. Portfolio (Links Only)



Provide at least 7 short-form videos you personally edited.

Links must be viewable without requesting access.

No attachments. No uncurated folders.



2. Full CV or Resume



Include a complete CV or resume with:

 • work history,

 • dates,

 • tools used,

 • notable clients or long-term contracts.



3. References (Exactly Three)



Provide three professional references, each with:

 • full name,

 • relationship to you,

 •
 address or WhatsApp number.



4. Written Reflection (Six Paragraphs)



Write three (3) whole paragraphs answering:



What is awe-inspiring to you in the audio-visual arts?



You may reference painters, photographers, filmmakers, editors, or specific works. This is about taste, perception, and articulation. 



Write three (3) whole paragraphs answering:



What does the marriage of your artistic vision and technical prowess look like in action? 



5. Generative AI Disclosure



Include a section titled "Generative AI Use" stating:

 • whether you used AI in this application,

 • approximately how much (none / light / moderate / heavy),

 • what it was used for.



AI is allowed, though not preferred, in the part about which is wondrous to you (because AI is not you). Honesty is required.



6. Other stuff



Are you online anywhere I can find you? What else about you is interesting? What else might be relevant for this job? (Answer what you want from these and offer more if you'd like.)



?



Shortlisted applicants will be invited to a paid test edit.



If this post feels demanding, that is intentional.



_____



Since I'm asking you to be honest about AI, I used ChatGPT to generate this post, revised it a few times with additional prompts, and made final edits before posting. I used Grammarly to make my language clearer/tighter (since I tend to be verbose). I also used the onlinejobs.ph suggested salary tool.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
We’re not just hiring a recruiter. We’re hiring a relationship architect. At Virtually, we don’t just fill roles—we build careers, communities, and talent pipelines that are ready before the job opens. We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist who sees recruiting as an act of service and an engine of transformation—for candidates and clients alike. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in fast-growth environments, is deeply curious about people, and believes that hiring should feel human, high-touch, and high-impact.



About Us



We’re one team, building two powerful brands.Pathfinder Hospitality is a Texas-based hotel management company known for transforming properties—and people. With a growing portfolio of branded and independent hotels, we specialize in revitalizing underperforming assets through operational excellence, peak service 
nts, and a culture that puts internal and external guests first.Virtually is our bold next chapter. A startup launched from within Pathfinder, Virtually connects U.S. companies with exceptional offshore professionals across different roles. But we go beyond placement. Our focus is long-term development, ongoing coaching, and matching the right talent to the right business at the right time.We’re building a people-first, performance-driven company where service, growth, and storytelling intersect. If you’re energized by seeing potential before others do—and you believe recruiting is about building relationships—you’ll thrive here. This role is for someone who connects people to purpose, champions long-term growth, and knows that the best hires are built on real relationships.While the industries differ, the throughline is the same: people-first performance, systems that scale, and brands that resonate.





Job Responsibilities



Own and Elevate our Talent Pool: Keep the talent pool warm, visible, and client-ready by proactively maintaining data-rich candidate profiles—complete with readiness scores, communication preferences, and skill benchmarks—to enable fast, high-fit placements.

Recruit Like a Magnet: Use creative sourcing tactics (inbound/outbound, community-based, referral-driven) to attract high-caliber, values-aligned professionals from around the world. Experiment with new platforms, niche communities, and referral programs to keep the pipeline fresh and diverse.

Nurture Relationships That Last: Treat every interaction as a chance to create a raving fan—someone who refers others, speaks highly of Virtually, and stays engaged for the long haul.Track placement outcomes and candidate performance to identify patterns of success, then use those insights to refine what “best-fit” means for each client type, role, and team environment.

Collaborate closely with the Sales Team to understand each role’s goals, team dynamics, and must-haves—enabling fast, high-quality placements based on true fit, not just resume keywords.

Champion Virtually’s brand across sourcing platforms, social media, and candidate touchpoints by creating content and campaigns—like spotlight posts, success stories, referral drives, and newsletters—that showcase our VAs, culture, and client impact, turning passive interest into active talent demand.



Job Requirements



Proven ability to recruit beyond job boards—you know how to find and engage great talent through creative sourcing, personal outreach, referrals, and relationship-building.

Strong communication and storytelling skills, both written and verbal in English—you can craft compelling narratives that make candidates and clients feel seen and understood.

Creative thinker with a marketing mindset—you bring ideas to the table for spotlight posts, referral campaigns, or sourcing angles that spark interest and drive 
ntum.

Highly organized and adaptable, with the ability to manage multiple pipelines, conversations, and deadlines at once without losing sight of the details.

Growth mindset and resourcefulness—you take feedback well, learn fast, and enjoy figuring things out, even when there’s no playbook yet.

Comfort with tools like applicant tracking systems, sourcing platforms, and CRM-style candidate engagement, or willingness to learn quickly.

This position will start as an hourly contractor role for the first 60 days, with a clear path to transition into a full-time role based on performance.

title: Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor with potential for more



Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

Cutting dead space in talking head videos

Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together, adding minor effects like crop and zoom to make the frames look more dynamic and seamless.







Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.











B-roll content - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.







You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

Attention to detail

STRONG English

Strong internet connection

Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

Good working with a team

Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

Availability to work 3-4h a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

Able to work 5-6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

Can take payments through Wise

PH or similar time zone



$300/month + bonuses for 2-3h a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (1h max)



Below is a Google drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video: 



Google drive:







Please complete the following steps:

- Download the files and import into your video editing software

- Find the “good” takes of the footage and stitch together seamlessly 

- Add overlays and additional effects to the edited footage

- Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing (duration of each scene), cropping, etc.

- Message me with a link to the re-created video

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer – AWS Cost Reduction & K8s Optimization
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month – and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters – right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments – EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery – one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done – what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience – cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start – potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them – we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

title: Senior Executive Assistant
description:
Role summary

You will run the CEO’s day to day operating layer across multiple entities (startup, agency, advisory, boards). You will own calendar orchestration, travel, inbox triage, meeting logistics, prep briefs, and the systems that keep commitments visible. This role requires excellent judgment, crisp writing, and strong operational follow-through.



Core responsibilities



Calendar and time protection

 • Own the CEO’s master calendar across all entities, resolve conflicts, protect focus blocks

 • Schedule internal, external, investor, client, and board meetings, handle all logistics

 • Prepare agendas and confirm attendees, ensure meetings start with clear purpose



Travel and trip management

 • Plan end to end travel, book flights, hotels, ground transport, dining when needed

 • Manage changes and disruptions, track loyalty numbers and preferences

 • Produce concise trip briefs (itinerary, key meetings, addresses, timing, prep notes)



Inbox triage and communications support

 • Triage inbox daily, label and prioritize, draft responses for approval

 • Handle routine correspondence directly when authorized

 • Ensure the CEO sees only high priority messages with context and suggested replies



Briefs, files, and systems

 • Create one page pre reads for key meetings (context, attendees, objective, decisions needed)

 • Maintain clean digital filing across entities (Google Drive, Notion or equivalent)

 • Maintain trackers for meetings, projects, contacts, board dates, key deadlines



Admin and expense workflow

 • Receipt capture, expense categorization, reconciliation prep, vendor coordination

 • Coordinate with bookkeeper or CPA as needed (support only, not full accounting)



What success looks like (first 60 to 90 days)

 • Calendar reflects true priorities, fewer context switches, protected deep work

 • Inbox is calm, urgent items surfaced with suggested responses

 • Travel runs smoothly with clear briefs, fewer last minute scrambles

 • A simple tracking system exists, and it stays accurate without CEO effort



Requirements

 • 5+ years supporting a senior executive or founder (multi-time zone a plus)

 • Excellent written English, can draft polished
s and briefs

 • Advanced Google Workspace skills, strong calendar hygiene

 • High discretion and strong judgment, comfortable with confidential information

 • Strong project tracking habits, Notion, Asana, or ClickUp



Working model

 • Remote, Philippines

 • Required overlap: 3 to 4 hours with Pacific Time

 • Full-time preferred (30 to 40 hrs)

 • Tools: Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom, Notion

title: Senior QuickBooks / Stripe Bookkeeper & Accountant (Full-Time, Remote)
description:
About Us

We’re a portfolio of fast-growing companies in:



-Home services (roofing & solar installation)

-Online education & sales training

-We operate in Canada and the U.S., and run everything on QuickBooks Online, Stripe, and Go High Level.



We’re building a real finance machine: a Group CFO at the top (Lucrum) and strong bookkeepers who keep the numbers clean, accurate, and on time across multiple entities.



This role is for someone who wants long-term, stable, full-time work with real responsibility and clear expectations.



Role Overview

You will be the day-to-day bookkeeping & accounting backbone for our companies.



You will:



-Own transaction accuracy, reconciliations, and basic reports in QuickBooks

-Keep Stripe and Go High Level perfectly in sync with QuickBooks

-Support our CFO by giving her clean, timely numbers so she can focus on analysis and strategy

-If you love organized books, clean reconciliations, and clear SOPs, you will enjoy this role.



Key Responsibilities



1. Daily / Weekly



-Download, categorize, and post all bank, credit card, and Stripe transactions into QuickBooks Online

-Manage Accounts Payable & Accounts Receivable (bills, invoices, payments, collections follow-ups as needed)

-Keep Stripe payouts matched to invoices / sales in QuickBooks

-Monitor Go High Level payments, refunds, and failed charges, and ensure they are correctly reflected in QuickBooks

-Flag any unusual or unclear transactions (no guessing)



2. Month-End Close (Support the CFO)



-Perform bank and credit card reconciliations for multiple entities

-Reconcile Stripe and other payment processors to the bank and QuickBooks

-Ensure all transactions are coded to the correct chart of accounts, class, project, and entity

-Prepare draft monthly financials (P&L, Balance Sheet, basic cash summary) for review

-Maintain an organized system of supporting documents (receipts, invoices, contracts) in Google Drive or similar



3. Systems & Process



-Follow existing SOPs for bookkeeping, and help improve them over time

-Maintain consistency in naming, categories, and coding across entities

-Work closely with the CFO to hit tight monthly close deadlines

-Help with cleanup projects when we improve the chart of accounts or restructure entities



Tools You Must Be Strong In



-Accounting GAAP 

-QuickBooks Online (non-negotiable, expert level)

-Stripe (understanding payouts, fees, disputes, refunds, and subscriptions)

-Go High Level (GHL) or similar CRM/payment systems

-Google Sheets / Excel

-Slack /
 / Google Drive



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



-3+ years hands-on bookkeeping/accounting experience for US/Canadian or international clients

-Mastery of QuickBooks Online

-Strong experience reconciling Stripe to QuickBooks

-Experience with subscriptions / instalment plans / online payments

-Solid understanding of:

-Chart of Accounts

-AR / AP

-Bank & credit card reconciliations

-Basic financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet)

-Very high attention to detail (you hate “close enough”)

-Able to follow SOPs exactly, but also spot and suggest improvements

-Comfortable working remotely, with reliable internet, and hitting deadlines without micromanagement

-Good written English (you’ll communicate with our finance team and sometimes operations)



Nice to Have (Bonus)



-Experience with Go High Level specifically

-Experience with multi-entity or holding company structures



Experience in:

-Home services / construction / solar

-Online education, coaching, or high-ticket programs



Success Metrics (How We’ll Know You’re Winning)



-All bank / credit card / Stripe accounts fully reconciled by the agreed monthly date

-Zero unexplained variances between Stripe / GHL and QuickBooks

-Monthly books ready for CFO review on time, every time

-Transactions consistently categorized correctly (very few reclassifications needed)

-Clear, proactive communication when something is missing, off, or delayed



Work Schedule & Compensation



Type: Full-time (40 hours/week), long-term

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Schedule: PH daytime with some overlap with North American business hours (to be agreed)

Salary: $800–$1,200 USD/month depending on experience



How To Apply



Step 1: Apply through OnlineJobs.ph and include the subject line:

“I am your QuickBooks + Stripe Bookkeeper”



Step 2: In your message, please include:



-A short paragraph about your QuickBooks Online experience (years + types of businesses)

-A short paragraph about your Stripe experience (what exactly you’ve done with it)

-Whether you have used Go High Level before (yes/no, and what you did)

-Your desired monthly salary in USD

-Your available working hours in PH time



Step 3: Attach or link your CV/resume.



Only applicants who follow the instructions and show real QuickBooks + Stripe experience will be considered.

Required Skills & Experience

________________________________________________________________________________

SUCCESS METRICS

HOW TO APPLY:

 do not resubmit. Your
 is under review.

WE'RE FILLING THE POSITION IN 3-7 DAYS.

title: DTC Ecommerce Specialist
description:
# E-Commerce Operations Specialist — Steap (Tea Brand, Pre-Launch)



**Company:** Steap — a new direct-to-consumer premium tea brand  

**Type:** Contract / Part-Time (20 hrs/week to start, potential to grow)  

**Location:** Remote (Philippines, Latin America, or similar timezone-flexible region preferred)  

**Compensation:** $5–$10/hr depending on experience (performance bonuses available)



---



## About Steap



Steap is a DTC tea brand in pre-launch mode. We're building the entire e-commerce infrastructure from scratch — packaging, product photography, Shopify store, and unit economics — with the goal of launching a lean, data-driven test of our initial product lineup. This is a ground-floor opportunity to help build a brand from zero.



## The Role



We're looking for a resourceful, detail-oriented E-Commerce Operations Specialist who can take ownership of the operational buildout of our Shopify store and product line. You'll work directly with the founder, following SOPs and detailed instructions, to execute across packaging, sourcing, store setup, and product page optimization.



This is NOT a strategy role. This is an execution role for someone who is fast, thorough, and obsessive about getting details right. You'll be given clear direction and SOPs — your job is to make things happen efficiently and flag issues proactively.



---



## What You'll Be Doing



### Packaging & Sourcing

- Obtain product packaging diecut templates from manufacturers

- Coordinate with designers to get packaging designs completed to spec (boxes, tea bags, labels, inserts)

- Research and source the highest quality, lowest cost, lowest MOQ options for: tea bags (material, fill type, string/tag), product boxes and cartons, inserts, collateral, and shipping materials

- Build a comparison sheet of supplier options with pricing, MOQs, lead times, sample costs, and quality notes

- Order and track samples; manage the feedback loop with suppliers



### Shopify Store Setup

- Set up the Shopify store from scratch (theme configuration, navigation, collections, pages)

- Ensure all product pages are fully built out: descriptions, ingredients, brewing instructions, imagery, pricing, variants, SEO metadata

- Install and configure essential apps (reviews,
 capture, analytics, etc.)

- QA the entire storefront for broken links, missing info, mobile responsiveness, and checkout flow



### Product Imagery & Creative Assets

- Coordinate product photography: source and brief photographers, ship product samples, manage timelines

- Receive raw shots, coordinate editing (or edit basic images yourself), and upload final assets to product pages

- Organize and maintain a shared asset library (product photos, lifestyle shots, packaging renders, brand files)

- Ensure all imagery meets Shopify and social media specs



### Unit Economics & COGS Analysis

- Help build a COGS spreadsheet for each SKU: raw materials, packaging, fulfillment, shipping, payment processing

- Research landed costs for each component and input into the model

- Flag discrepancies or cost concerns so we can align pricing and margins before launch

- Support the founder in distilling proper unit economics for each initial offer/bundle we'll test



### General Operations

- Maintain organized project tracking (Notion, Sheets, or similar)

- Communicate progress daily via async updates (Loom, Slack, or similar)

- Follow and improve SOPs as processes get refined

- Proactively research and recommend vendors, tools, or approaches that save time or money



---



## You're a Great Fit If You…



- Have **2+ years of experience** in e-commerce operations, preferably with DTC/Shopify brands

- Have sourced packaging, raw materials, or physical product components before (bonus: CPG or food/bev experience)

- Are highly organized and can manage multiple workstreams without things falling through the cracks

- Can navigate Alibaba, ThomasNet, supplier directories, and know how to vet manufacturers

- Are comfortable in Shopify (store setup, theme editing, product page management)

- Have basic spreadsheet skills for building COGS models and comparison sheets

- Communicate clearly in English, both written and verbal

- Are comfortable with async work and providing daily Loom or written updates

- Take pride in thoroughness — you don't leave fields blank or skip steps

- Are resourceful: when you hit a wall, you find a way around it before escalating



## Bonus Points



- Experience with tea, coffee, supplements, or food & beverage products

- Familiarity with packaging production (diecuts, print specs, Pantone, etc.)

- Basic Canva/Figma skills for light creative work

- Experience coordinating product photography shoots

- Familiarity with landed cost calculations and basic supply chain concepts



---



## How to Apply



Send a short message (not a cover letter — just a few sentences) covering:



1. **Your relevant experience** — specifically with Shopify store builds, physical product sourcing, or packaging coordination

2. **A specific example** of a time you took a project from zero to launch (even a small one)

3. **Your hourly rate and availability** (hours per week and timezone)

4. **A 2-minute Loom video** introducing yourself and walking through one thing you've built or managed in e-commerce (Shopify store, product page, sourcing project, etc.)



No Loom = no consideration. We need to see how you communicate.

title: Technical SEO & Ecommerce Performance Analyst
description:
We are seeking a highly analytical, technically skilled SEO and performance specialist to improve organic visibility, site performance, and conversion rates across multiple Shopify stores.



This role is NOT focused on content writing or blogging. Instead, the ideal candidate understands how search engines, search apps such as Searchspring, ecommerce platforms (Shopify), and real user behavior interact — and can identify why traffic isn’t converting and what to fix.



You will be responsible for monitoring site health, Core Web Vitals, organic search performance, and on-site behavior, then recommending and prioritizing changes that drive measurable growth.



Key Responsibilities

- Technical SEO & Site Health

- Monitor and troubleshoot Core Web Vitals (LCP, INP, CLS)

- Identify performance issues related to:

-- Theme code

-- JavaScript bloat

-- Third-party apps

-- Image delivery

-- Caching and CDN configuration

- Recommend actionable fixes for developers or implement directly when possible

- Monitor crawlability, indexing, canonicalization, and sitemap health

- Identify redirect chains, duplicate content, and indexation waste

- Organic Search Optimization

- Monitor organic rankings and search visibility across all stores

- Monitor AI visibility across all stores

- Identify opportunities to improve:

-- Collection structure

-- Internal linking

-- Faceted navigation handling

-- Category hierarchy

- Review Google Search Console data to:

-- Identify declining pages

-- Find missed keyword opportunities

-- Diagnose indexing or coverage issues

- Recommend new collections or landing pages based on search demand

- Keyword & Traffic Analysis

- Analyze organic search queries and landing page performance

- Identify:

-- High-impression / low-CTR opportunities

-- High-traffic / low-conversion pages

-- Keywords we rank for but are not capitalizing on

- Recommend keyword targeting strategies aligned with:

-- Product categories

-- Collection pages

-- High-value SKUs

- Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)

- Review onsite behavior to identify conversion issues

- Analyze:

-- Product page layouts

-- Collection filtering and navigation

-- On-site search behavior

-- Mobile vs desktop gaps

- Recommend UX, merchandising, or layout changes to improve conversion

- Connect traffic intent to landing page relevance



REQUIRED Skills

- Strong understanding of technical SEO

- Deep knowledge of Google Search Console

- Experience with Core Web Vitals optimization

- Strong analytical skills 

- Solid understanding of Shopify architecture, including:

-- Collections

-- Tags

-- Templates

- Ability to diagnose problems without relying on content creation



Preferred Experience

- Ecommerce SEO experience (large catalogs strongly preferred)

- Shopify Plus experience

- SearchSpring experience

- Experience working with:

-- GA4

-- Google Search Console

-- Lighthouse

-- PageSpeed Insights

-- Screaming Frog or similar tools

- Familiarity with:

-- Faceted navigation SEO

-- Canonical strategy

-- Crawl budget optimization

- CRO or UX analysis background a plus



Qualified applicants will be given an assignment prior to interviewing. When applying, put "CRO Enthusiast" in your Subject line.

title: Track and Trace Assistant
description:
GH Logistics is a high performance freight brokerage and asset based logistics firm specializing in dry van and reefer freight. Our operation is built on real time visibility, disciplined execution, and consistent service standards. As our national network continues to grow, we are seeking a Track and Trace Assistant who plays a critical role in monitoring active shipments, maintaining accurate tracking data, and ensuring timely communication across carriers, customers, and internal teams to support reliable freight execution.



Role Overview

Monitor and track OTR (On-The-Road) shipments, including overnight freight and shipments picking up the next morning. Ensure consistent, accurate tracking visibility across internal dashboards and customer systems. Maintain refreshed ETAs, verify carrier compliance on tracking platforms, and proactively communicate delays or risks.



Core Responsibilities

• Update assigned sections of the Tracking Dashboard with accurate ETAs, locations, mileage, and notes

• Communicate with carriers via
 and communication channels regarding updates or missing information, ensuring issues are clearly verbalized and documented

• Audit OTR shipments, confirm carriers are properly assigned, accepted, and actively tracking in tracking platforms

• Monitor multiple communication channels to ensure no information is missed

• Closely monitor critical shipments, coordinating with the team to act quickly and decisively

• Work with the Booking Team to confirm ETAs for urgent shipments and uphold GH service standards

• Ensure smooth handoffs to the next shift, including verbal updates via Zoom and written updates in communication channel



What Success Looks Like

• Brokerage task sections are fully updated and accurate

• Assigned hourly
 updates are sent on time

• Delegated critical shipments are handled from first to last step with urgency

• Shipments are properly sent to and accepted by carriers

• Confident verbal escalation and written documentation of issues

• All shift handoffs are clearly verbalized via Zoom and documented in communication channel



Ideal Candidate Profile

• Experience in US logistics, freight brokerage, or track & trace (required)

• Familiarity with US geography and OTR operations (plus)

• Highly organized and tech-savvy, comfortable managing multiple spreadsheets and group chats

• Understands urgency and prioritization in a fast-paced freight environment

• Strong, professional communicator via chat and

• Able to multitask in real time while monitoring multiple active shipments

• Demonstrates strong attention to detail and sound judgment when resolving tracking or transit issues

• Manages time effectively in high volume operations, maintaining accuracy under pressure

• Follows instructions clearly and consistently

• Approaches work with a cooperative and team oriented mindset

• Open to guidance and feedback. Collaborates without resistance or ego



Schedule & Work Setup

Full Time | Monday Friday

7:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (San Antonio time)

Must work U.S. business hours

Zoom presence (with camera open and unmuted audio) required

Hubstaff time tracking in the future required



This role is not passive. It’s for people who want clear expectations, measurable output, and growth tied to performance.



Manage freight cleanly. Execute with urgency. Grow with GH Logistics.

title: Risk Associate
description:
AJG Transport is a fast-growing and safety-focused trucking company dedicated to delivering excellence on the road. We take risk management seriously and are looking for a proactive after-hours admin assistant to help us monitor, assess, and address issues as they arise during nighttime operations.



Position Overview

As our risk associate, you’ll be the first line of defense in identifying and mitigating potential risks, ensuring safe and smooth overnight operations. You will start by training on the day shift to learn our processes before transitioning to nights, where you’ll work independently while keeping leadership informed of critical issues.



Key Responsibilities

• Monitor trucking operations in real-time, identifying potential safety, compliance, and operational risks with a primary focus on Hours of Service (HOS) compliance and ELD.

• Respond to and escalate issues such as a
, delays, equipment failures, policy violations, and HOS infractions.

• Proactively monitor drivers in violation or nearing violation on an hourly basis to prevent potential risks.

• Conduct i
 investigations and document findings for leadership review, ensuring accurate reporting of HOS violations, operational concerns, and any irregularities uncovered during risk checks

• Collaborate closely with dispatch, drivers, and management to ensure quick resolution of issues and seamless coordination across shifts, ensuring that repairs are logged and invoices are uploaded and split in Loadstop for vehicles and trailers.

• Generate audit reports and provide insights on operational performance, compliance trends, and recurring issues to support decision-making.

• Send memos as necessary as part of regular communications to ensure compliance.

• Support seamless shift transitions by ensuring clear handoffs, completing or passing on pending tasks, and maintaining workflow continuity throughout the day.



Ideal Candidate Profile

• Experience in US trucking, logistics, fleet operations, dispatch, safety, compliance, or risk management (required)

• Hands on exposure to HOS monitoring, ELD systems, and FMCSA & DOT compliance standards (strong plus)

• Highly organized and tech-savvy, comfortable working across multiple systems (TMS, ELD, Google Workspace, MS Office)

• Able to monitor drivers and assets in real time, identifying potential violations or risks before escalation

• Understands urgency and prioritization in a fast-paced freight environment

• Demonstrates strong attention to detail and sound judgment when handling i
, violations, or irregularities

• Communicates clearly and professionally via chat,
, and i
 reports

• Maintains clean shift handoffs and ensures continuity across teams

• Able to multitask in real time while monitoring multiple drivers and assets

• Demonstrates strong attention to detail and sound judgment when resolving safety issues

• Follows instructions clearly and consistently

• Approaches work with a cooperative and team oriented mindset

• Open to guidance and feedback. Collaborates without resistance or ego

• Minimum typing speed of 50 words per minute.



Schedule & Work Setup

Full Time | 7 AM - 5 PM CST & 11 PM - 9 AM (San Antonio time)

Must work U.S. business hours

Zoom presence (with camera open and unmuted audio) required

Hubstaff time tracking in the future required



Apply Here: 



Remote | Full Time | Direct hire opportunity

Regular Schedule: 7 AM - 5 PM CST & 11 PM - 9 AM CST (San Antonio Texas Time)



If you’re a proactive problem-solver who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!

title: Social Seller and Engager
description:
About the Role



We are a fast growing, high energy small business looking for Social Sellers and Engagers who love conversations, community, and helping people find the right products and programs.



This is not a passive posting job.

You will be actively online throughout your shift, responding to comments and messages, engaging in conversations, and guiding people toward the right next step.



Customer service matters to us. Response time matters to us. Human, friendly conversations matter to us.



Shift Coverage (USA and Philippines Time Listed Clearly)



We are hiring for multiple shifts. Each hire will work one consistent shift only.



Shift 1: US Day Coverage



USA Time (Eastern): 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM



Philippines Time (PHT): 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM



Shift 2: US Evening Coverage



USA Time (Eastern): 5:00 PM to 1:00 AM



Philippines Time (PHT): 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM

Introduce products, programs, and events when people express interest

Maintain fast response times (tracked and reviewed)



Prioritize open conversations across platforms

Follow through until the customer’s question or concern is fully resolved



Team Communication



Communicate with your manager and team using Slack



Share updates, escalations, and follow ups clearly



Participate in daily coordination and feedback



AI Assisted Writing



Use AI tools to draft responses quickly



Keep responses human, conversational, and on brand



Adjust tone based on context and customer needs



What We’re Looking For



Excellent written English communication skills



Enjoys conversation and helping people



Experience with social media engagement, customer support, or social selling



Comfortable using tools like AgoraPulse, Slack, and WhatsApp



Confident using AI tools for writing assistance



Reliable, responsive, and organized



Team player who thrives in a fast paced environment



Able to remain active and engaged for the full duration of your shift



What Success Looks Like



Fast response times during your shift



High quality, friendly conversations



Customers feel heard, supported, and guided



Smooth collaboration with the team



Increased engagement and interest in products and events



Why Join Our Team:



Supportive and collaborative team



Clear expectations and daily feedback



Growing business with long term opportunities



Real impact on customer experience and revenue



How to Apply:



When applying, please include:



Which shift you are applying for



Your experience with social engagement or customer support



Your experience using AI tools for writing



Your experience with Slack or WhatsApp (if any)



But hold up!

If you love fast paced work, meaningful conversations, and being part of a growing team, this role is for you.



Looking forward to meeting you.
