title: Snr Paid Traffic Manager (META & PPC)
description:
???? Remote | Client-Facing Role



We are searching for a seasoned and strategic Meta and PPC expert to lead and oversee our paid advertising efforts. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing high-performing paid traffic campaigns across various platforms, managing a team, and generating data-driven insights to optimize campaign performance and maximize ROI for our healthcare clients.



You will leverage your in-depth knowledge of Meta & PPC best practices and campaign management to develop winning strategies, oversee a team of specialists, and ensure our clients achieve their digital marketing goals.



? What You’ll Do



Strategic Leadership:

- Collaborate with the marketing, content, and design teams to craft comprehensive (and novel) paid advertising strategies aligned with client objectives.

- Conduct thorough keyword research to identify high-volume, relevant keywords for either their local or even national paid PPC campaigns.

- Stay up-to-date on the latest Meta & PPC trends, paid platform updates, and industry best practices.

- Craft effective SOPs that roll out our own best practices and recipes.



Campaign Management & Optimization:

- Oversee the setup, management, and optimization of paid advertising campaigns across Meta 
, Instagram), Google Ads, and potentially other emerging platforms.

- Manage PPC budgets effectively and allocate resources to maximize return on investment (ROI).

- Analyze campaign performance data using industry-standard tools and identify areas for improvement.

- A/B test different ad variations and landing pages to optimize campaign performance.

- Refine these ad management roles so as to delegate to junior ad managers under your wing.



Team Management:

- Provide guidance and mentorship to a team of Meta & PPC specialists.

- Foster a collaborative team environment that promotes knowledge development and professional growth.

- Ensure effective communication and coordination between in-house and remote tea
mbers.

- Provide honest and regular feedback to tea
mbers.



Client Communication:

- Serve as the primary point of contact for client communication regarding all paid advertising initiatives.

- Proactively communicate campaign progress, performance updates, and key insights to clients.

- Address client questions and concerns promptly and professionally.

- Build and maintain strong client relationships based on trust and transparency.

- Troubleshoot any client misunderstanding or any internal kefuffels so as to repair & restore the clients trust and results. 



Reporting & Analysis:

- Generate reports that showcase campaign performance metrics and key insights for clients.

- Translate data into actionable recommendations to optimize campaign performance and client growth.

- For juniors: provide action plans for your juniors to ensure campaigns are updated and enhanced per your observations.





? What You'll Need to Succeed



Experience:

- Minimum of 4+ years of experience in paid social media advertising, including Meta Ads and Google Ads.

- Proven track record of building high-converting ad campaigns and driving significant ROI for clients in the healthcare or related industries (a plus).

- Experience leading and managing a team of Meta and PPC specialists (highly preferred).



Skills:

- Deep understanding of Meta & PPC advertising principles and best practices.

- Expertise in campaign strategy development, keyword research, ad copywriting, and landing page optimization.

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify trends.

- Excellent English written and verbal communication skills to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.

- Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., we use Asana) to manage team tasks and workflows (a plus).



Attributes:

- Proactive, self-motivated, and results-oriented with a passion for digital marketing and growing businesses.

- Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven approach to campaign optimization.

- Excellent leadership qualities with the ability to mentor and inspire a team.

- Positive, confident, and energetic with a collaborative work style (we are an enthusiastic bunch).

- Adaptable and eager to learn in a fast-paced and ever-changing industry.



? Bonus Points

- Previous experience in a marketing agency environment.

- Familiarity with tools like Asana, Slack, Google Ads, Meta Business Manager.

- Exposure to automation/chatbot tools like ManyChat or AI-assisted DMs.



???? Why You’ll Love Working With Us

- Fully remote role

- Opportunity to grow with a fast-scaling agency.

- Direct access to leadership & opportunity to make an impact.

- Competitive pay, with potential for performance-based bonuses.

- Join a goal-driven, collaborative, supportive, and forward-thinking team that values Accountability, Innovation, Teamwork, and Integrity. ?





Ready to join our team?

Send us your resume + a quick note on your experience with PPC/Facebook campaigns and why you’d be a great fit as Senior Paid Traffic Manager to

********

title: Remote Inside Sales Agent (Full-Time, PST Hours)
description:
**Work From Anywhere | Join a Fast-Growing Real Estate Investment Firm**



Are you a persuasive communicator who thrives in inside sales? Do you enjoy qualifying leads, setting high-quality appointments, and driving deals forward through consistent follow-up?



If you’re looking for a long-term remote career with a company that values growth, accountability, and integrity — this opportunity is for you.



About the Role

Position: Inside Sales Agent (ISA)

Location: Anywhere – 100% Remote

Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM Pacific Time

(Occasional weekend work up to 4 hours)

Work Hours: 40 hours/week



As an Inside Sales Agent, you’ll be the frontline sales professional responsible for handling inbound and outbound leads, qualifying motivated sellers, and setting appointments for our acquisitions team. You’ll play a critical role in driving revenue by ensuring only high-quality opportunities move forward.



You’ll work closely with a supportive, performance-driven team that values consistency, ownership, and continuous improvement.



Qualifications & Requirements 

* Minimum 6 months of experience as an Inside Sales Agent (REQUIRED)

* Experience handling high-volume inbound and outbound calls

* Background in real estate, wholesaling, acquisitions, or property sales is a strong plus

* Proven ability to qualify leads, uncover motivation, and handle objections

* Confident, professional, and persuasive phone presence

* Excellent English communication skills (clear, neutral accent preferred)

* Strong follow-up skills and ability to nurture leads over time

* Comfortable working with CRM systems, dialers, and lead management tools

* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and consistent with data entry and notes

* Self-motivated, reliable, and able to hit daily/weekly call and appointment targets

* Team-oriented mindset with a strong sense of accountability

* Positive attitude and genuine interest in building rapport and long-term relationships





Technical Requirements

* Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 50 Mbps) with backup connection

* Reliable laptop/desktop and smartphone

* Quiet, distraction-free workspace suitable for sales calls





About SV Ventures

SV Ventures is a California-based real estate investment firm specializing in residential fix-and-flip projects and new construction throughout the Bay Area. We manage the full lifecycle — acquisitions, design, renovations, and financing — and we’re growing rapidly.



Our culture is built on strong core values:

-Growth Mindset – We learn, adapt, and improve continuously

-Accountability – We take ownership and deliver results

-Relationships – We build trust through every interaction

-Transparency – We value honesty, integrity, and clear communication



If these values resonate with you, you’ll feel right at home here.



Compensation & Benefits

-Hourly Rate: $6–8/hour (based on experience)

-3th Month Pay Bonus (with the opportunity to earn beyond for exceptional performance)

-Property Sale Bonus: $50 per property sold (Average: 12–20 properties per year)

-Bi-weekly Pay

-Long-term, stable remote position with growth opportunities





How to Apply

Please submit the following:



1. Resume (PDF or Word format)

2. Screenshot of Internet Speed Test

3. Computer Specs (make, model, RAM, storage, year of manufacture)

4. 3-minute video (Loom or YouTube only) answering:

      -Tell us about yourself — your experience, education, and why you’re a strong fit for an Inside Sales Agent role

      -What do you believe are the most important qualities of a successful Inside Sales Agent?





Ready to grow with us?

Apply now and become part of a team that values your success as much as its own.



Join SV Ventures — where growth, accountability, and opportunity meet.

title: Video Editor – Meta Ads | Health & Beauty Brands (EU)
description:
We are hiring a full-time Video Editor with proven experience in creating and editing high-performing ad creatives for Meta 
 & Instagram), to support the scaling of our health & beauty e-commerce brands across the European market.



In this role, you will be responsible for editing and improving winning ad images and videos. You understand what makes creatives convert on Meta, how to hook attention in the first seconds, and how to optimize visuals for performance rather than just aesthetics.



You will work closely with our team to continuously improve ad creatives based on data and results.



Requirements:



- Proven experience editing Meta ad videos and images



- Strong proficiency in Canva for ad creatives (required)



- Experience in the health & beauty niche



- Strong understanding of direct-response ad creatives



- Ability to turn raw footage, UGC and assets into high-converting ads



- Experience working with European e-commerce markets



- Full-time availability and interest in a long-term role





What we offer:



- Hourly rate between $5–$10, based on experience and performance



- Performance-based bonuses for winning creatives



- Clear growth opportunities as ad spend and brands scale



- Supportive team with clear communication and fast feedback



- 100% remote, long-term position





Application process:



To apply, please provide:



- A short introduction about your background



- A brief explanation of your experience with Meta ad creatives



- 10–20 examples of ad videos or images you edited (Canva examples allowed)



- A short explanation of why you believe you are a strong fit for this role





Please note: applications without relevant Meta ads experience or creative examples will not be considered.

title: Video Creator
description:

, instagram, linkedin, tiktok, youtube

title: GHL Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Do you LOVE all things TECH, FUNNELS & DIGITAL MARKETING?



Do you get excited creating high-converting landing pages, opt-in pages,
 sequences, tagging systems, automations and funnels that actually convert?



Do you also enjoy making pages look beautiful, on-brand and professional — not just functional?



If so, CONGRATS — you may have just found your DREAM CAREER POSITION…



The Digital Marketing Specialist is a key support position for the company.



You will be responsible for managing, building and optimizing our Go High Level (GHL) CRM, marketing systems, and digital assets. Chances are you have experience with multiple CRMs (Active Campaign, InfusionSoft/Keap, Kartra, Go High Level, etc.) and are excited to be the KING or QUEEN of marketing automation, funnel building, tagging, and CRM management.



You have a special affinity and expert-level skill with Go High Level (GHL) — not just technically, but also from a marketing and conversion perspective.



We’re not into temporary hookups — and we won’t treat you as a short-term fix.

We are looking for someone who wants a LONG-TERM CAREER with a growing company.



Here are the benefits you can earn:



- HMO

- PTO

- Internet allowance

- Generator

- Performance reviews

- …and a LOT more!



If you don’t want a long-term career with growth potential, please do NOT apply.



This is a FULL-TIME (40 hours/week) position.



This is a long-term career opportunity, with 13th-month pay and benefits after 90 days of successful performance. In exchange, we require an exclusive commitment — no outside clients, freelancing, or part-time jobs.



Must be willing to work US hours and have at least 2 years experience working US hours.



Compensation

Php 65,000 – 90,000 per month for full-time hours (based on experience)



Responsibilities



- Go High Level (GHL) CRM management – building, maintaining and optimizing all systems

- Building and managing landing pages, opt-in pages, funnels and websites inside GHL

- Creating and managing
 sequences, workflows, triggers and automations

- Tagging, segmentation and contact organization for proper tracking and follow-up

- Uploading, organizing and maintaining trainings, recordings, courses and memberships inside GHL

- CRM database management and technical support (Active Campaign, InfusionSoft/Keap, Kartra, Go High Level, etc.)

- Managing
 marketing tasks: setting up, tracking and updating the CRM

- Making sure naming protocols, tagging systems and workflows are followed

- Providing tech support, troubleshooting and fixing tech glitches

- Submitting support tickets and resolving platform issues

- Creating and editing membership portals and training hubs

- Tech Wellness Checklist (monthly)

- Assisting with Launches & Content Marketing Team as needed

- Updating & scheduling
 sequences

- Calendar management & updates in GCal and web portals

- Fixing technology and backend glitches and issues



The Ideal Candidate Will:



- MUST know CRMs inside & out — at least 2+ years of experience, specifically Go High Level

- Be highly skilled in funnels, automations, tagging, workflows and
 marketing

- Have graphic design skills and the ability to make pages look beautiful, professional and on-brand

- Have experience designing high-converting landing pages and funnels

- Have some social media experience — creating Reels, graphics and posts

- LOVE tech and know too many platforms to list

- Be proficient in GDrive & GSuite

- Be a self-starter who thrives in a team environment

- Like structure, routine and consistently meeting deadlines

- Be meticulous and detail-oriented

- Type at least 45 WPM

- Understand automation logic (if/then)

- Get tasks done right the first time

- Be tech-savvy and able to learn new tools quickly

- Excel at creating workflow efficiencies and automation



Experience with Technology & Tools



- Too many to list — you LOVE technology

- At least 2 years of Go High Level experience

- Project Management tools (Asana, Trello, Monday, ClickUp)

- Time Doctor (or similar time-tracking tools)

- Slack

- Google Drive



NEXT STEPS



If this position sounds like YOU and you’re jumping for joy at this opportunity, follow these instructions carefully:



Send your updated resume/CV and cover letter answering the following questions to:





1. What attracts YOU to this position & why are you the BEST candidate?

2. What qualities make you a great TEA
MBER?

3. Which CRMs do you have experience with and for how many years?



This is no time to be bashful -- sell yourself. If you don’t, no one else will ????



Thanks and GOOD LUCK!

title: Structural Engineer-Remote
description:
We are looking for a high-quality structural engineer to design our development projects, including resorts, villas, and multi-building sites.

Responsibilities

• Structural analysis and design for concrete and/or steel buildings

• Gravity and lateral load calculations

• ETABS / SAFE / SAP2000 / similar modeling

• Structural drawings and details

• Coordination with architects and MEP engineers

• Value engineering and constructability input

• Writing clear calculation reports

• Code-based design (ACI, AISC, IBC, ASCE, etc.)

• Redline reviews and revisions

Requirements (Important)

Please apply only if you meet most of these:

? Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering

? 3+ years of real structural design experience

? Strong understanding of load paths and lateral systems

? Proficient in structural software (ETABS, SAFE, SAP2000, etc.)

? Can explain your design decisions clearly

? Organized, detail-oriented

? Can work independently

? Strong written English

title: Senior GoHighLevel (GHL) Specialist
description:
Overview

We’re looking for a Senior GoHighLevel (GHL) Specialist to lead complex migrations, advanced automations, and custom system setups. You’ll take messy or high-stakes systems and transform them into scalable, revenue-ready workflows.

This is a senior-level role: you must be comfortable designing systems, executing advanced setups, and guiding teams or clients on technical decisions.

Responsibilities

Complex Migrations

Lead full-scale migrations from CRMs like HubSpot, ClickFunnels, ActiveCampaign, Keap, Salesforce, Kajabi, and custom platforms.





Audit legacy systems and design optimized GHL architectures.





Migrate contacts, opportunities, workflows, tags, pipelines, and historical data with minimal downtime.





Identify and resolve data integrity, automation, and deliverability issues.





Advanced System Architecture & Custom Builds

Design multi-account and multi-location GHL systems.





Build complex workflows with conditional logic, webhooks, APIs, and external integrations.





Develop custom pipelines, lead routing, and lifecycle automations.





Create reusable snapshots and scalable system frameworks.





Automation & Integrations

Implement sophisticated automation across SMS,
, voi
, calendars, and pipelines.





Integrate GHL with third-party tools (Zapier, Make, Stripe, Slack, Google Workspace, Twilio, Meta, APIs).





Troubleshoot complex automation failures and integration issues.





Deliverability, Compliance & Optimization

Maintain
 deliverability infrastructure (SPF, DKIM, DMARC, domain setup).





Ensure compliance with TCPA, opt-ins, and unsubscribe processes.





Optimize performance, reporting, and automation efficiency.





Documentation & Support

Document system architecture, workflows, and migrations.





Perform QA testing pre- and post-launch.





Provide advanced technical support and training as needed.





Required Skills & Experience

5+ years in CRM systems and marketing automation.





2+ years hands-on GoHighLevel experience (advanced/expert level).





Proven experience in complex CRM migrations.





Deep understanding of GHL workflows, triggers, campaigns, pipelines, snapshots, and custom values.





Knowledge of APIs, webhooks, and tools like Zapier or Make.





Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.





Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.





Nice-to-Have

Experience with agencies, SaaS, franchises, or high-ticket sales teams.





Familiarity with attribution/call tracking and reporting.





Experience with white-label GHL environments.





Background in funnel strategy, CRO, or revenue operations.





Success Metrics

Migrations completed without data loss or downtime.





Systems are scalable, clean, and reduce manual work.





Automations are stable, reliable, and well-documented.





Minimal escalations thanks to proactive design and QA.



If you’re qualified, send your updated resume to

title: HVAC Cold Caller - **HIRING ASAP** - READ DETAILS CAREFULLY SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY
description:
Position Details: Cold Caller in HVAC Industry  - WARM LEADS** ARE PROVIDED

Company: Reliance Home Comfort 



Reliance Home Comfort is a large Canadian home services company specializing in HVAC, water heaters, plumbing, and related protection plans, with over 60 years in the industry and thousands of employees across Canada and the U.S.



Compensation in CAD currency.

Base Pay: $375 per month (Minimum $520 a month, Tier One** is Required for job position, read below)  

Pay Schedule: Bi-weekly (paid every other Thursday)



Working Hours: 



10:00 AM EST – 6:00 PM EST



Bonus Structure: 



Tier One: $145 bonus for 30 appointments per month  (MINIMUM REQUIREMENT TO UPHOLD JOB POSITION) 

Tier Two: $195 bonus for 60 appointments per month

Tier Three: $290 bonus for 90 appointments per month



Bonus Pay Schedule: Paid on the first payroll following the completion of the previous month.



Performance & Growth:



Eligible for a pay raise after 1–3 months, based solely on performance

Minimum requirement: 30 appointments per month

Progress and results are actively tracked and recorded



Break Policy:



Two (2) breaks per shift, 15 minutes each

A third break may be granted based on strong performance

All breaks must be announced in the group chat prior to starting



Time Off & Holidays:



Time off must be requested at least 24 hours in advance

Holiday bonus pay will be provided



Requirements:



Proven sales or cold-calling experience

Reliable primary internet connection plus backup Wi-Fi

Backup power supply

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

No simultaneous employment or juggling of multiple jobs during scheduled hours

(Failure to comply will result in immediate termination)



Role Expectations:



Work the full scheduled shift (10:00 AM – 6:00 PM EST). All activity is tracked.

Maintain honesty, transparency, and open communication.

Operate independently and manage time effectively.

Meet or exceed performance expectations consistently.

Notify management at least one day in advance for any time-off requests.

Micromanagement will not be necessary unless performance or conduct issues arise.



We are looking for motivated individuals who are ready to perform, grow, and succeed. Let’s build results, stay consistent, and make money while doing it

title: Marketing Coordinator for Real Estate Agent
description:
DO NOT USE CHAT GPT TO WRITE YOUR RESPONSES TO ME (Trust me - I will know). 



Please send:

1) A brief introduction and your relevant real estate experience

2) A portfolio link if you have one.

3) Direct links to the blog writing samples that demonstrate your SEO/GEO abilities

4) Your typical availability and preferred working schedule

5) Your hourly rate 



I am hiring a highly organized, proactive marketer with real estate industry knowledge, strong written content creation abilities (blogs), and video editing/graphic design abilities. This role requires a blend of content writing, video editing, SEO, basic graphic design, CRM management, research, social media, and operational support. Use of AI tools and Chat GPT will be involved.



This role would be for a minimum 20 hours a week. You will be paid HOURLY, not a flat rate and not a salary. The pay is $6/hour. After an initial training period, you can work flexible hours. You must speak and write fluent US English.





The role will include:



1. Real Estate Content Writing (High Priority)

- Write SEO-optimized blog posts, guides, and neighborhood/city pages using Chat GPT as a starting point and your own abilities/my input to fill in any gaps in quality or accuracy. Topics will be provided to you initially and then you will be encouraged to come up with your own suggestions once you are more familiar with the content.

- Draft scripts and outlines for videos, newsletters, social posts, and guides while maintaining my voice, brand messaging, and content standards

- Upload, format, and optimize blog posts in Wix (instructions will be provided)



2. Video Creation & Editing

- Create and edit videos in Canva with captions, jump cuts, B-roll, overlays, etc.

- Upload videos across YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram,
, and others

- Write SEO-friendly titles, descriptions, and tags



3. Graphic Design & Marketing Materials

- Design postcards, flyers, social graphics, and presentations using Canva.

- Update and maintain my marketing materials as requested

- Create digital and print assets for seminars, guides, and outreach



4. Website & SEO Support

- Update website pages in Wix (marketing services, city pages, blogs, landing pages) including optimizing page titles and meta descriptions, adding internal linking, ensuring brand consistency across all pages and assets, and creating new pages as requested.



5. Social Media Management

- Engage as me with local businesses and professionals on LinkedIn/Facebook (instructions provided)

- Using my
 page, share content strategically across
 Groups (instructions provided)

- Create and schedule posts using Wix Marketing Manager (instructions provided)



6. Directory Listings & Review Management

- Manage Google Business Profile, Bing Places, Yelp and other directory listings

- Repost verified client reviews across major real estate platforms

- Build and optimize profiles on RateMyAgent, HomeLight, Zillow, 
, etc (instructions provided)



7.Other Administrative & CRM Tasks

- Update CRM, mange files, fill out form submissions for me, etc. (instructions provided)



**Required Skills & Experience

- Real Estate Experience (Non-Negotiable). You must have a basic understanding of the USA real estate industry.

- Writing & SEO: You must be capable of producing accurate, engaging, and SEO-optimized real estate content.

Your subject line must follow this exact format, so I know you read the full post:



roofjefe / Your Age / Current Role



Example:

roofjefe / 23 / student



Applications without a video link will not be considered. No video = No interview

title: Online Chat Salesperson
description:
WARNING: DO NOT APPLY WITH CHAT GPT. ANY AI USE, IN THE APPLICATION OR DURING AN INTERVIEW, WILL BE DETECTED.



This is NOT a DATA-ENTRY or CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for AGGRESSIVE candidates.



SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY - PUNCTUAL, TEACHABLE, DISCIPLINED



STRONG ENGLISH is a MUST, WRITTEN AND SPOKEN.



Job description:



Selling to and upselling over online chat to people who have indicated interest in the product. This is a SALES position, NOT a CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for COMPETITIVE, DRIVEN, and HUNGRY candidates. Our standards are HIGH. You will work as a part of a TEAM, but you are responsible for YOUR OWN SUCCESS. The ideal candidate is between the ages of 18-25 and has ENERGY and AMBITION.





Compensation:



You will be paid hourly and in commission if your commission exceeds your hourly. After your trial period you will be expected to consistently exceed your hourly. If you are unable to meet the daily sales target after the trial period, you will be let go. You will be expected to make enough sales to AT LEAST earn $40 per shift. With skill and motivation a salesperson can exceed this amount multiple times over.





Hard Requirements:



- Adequate internet connection

- Adequate PC setup

- EXCELLENT written and AND spoken English

- SPEED. You may be juggling 10 or more chats at the same time and each requires your full attention to EARN

- WORK ETHIC: You will be expected to stay focused and active for the entire duration of your shift

Everything else can be taught.





Nice to have:



- Understanding of modern internet culture/
s

- Exposure to video games and other media from the US

- Charisma

- Post-secondary education (we'll accept it as an indicator of competence as long as you can provide us with the diploma)



This is NOT an easy job, but it can be VERY LUCRATIVE with talent and especially hard work.





Repeating: Applications written by AI will be detected and rejected immediately. Chosen candidates are to expect a thorough interview (1 hour). No hard feelings if the interview is cut short, it means we have d
 you're not a good fit.



Full time ONLY

title: SEO Content Specialist

We’re a growing business looking for a hands-on SEO Specialist to manage and execute our organic search efforts, with a strong focus on local SEO, content optimization, and lead generation. Monitor organic performance and recommend improvements to increase traffic and inbound leads

Collaborate with marketing and web teams on SEO-driven content and site updates

Support occasional SEO-related communications when needed



REQUIREMENTS

Strong written and verbal English communication skills

At least 2 years of experience in an SEO or related role

Experience with local SEO, including service-area and location-based pages

Experience working directly in WordPress and basic HTML/CSS

Solid understanding of keyword intent, headers, metadata, internal linking, and content structure

Experience using SEO tools for research and optimization

Comfortable using AI tools to improve speed and efficiency in content workflows

Availability to work aligned with U.S. business hours

Ability to start within a short transition period after job offer



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

Comfortable in using time-trackers

Own laptop/desktop, noise-cancelling headphones, and webcam

Salary based on your qualifications

Paid time off

Salary increase

 your resume to

title: Real Estate Photo Editor/Quality Control
description:
We are seeking an individual who thrives in a collaborative team environment, demonstrates enthusiasm, and takes initiative. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide effective solutions are essential. The ideal candidate should be organized and capable of enhancing our existing systems.



Responsibilities:

Primary responsibility involves meticulously reviewing each image received from our editing house, ensuring consistency and adherence to our brand standards. This entails identifying mistakes or inconsistencies in the editing process to maintain a unified visual style.



If content falls short of our brand standards, the candidate will be required to either send it back with revision requests or make necessary adjustments, including exposure, color correction, cropping, and other enhancements, to ensure a professional and appealing look.



Proficiency in photo editing software such as Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom is a must. A solid understanding of various editing techniques and tools available in these programs is expected.



Effective communication and collaboration with photographers and the scheduling team are crucial. The candidate will closely work with them to comprehend clients' specific requirements, ensuring that the final images align with their vision.



Management and prioritization of a substantial volume of images within tight deadlines is a key responsibility. The candidate should employ efficient workflows and demonstrate strong time management skills to complete editing tasks punctually.



A keen eye for detail is indispensable in identifying and rectifying imperfections or inconsistencies in the images.



Maintenance of an organized file structure and the use of proper naming conventions for edited images are critical. This facilitates easy access, retrieval, and sharing of files with both clients and tea
mbers.



Reach out to clients in a timely manner and effectively response to clients' revision requests is vital for ensuring customer satisfaction.



Required Experience:

Virtual Staging

Proficient in Photoshop and Lightroom

Exposure blending

Luminosity masks

Layer masking

Color correction and grading

Sky replacement

Virtual dusk

--

Tuesday - Saturday 6am-2pm EST

Dont forget to send link of your CVs and  your portfolio. Other candidate forgets that. So dont miss it! :)



In your message  write "I bring magic" in the first sentence of your application letter. This will be our identifier that you have completely read our job post up to the end because we are seeking for the someone who is very keen to details.

title: Technical Project Coordinator
description:
Position: Technical Project Coordinator



Location: Remote (Philippines)



Job Type: Full-time



Work Schedule: 9:30 AM- 4:30 PM (PST)



Base Salary: PHP 55,000 - 68,000 per month



Role Overview:

Were looking for a Technical Project Coordinator to support our engineering and operations teams by keeping work organized, visible, and moving forward.



This role focuses on execution support and task hygiene — making sure requests are properly captured, tasks are clear and updated, follow-ups happen on time, and nothing falls through the cracks. Youll work closely with developers, project leads, and leadership (including Jhun) to help projects stay on track.



This is an excellent role for someone who is detail-oriented, proactive, and looking to grow into a technical project or operations role.



Key Responsibilities:



Tasks Management via ClickUp

- Create ClickUp tasks from Slack threads, requests, or discussions

- Ensure every task has the correct status, assignee, priority, due date, and acceptance notes

- Keep tasks updated as work progresses and close tasks properly when done

- Break down incoming requests into basic subtasks and checklists

- Flag unclear requirements, missing details, or open questions for review by the Technical Project Manager

- Help ensure tasks are actionable before work starts

- Follow up with task owners regularly to ensure progress

- Raise blockers early and escalate when tasks are stuck

- Ensure no task remains in In Progress without movement



Communication

- Post short, clear updates in Slack covering: whats done, whats next, and whats blocked

- Tag the right people to ensure visibility and quick responses

- Support smooth communication between teams



Documentation via Confluence

- Keep Confluence pages clean, accurate, and up to date

- Add links to relevant tasks, notes, screenshots, and decisions

- Help maintain organized documentation for ongoing work



Issue Intake & Routing

- Gather complete issue details, including: reproduction steps, sample request or payload, error messages, affected client or system, relevant logs or links.

- Route issues to the appropriate development team with clear context



Requirements:

- At least 2 years of experience in project coordination, operations, or a similar support role

- Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills

- Comfortable using ClickUp, Slack, and documentation tools

- Clear written and verbal communication skills

- Willingness to ask questions and flag unclear information

[ Ability to follow processes and execute consistently

- Comfortable working in a remote, fast-paced environment



Nice to Have:

- Exposure to technical teams, software projects, or APIs

- Experience working with startups or small, fast-moving teams.

- Experience supporting data-driven or infrastructure-heavy products.



Benefits & Perks:

Fully Remote Work – Work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection

Healthcare Coverage – We provide health benefits for you and your familys well-being

Leave Days, Vacation Time, and Paid Holidays – Recharge and take the time you need

Equipment Funds – Get support to set up or upgrade your home office

Profit Sharing – Monthly and annual bonuses tied to company performance

Long-Term Employment – We value tea
mbers who grow with us

Collaborative Team Culture – Work with a supportive and globally distributed team



About Us:

AutoScale Ventures is a technology-driven company with 50+ tea
mbers across the Philippines, Pakistan, India, the U.S., China, and Canada. We operate a group of businesses spanning tech, data services, infrastructure, and AI. Some of our main products and ventures include:



Vehicle data (
)

Proxy Infrastructure solutions (
)

title: Digital Wholesale Manager (Faire)
description:
Location: Remote (U.S. preferred)

Type: Contract or 

Reports to: Sales Manager



About R. Riveter



R. Riveter is a mission-driven, American-assembled handbag and accessories brand that supports military spouses through flexible employment and entrepreneurship. As we continue to scale our wholesale channel, we’re looking for a Digital Wholesale Manager to own and grow our presence on Faire and related digital wholesale platforms.



This role is ideal for someone who is both strategic and hands-on, thrives in data, and understands how to drive wholesale growth through smart merchandising, account optimization, and retailer relationships.



Role Overview



The Digital Wholesale Manager will own the performance and day-to-day management of our Faire wholesale channel, ensuring it is optimized, growing, and aligned with our brand, inventory, and financial goals. You will work cross-functionally with merchandising, inventory planning, marketing, and leadership to drive profitable wholesale growth.



Key Responsibilities

Faire Channel Ownership



Fully own and manage the R. Riveter Faire account



Optimize storefront, collections, pricing, assortments, and promotions



Manage product uploads, descriptions, photography, and merchandising strategy



Monitor and improve conversion, reorder rates, and retailer engagement



Wholesale Growth & Strategy



Develop and execute strategies to grow wholesale revenue and active retailer accounts



Analyze sales performance, reorder behavior, and category trends



Identify opportunities for new product launches, bundles, and exclusives for wholesale



Coordinate Faire promotions, campaigns, and marketplace opportunities



Retailer Relationships & Operations



Serve as the primary point of contact for inbound wholesale retailers via Faire



Respond to retailer inquiries promptly and professionally



Partner with operations to ensure smooth order fulfillment, timelines, and inventory alignment



Track and report on wholesale KPIs, forecasting needs, and risks



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Work closely with merchandising and inventory planning to ensure wholesale demand is supported



Align with marketing on product storytelling and seasonal positioning



Provide leadership with regular reporting and insights on wholesale performance



Qualifications



Proven experience managing Faire or other digital wholesale platforms



Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into action



Experience in wholesale, retail buying, merchandising, or sales operations (DTC + wholesale a plus)



Highly organized, proactive, and comfortable owning outcomes



Clear communicator who can explain performance and priorities to non-technical teammates



Experience in fashion, accessories, or consumer goods strongly preferred

title: Part-Time Shopify Expert Needed Urgently (Immediate Start)
description:
We are looking for a part-time Shopify Expert to help us improve our premiu
n’s skincare store. The website is already built and working, but we need someone who can make the design cleaner, improve the user experience, and increase conversions.



Your tasks will include updating Shopify Liquid and CSS, improving the layout, fixing mobile issues, making small design changes, and creating better elements like badges, buttons, and offers. You will also help improve the product page, the checkout flow, page structure, and overall look and feel. Our brand style is clean, simple, and modern, so we want someone who understands minimalist design.



We are looking for someone with experience in Shopify Liquid, HTML, and CSS. You should understand basic CRO (conversion rate optimization) and know how to make small improvements that lead to better results. Good communication is important, and you should be able to work independently.



This is a part-time, ongoing job with flexible hours. We offer a long-term working relationship, clear tasks, fast communication, and a friendly environment. You will work directly with the founder.



Before starting, we will have a short call to go over the tasks, goals, and priorities.



If you want to apply, please send your Shopify work (preferably clean or minimalist designs) and a short explanation of your experience. Please start your application with the word “ROUTINE” so we know you read the full post.

title: OBM/PM - Operations & Project Manager
description:
We are hiring a senior-level Operations & Client Project Manager to own internal coordination, client project flow, and team communication for a multi-entity consulting online-based healthcare business. This is not a task-only position. This role requires independent thinking, strong judgment, and the ability to organize, prioritize, and move complex projects forward without constant direction.



The goal of this role is simple:

Client work moves forward smoothly, the team is well coordinated, and the executive is not the bottleneck for communication.



Role structure

• Part-time: workload equivalent to ~variable 16–24 hours per week max

• Flat monthly stipend (outcome-based, not hourly)

• Long-term role for the right fit into Full-Time

• Fully remote



Business context

• Multi-Entity Healthcare consulting and online membership business

• Multiple concurrent client projects

• Small internal team (contractors + staff)

• Fast-moving, high-responsibility environment



Core responsibilities

Project ownership

• Own the internal execution of projects after the scope is defined

• Break projects into clear tasks, owners, and timelines

• Track progress and unblock issues

• Ensure deliverables move forward without executive intervention



Team coordination

• Serve as the primary point of coordination for consultants, auditors, and contractors

• Ensure clear task ownership and deadlines

• Follow up on open items and missed deadlines

• Reduce reliance on the executive for day-to-day coordination



Operations & workflow management

• Maintain and manage projects and deliverables

• Translate priorities into clear, executable plans

• Create and refine SOPs as patterns emerge



Executive leverage

• Take ideas, voice notes, or high-level direction and operationalize them

• Minimize back-and-forth questions by thinking through next steps

• Escalate only what truly requires executive decision-making



Communication & documentation

• Run internal check-ins or updates as needed

• Draft clear summaries, next steps, and action items

• Ensure nothing lives only “in someone’s head” 

• Check in with contractors on deadlines



What success looks like

• Client projects move forward without chasing

• Tea
mbers are clear on responsibilities and communicate needs

• Problems are solved or escalated with solutions

• Executive is no longer the default project manager



Required experience (no exceptions)

• 5+ years of experience in operations, OBM, program management, or project management

• Experience supporting healthcare, service-based, or consulting businesses

• Proven ability to manage multiple projects independently

• Strong judgment and decision-making skills



Compensation

• Flat monthly stipend: $700

• Based on experience and demonstrated capability

• Scope and compensation revisited if workload materially changes



Within the first 30 days, the following must be demonstrated:

• At least one active client project is fully organized and moving forward without executive involvement

• Asana is actively managed and reflects real project status

• Team communication flows through this role instead of the executive

• Issues are identified and addressed proactively

• Minimal direction is required after the initial context is provided



**If ongoing step-by-step direction or repeated clarification for standard decisions is required, the engagement will end immediately**

title: Senior AI Video Editor (Direct Response / Meta Ads – Health Niche)
description:
We are looking for a top-tier video editor who specializes in direct-response advertising and understands how to create high-converting short-form video ads for Meta.



This role is for someone who works fast, thinks creatively, and understands how to turn concepts, hooks, and briefs into engaging ad creatives that drive measurable results.



If you are not confident you are among the best in your field, this role is likely not a fit. We maintain high standards and screen candidates carefully.



Responsibilities

 • Edit high-performing video ads for Meta (UGC style, storytelling, product demos, short-form formats)

 • Translate creative briefs into compelling video concepts quickly

 • Produce multiple variations and iterations for testing

 • Apply feedback and revisions efficiently

 • Maintain consistent quality across large creative batches

 • Research competitor ads and identify winning video formats and hooks

 • Source and assemble supporting footage, visuals, and storytelling elements creatively (stock, public sources, licensed footage, AI-generated content, etc.)

 • Combine AI-generated assets with real footage and motion graphics to produce unique, high-converting creatives

 • Continuously test new editing styles, pacing, hooks, and storytelling formats to improve performance

title: GHL Expert
description:
Virtual Assistant – CRM & Automation Specialist (Go High Level + ChiroHD + Google + Slack)

Part-Time | Remote | $6/hour | 5 hrs/week



About Us:

We’re a small, purpose-driven chiropractic office that’s growing fast—and we’re ready to modernize how we connect with and support our patients. We’re in the early stages of implementing a CRM system and need a tech-savvy, self-starting Virtual Assistant to lead the charge with Go High Level and document the process with Loom. If you're a systems thinker with a passion for automation and client journey design, we want to work with you!



Role Overview:

This role is laser-focused on setting up, optimizing, and automating our CRM using Go High Level. You will be responsible for helping us build out the backend—from pipelines to forms, from funnels to follow-ups—and ensuring everything integrates smoothly with our existing tools (Google tools). You’ll need to work independently, guide us through what we don’t know, and help create a CRM that feels like an extension of our heart-led practice.



Key Responsibilities:

Set up and customize our Go High Level account 



Build automations, workflows, tags, pipelines, calendars,
/SMS templates, and nurture sequences especially for FB ad leads and lead collections.



Create simple sales funnels and lead forms for our website and events



Integrate with Google tools (Drive, Sheets, Forms, Calendar)



Recommend and implement best practices for patient lead capture, onboarding, and retention



Provide weekly updates and communicate clearly about next steps, challenges, and suggestions



Weekly training Loom videos to teach us the process



Troubleshoot and problem-solve independently, but loop us in for key decisions



Ideal Candidate/Requirements:

3+ years of hands-on experience with Go High Level 



Proven experience building lead funnels, automations, and landing pages in Go High Level



Proficient with Google Workspace integrations + squarespace website. 



Proactive, resourceful, and solution-oriented



Comfortable guiding clients who aren’t tech experts



Strong written and verbal communication skills



Strong initiative and leadership mindset—able to lead without needing step-by-step instructions



Bonus: Experience working with health, wellness, or coaching businesses. Especially working with Chiropractors





Details:

5-10 hours per week



$6 USD/hour (paid biweekly via Wise)



Flexible schedule, but must overlap at least 1 hour/week with EST for check-ins



Initial contract for 1–3 months with potential to grow based on performance



How to Apply:

Please send the following:

A cover letter or portfolio clearly stating your years of Go High Level experience



Links to any live Go High Level landing pages or funnels you have personally built



Your current availability for an EST timezone (specific days and times)



Confirmation that you’re comfortable with the hourly rate and weekly hours



*Candidates who submit all requested materials and demonstrate clear, relevant experience will be prioritized for interviews.A portfolio or description of a Go High Level setup you’ve done (screenshots or Loom welcome!)





What It’s Like to Work With Us:

You’ll be working directly with the doctors in a highly supportive, collaborative environment. We’re kind, driven, and focused on serving our patients well—but we’re also learning as we go. We’ll trust you to lead this part of our business and will give you the freedom to make it excellent.

title: Acquisition Assistant
description:
We are currently looking for a remote Acquisition Assistant to support our operations in California. This role will play a key part in assisting the acquisitions team with day-to-day administrative and operational tasks. The ideal candidate is highly organized, master in time management, detail-oriented, and comfortable working remotely while supporting a fast-paced U.S.-based operation.





Responsibilities:

Employ strategies that will generate responses from motivated sellers, such as

1. Direct mail marketing.

2. Online marketing (social media).

3. Cold Calling

4. Text blast. Knowledge in REIREPLY is a plus.

5. Building great relationship with Agents.

6. Networking with wholesalers and broker.

- Respond to all leads in a timely manner to drive business forward.

- Manage leads and follow up through daily CRM use to update and stay on task until deals are closed.

purchase agreement and other business administration paperwork in advance of real estate transactions.

- Act as an intermediary between the sellers/wholesaler/agent and the company to ensure a smooth close.

7. Due diligence for potential deals.

Qualifications:

- Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, with strong phone skills; ability to set and close appointments over the phone.

- Knowledgeable in MLS, Redfin, Docusign, Reireply, Property Radar, Prosptream and Podio.

- Flexible in a changing work environment.

- Excellent in multitasking and problem-solving skills.

- Dedicated to growing the client's business.

- Strong work ethic.

- Master in time management and is fully committed to responsibilities.

title: Cold Caller / Appointment Setter (U.S Clients) (Part-Time, Long-Term)
description:
We are a U.S.-based digital services company working with local service businesses (auto detailing, home services, etc.).

We are hiring ONE motivated cold caller who is serious about performance, consistency, and long-term work.





This role is not for people looking to “just try” calling.

What You’ll Be Doing

-Making outbound calls to U.S.-based businesses

-Delivering a clear, structured pitch (script provided)

-Qualifying interest and booking demo appointments

-Logging call outcomes accurately in our CRM

-Working independently without constant supervision



Schedule (Non-Negotiable)

-Monday–Friday

-9:00 AM – 12:00 PM (PST)

-Consistent attendance is required

*Hours will increase as the company grows for top performers only*



Pay & Incentives

-Hourly pay (paid weekly)

-Bonus for every demo booked that converts into a paying client

-Additional incentives for strong and consistent performance

-Higher pay and expanded hours based strictly on results

**We reward performance and effort, not time-wasting.**



This Role Is NOT For You If

-You need frequent or long breaks

-You dislike cold calling

-You need constant reminders or supervision

-You cannot stay focused for 3-hour work blocks

-You are uncomfortable speaking confidently in English



Requirements

-Clear, confident English speaking voice

-Stable internet connection

-Noise-free working environment

-Reliable headset/microphone

-Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural



Willing to be tracked by call logs and CRM activity



Application Instructions (READ CAREFULLY)

-Applications that do not follow these steps will be ignored.

-Brief introduction about yourself

-Any previous cold calling or sales experience (if none, say so honestly)

-Confirmation you can work 9:00 AM – 12:00 PM PST

-Your internet speed and headset/mic setup



Voice Sample (Required):

-Record a short voice sample (30–60 seconds) introducing yourself

-Upload it to Vocaroo and include the link in your application

-Example prompt:

“Hi, my name is ___. I’m applying for the cold caller position. I’m comfortable making outbound calls and booking appointments.”



No voice sample = no response.



Trial Period

-This position starts with a short paid trial period.

Only applicants who demonstrate effort, reliability, and results will continue long-term.



Why This Is a Good Opportunity

-Clear expectations

-Performance-based bonuses

-Growing company with room to increase hours and pay

-Direct communication with the business owner



Final Note



We are looking for someone who takes ownership of their work and wants to grow with the company.

If that’s you, apply with care.

title: Credit Repair VA
description:
Im looking for an experienced credit repair VA. I need someone who knows what they’re doing & is up to date with all the new techniques to clean a credit report.



My most recent VAs have been working on 7 clients for the past 9 months and haven’t gotten through.  The negative accounts will come off and then 5 days Later they’ll come right back. I’m sick of it and I cannot move forward with this.  



I need a Credit repair specialist who can consistently clean reports in a timely fashion and keep negative items from coming back.



My offered pay to take care of my current clients is $75 per week to get things up to speed. Once I see you’ve taken care of that I will move into full time to obtain new clients and pay will increase to $100 per week.



Any questions please reach out thanks

title: Real Estate Executive VA
description:
Job Overview ---



We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Transaction Coordinator & Virtual Assistant to join our growing real estate team. This isn't just a data-entry role; you will be the "glue" that holds our transactions together, ensuring every deadline is met, every document is signed, and our clients receive world-class service from contract to close.



Compensation & Benefits ---



Monthly Salary: Starts at Php 50,000 – Php 60,000 (based on experience); potential for salary increases as certain milestones and job expectations are met

Payment Schedule: Paid twice a month

Leave: Paid work holidays + 7 days paid vacation (increases by 1 day per year)

Bonus: 13th-month pay (prorated for the first year)



Key Responsibilities ---



1. Transaction Coordination (The Core)

Manage the full "Contract to Close" process: Prepare contracts, listing agreements, disclosures, and addendums.

Update and maintain Brivity, CTM, and Bolt with 100% accuracy.

Coordinate with title companies, lenders, and brokers to ensure file compliance.

Track critical dates/deadlines and notify agents and clients daily.

Manage MLS status changes (Coming Soon, Active, UC, Sold).



2. Daily Operations &
 Management

Monitor "Transactions & Homes"
 and Google Chats; triage high-priority items.

Update Google Calendars with transaction dates and meeting invites.

Maintain the Vendor List, Agent Tools pages, and Team Resources.

Track lender opportunities and recruiter job boards (Indeed, 
).



3. Marketing & Social Media

Coordinate social media daily: Create/get posts and share on our pages.

Monitor marketing sites and Homebot.ai for replies and inquiries.

Send client "Testimonial Tree" requests and follow-up
s post-closing.



Required Skills & Experience ---



Experience: Must have a solid background in US-based Real Estate transaction coordination.

Tech Stack: Proficiency in Brivity, CTM eContracts, Bolt, and Google Workspace (Suites) is highly preferred.

Marketing: Experience managing social media platforms for business and basic marketing tasks.

Communication: Neutral English (written and verbal) for interacting with agents, clients, and title companies.

Traits: High level of ownership, "zero-inbox" mentality, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

title: Commercial Mortgage Loan Processor
description:

About Us:



We are a growing mortgage brokerage focused on fast, accurate, and compliant lending. Our team values clear communication, efficiency, and a deep understanding of mortgage guidelines. We are looking for an experienced Mortgage Broker Underwriter to join our fully remote team.

Minimum 6 months of experience in the same role.

US-based client experience in the same role.

Availability to work in US time zones.

Availability to work 8 hours per day, Monday to Friday.

Not currently working with other clients.

Strong English skills, both speaking and writing.

title: Accouning - Quickbooks Online AR\AP Role
description:
Hi, 



Job Title: Remote QuickBooks Online AP/AR Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)

Location: 100% Remote (Must align with US Pacific Time Zone / PST working hours)

Company: California-based small/medium business

Job Type: Independent Contractor (1099 equivalent for non-US hires; hourly billing)

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday through Friday (approximately 25 hours per week)



Hours must overlap with PST business hours (e.g., 8 AM – 5 PM PST preferred for real-time collaboration).

Philippine-based applicants encouraged (night shift flexibility to match PST is ideal).



Compensation: Competitive hourly rate in USD (based on experience; paid via PayPal, Wise, or similar). Negotiable depending on skills and trial performance.

About the Role

We are a growing California-based company seeking a reliable, detail-oriented QuickBooks Online specialist to handle our accounts payable (AP), accounts receivable (AR), and related accounting tasks on a part-time remote basis. This is an ongoing contractor position with potential to increase to full-time (40+ hours/week) if the right fit is found—especially if you bring digital marketing experience (e.g., social media management,
 campaigns, basic SEO, ad management) that we can blend into the role.

Key Responsibilities



Manage full-cycle Accounts Payable (AP): Enter vendor bills, match invoices to purchase orders/receipts, schedule and process payments (checks, ACH, wires), track expenses, and maintain vendor records in QuickBooks Online.

Handle full-cycle Accounts Receivable (AR): Create and send customer invoices, apply payments, monitor aging reports, follow up on overdue accounts (via
/phone as needed), process credit memos/refunds, and reconcile customer accounts.

Perform bank and credit card reconciliations monthly.

Assist with month-end closing tasks: journal entries, accruals, prepayments, and basic financial reporting.

Maintain accurate general ledger entries and ensure clean books.

Identify and resolve discrepancies, errors, or unusual transactions promptly.

Support ad-hoc accounting tasks (e.g., expense tracking, basic budgeting support, data cleanup).

Communicate clearly with the team (via
, Slack/Zoom) and provide weekly updates on AR aging, AP due dates, and cash flow insights.



Potential Future Expansion (Big Plus)

If you have experience in digital marketing, we may gradually incorporate tasks such as:



Managing social media accounts 
, Instagram, LinkedIn).

Creating and scheduling
 campaigns or newsletters.

Running basic paid ads (Google/Facebook).

Website content updates or basic SEO.

This could evolve the role into a full-time hybrid accounting + marketing position for the right candidate.



Requirements



Must-have: Certification in QuickBooks Online (e.g., QuickBooks ProAdvisor, QuickBooks Certified User, or equivalent demonstrated expertise).

3+ years of hands-on experience with QuickBooks Online specifically for AP/AR and bookkeeping (US GAAP familiarity preferred).

Proven track record handling full-cycle AP and AR for US-based clients.

Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and organizational skills.

Excellent written and verbal English communication (professional
s, client/vendor interactions).

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, and availability during PST hours.

Comfortable working independently as a remote contractor.



Preferred (Not Required)



Experience with additional tools (e.g., 
, Expensify, HubSpot, Mailchimp, Canva, Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite).

Digital marketing background (even part-time or freelance).

US client references or experience with California businesses.



How to Apply

Please submit:



Your resume/CV highlighting QuickBooks Online experience and certifications.

Examples of AP/AR tasks you've handled (e.g., "Managed 100+ vendor bills monthly in QBO").

Your expected hourly rate in USD.

title: SEO & Web Development Specialist
description:
Position Title: SEO & Web Development Specialist

 

Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. CST

 

 

About the Role

 

We are seeking an experienced SEO & Web Development Specialist who excels at building and maintaining websites using modern page builder platforms. This role requires a blend of strong SEO expertise and hands-on website development skills.

 

Your primary strength should be working with page builders such as YOOtheme Pro, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery, Beaver Builder, or similar tools. Experience with Joomla is a strong plus, but proficiency in building clean, responsive, high-performing websites with visual builders is what matters most. Basic HTML knowledge is required for troubleshooting and layout refinement.

 

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Search Engine Optimization

 

Conduct technical SEO audits and implement improvements.

Perform keyword research and optimize on-page elements, including metadata, headers, internal links, and content structure.

Ensure proper setup of schema markup, robots.txt, sitemaps, and indexing rules.

Monitor SEO performance using Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and third-party tools.

Stay updated on algorithm changes and best practices to maintain strong site performance.

 

 

Page Builder–Focused Web Development

 

Build, edit, and maintain websites using YOOtheme Pro, Elementor, Divi, Beaver Builder, or WPBakery.

Develop responsive, SEO-friendly layouts using drag-and-drop builder environments.

Troubleshoot layout or display issues without relying heavily on custom coding.

Implement tracking scripts, forms, popups, integrations, and third-party tools directly within the CMS.

Collaborate with design and content teams to turn wireframes or mockups into polished, functional web pages.

 

 

Collaboration & Technical Support

 

Work closely with internal teams to deliver optimized, high-performing websites.

Recommend improvements for site structure, usability, accessibility, and load speed.

Maintain clear records of updates, SEO enhancements, and technical adjustments.

 

 

 

Required Qualifications

 

3+ years of experience building websites using modern visual page builders.

Proficiency in at least two major builders: YOOtheme Pro, Elementor, Divi, Beaver Builder, or WPBakery.

Strong understanding of core SEO principles and proven optimization experience.

Familiarity with tools such as Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or SEMrush.

Ability to manage and optimize multiple websites at once.

Strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills.

Basic HTML knowledge for layout edits and troubleshooting.

 

 

Preferred Qualifications

 

Experience with Joomla, especially YOOtheme Pro.

Working knowledge of CSS for layout adjustments.

Experience with Linux-based hosting (cPanel, file manager, basic troubleshooting).

Familiarity with WordPress management and plugin configuration.

Basic graphic/layout skills using Figma, Canva, or Adobe XD.

Understanding of Core Web Vitals, page speed optimization, and caching tools.

 

 

 

Compensation & Benefits

 

Competitive hourly rate based on experience. Remote work environment with stable, long-term employment.

Paid time off, including:



1. Vacation leave

2. Sick leave

3. Bereavement leave

4. Flex days

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our growing real estate team.  This role will support development and investment decisions by building financial proforma models, analyzing project performance, and preparing reports for management. You’ll work closely with the US-based team on residential and multifamily real estate projects, helping evaluate feasibility, cash flows, and returns.



What You’ll Do

- Build and update Excel-based financial models for real estate development and investment projects.

- Analyze project costs, revenues, and returns (IRR, NPV, ROI, cash flow projections).

- Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and scenario analysis to support decision-making.

- Review market and economic data to ensure financial assumptions are realistic.

- Help prepare investment memos, presentations, and financial reports for management and investors.

- Coordinate with the market research and development teams to align assumptions and projections.

- Track ongoing project performance versus budget and highlight key variances.





Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or any related field.

- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel - including financial modeling, formulas, and data analysis.

- At least 2–4 years of experience in financial analysis, investment modeling, or real estate development.

- Understanding of real estate finance concepts (pro forma, IRR, cap rate, yield, absorption, etc.).

- High attention to detail and excellent analytical and quantitative skills.

- Ability to communicate complex financial information clearly.

- Familiarity with real estate markets (especially in the US or Bay Area) is a plus.

- Experience using tools like Microsoft 365 is an advantage.



Preferred Attributes

- Strong interest in real estate investment and development.

- Enjoys working with numbers and models and solving analytical problems.

- Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable in meeting deadlines.



Working Hours

- Required to follow 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Pacific Standard Time

Tools used include Skyslope and Follow Up Boss

• Inspections

- Manage client pipelines and follow up on leads.





Systems & Process Development

• Help refine and improve transaction workflows.

• Identify inefficiencies and propose improvements.

• Create and maintain clear written SOPs.







Requirements

• Proven experience real estate transaction management.

• Understanding of contract-to-close workflows.

• Experience with CRMs (Follow Up Boss or similar)

• Experience with Document Management Tools  - (example - Skyslope, DotLoop, DocuSign

• Strong written and verbal English communication skills.

• Strong organizational and time management skills.

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

• High level of professionalism and confidentiality.

• Comfortable making outbound calls to clients, leads, and vendors.

• Process-oriented and comfortable documenting SOPs.

• Reliable internet connection and speed.





Preferred Qualifications

• Familiarity with automation tools.

• Nice to Have: Familiarity with Lead Generation and YouTube Marketing







Compensation

• Bonus potential based on individual performance and overall company performance.

• Long-term growth opportunity within a structured and performance-focused team.







Application Requirements



In addition to your resume - please send a brief video intro.  Share with us a little about your background, why you are a fit for this role, and what was most interesting about this position.

title: Full-Time WordPress Developer (API Integrations & User Dashboards)
description:

title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)
description:
Job Title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

Company: California-based FMS (Focused on becoming #1 globally in attracting product inquiries through optimized digital presence)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (Hourly billing via PayPal, Wise, or similar)

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday through Friday (approximately 25 hours per week)



Must overlap with US Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours (e.g., 8 AM – 5 PM PST for collaboration; night shift in PH time ideal, as 10 AM PH = 6 PM previous day PST).



Compensation: $6–$10 USD per hour (based on experience and certifications; typical for experienced PH-based talent in this role). Paid weekly or bi-weekly. Negotiable for top candidates with proven results in driving global inquiries.

About the Role

FMS is a dynamic California company dedicated to leading the market in global product inquiries. We're seeking a skilled, certified Wix specialist with expertise in SEO and search engine marketing (SEM) to build, optimize, and maintain our websites remotely on a part-time basis. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing our online visibility, attracting international traffic, and positioning FMS as the top choice for product inquiries worldwide. This role may expand if performance excels.

Key Responsibilities



Design, build, and customize responsive websites using Wix platform, ensuring user-friendly navigation, mobile optimization, and integration of e-commerce or inquiry forms.

Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve search rankings, including keyword research, content optimization, meta tags, alt text, and site speed enhancements.

Manage SEM campaigns (e.g., Google Ads, paid search) to drive targeted global traffic and product inquiries, including ad creation, bidding, A/B testing, and performance tracking.

Analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics and Search Console to identify opportunities for increasing inquiries from diverse global markets.

Perform regular site audits, updates, and maintenance to ensure SEO/SEM best practices are applied for maximum visibility and conversion.

Collaborate remotely with the team (via Slack, Zoom,
) to align on goals, report on metrics (e.g., traffic growth, inquiry rates), and suggest improvements for global reach.

Focus on strategies that attract international audiences, such as multilingual SEO elements or region-specific targeting to make FMS #1 in product inquiries.



Requirements



3+ years of experience building and managing websites on Wix, with a portfolio of live sites demonstrating SEO/SEM integration.

Proven track record in driving traffic and inquiries through SEO and paid search for global audiences.

Strong understanding of search engine algorithms, digital marketing trends, and tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, or similar.

Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal) for professional reports and team interactions.

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, and flexibility for PST hours.

Ability to work independently as a remote contractor.



Required Certifications/Training

To ensure high-quality, professional work aligned with industry standards:



Wix-Specific: Wix Certified (e.g., Wix Partner Certification, Wix Web Designer Certification, or completion of Wix's official training courses on website building and SEO via Wix Learn).

SEO: Google Analytics Certification (Google Skillshop), SEMrush SEO Fundamentals Certification, HubSpot SEO Certification, or Ahrefs SEO Training Course.

SEM (Search Engine Marketing): Google Ads Certification (Search, Display, or Performance Max tracks via Google Skillshop), Microsoft Advertising Certified Professional, or equivalent paid search training from platforms like Udemy or Coursera.

These certifications demonstrate expertise and are essential for optimizing FMS's global inquiry strategy.



Preferred (Big Plus)



Experience with additional tools (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Hotjar for user behavior, Canva for visuals, or
 marketing platforms like Mailchimp).

Background in e-commerce or lead generation sites, with examples of increasing global inquiries.

Familiarity with international SEO (e.g., hreflang tags, geo-targeting).



How to Apply

Submit:



Resume/CV with Wix/SEO/SEM experience and certifications listed.

Portfolio links to Wix sites you've built/optimized, including before-after metrics on traffic/inquiries if available.

Expected hourly rate in USD.

Brief note on your PST availability and how you've driven global product inquiries in past roles.



We'll review quickly and may include a short Wix/SEO skills test. Join us in making FMS the global leader in product inquiries!

title: Senior AI Graphic Designer (Direct Response / Meta Ads – Health Niche)
description:
We are looking for a top-tier graphic designer to join a fast-growing direct-to-consumer brand in the health niche.



This is not a beginner role.

We work at speed, test aggressively, and expect a high level of taste, execution, and attention to detail. If you don’t consider yourself among the best in your field, this role is likely not the right fit.



You will be responsible for producing high-converting creatives for Meta Ads, working closely with our creative strategist and media buyers. The workflow involves creating multiple batches of ad creatives every week, testing different hooks, angles, and visual concepts.



We value designers who understand performance marketing, not just aesthetics. The goal is not only to design something that looks good—but something that stops the scroll and converts.



	•	Design high-performing ad creatives for Meta (static images, carousels, simple motion graphics)

	•	Translate creative briefs into strong visual concepts quickly

	•	Produce multiple variations and iterations for testing

	•	Apply feedback and revisions efficiently

	•	Maintain consistent visual quality across large creative batches

	•	Research competitor ads and winning creative formats

	•	Use AI tools (Midjourney, Ideogram, Photoshop AI, etc.) at an expert level to generate, refine, and scale high-converting visuals

	•	Combine AI-generated assets with professional design skills to create original, polished, conversion-focused creatives

	•	Continuously explore new AI workflows and creative automation techniques to increase production speed and output quality

title: Appointment-setting rockstar with a sense of urgency
description:
Support a mission that changes lives from the nervous system up.



 The Role (In a Nutshell)

I’m looking for someone who thrives with appointment setting and loves to really connect with people – not just pitch to them. My ideal Virtual Assistant loves to move fast, is a quick, responsive, action-oriented go-getter who can act with a sense of urgency to be my right hand - helping me rapidly expand to the people who want my help.



 Your Responsibilities

Appointment setting - turn cold leads into qualified calls, booked on my calendar.

Quickly & efficiently edit 2 podcast episodes/week and create reels

Schedule content & engage on social media

Clean up & manage my inbox with clarity and care

Admin tasks: cleaning out old lists, unused funnels, etc

Podcast outreach 



 You’ll Thrive If You Are…

A self-starter who sees what needs to be done and jumps in proactively without needing to be reminded or managed

Fantastic communicator to work with me as a team

Highly organized with tasks and timelines

Energetic, warm, and great with people online (especially in chat/DMs)

Work with a sense of urgency, with efficiency but not stress

Flexible, funny, and grounded — you love systems AND a good laugh



 Tech Skills That’ll Make You Shine

Proficient in GoHighLevel (or quick to learn it!)

Canva wizardry

Reels / short-form editing tools (CapCut, InShot, etc.)

Calendar management

Social media scheduling tools

Comfortable navigating Google Drive, YouTube, LinkedIn, and Gmail



 Time & Compensation

~10–15 hours/week to start (with potential to grow)

Daily 15-min check-ins + Weekly 1-hr planning call

Compensation: $6–$10/hr based on experience with ability to increase hours and income

Flexible hours, but must be available to collaborate during US mornings (9-11 am ET)





 How to Apply (We Read Every Word!)

If you’re excited to bring your magic to this mission, apply by sending an
 to 
 with the subject line:

 “I’m Your Appointment Setter!”

Include:

A short Loom video (2–3 min) introducing yourself and sharing why this role excites you

Links to your portfolio or samples of relevant work (video edits, social posts, Canva designs)

Proven track record with appointment setting of quality leads

Your resume (optional, keep it real)

And tell me: What’s a silly fact about you that makes you giggle when you think about it? 



 Bonus Points If…

You believe healing is possible. You’ve done some inner work yourself. You love being the behind-the-scenes magic maker. And you want to grow alongside a founder on a mission to help thousands.



Ready to help people reset their systems and reclaim their lives?

Let’s co-create something powerful. 

Katie Wrigley - The Catapult Effect
