title: Freelance Graphic Designer
description:
Job Description



As a Freelance Graphic Designer at Tulen, you’ll be responsible for designing high-quality ad creatives, event guides, and venue layouts for our hospitality clients. You’ll bring marketing campaigns to life visually, helping restaurants and event venues stand out across digital and print formats.



This role blends creativity, strategic thinking, and fast-paced execution. It requires a strong visual eye and the ability to deliver assets that are both branded and conversion-focused.



Responsibilities

- Design ad creatives for social media,
, and digital ads

- Develop functional and branded space layouts for venues

- Create event guides and promotional materials for clients

- Maintain brand consistency across all projects

- Collaborate with the creative team and account managers

- Meet deadlines, provide revisions, and manage feedback loops

- Stay up to date with hospitality design trends and social media best practices



About Our Clients

Tulen works with a wide range of event venues, restaurants, and hospitality businesses across the U.S. Many of our clients run high-end event spaces or multi-venue restaurant groups. A strong understanding of this visual space is key.



Must-Have Skills

- 1+ years of graphic design experience

- Strong portfolio with hospitality or event-related work

- Canva proficiency (Adobe Creative Suite is a plus)

- Clear content creation skills for social media

- Experience creating both print and digital assets

- Detail-oriented with a refined design aesthetic

- Comfortable working independently with clear deadlines

- Strong communication and collaboration skills



Nice-to-Haves

- Experience with layout design (blueprints, space mockups)

- Light animation or motion design (GIFs, reels)

- Knowledge of branding, typography, and composition

- Familiarity with pitch decks or client-facing presentations



Success Metrics

- Turnaround time for active clients: 2 business days

- Turnaround time on large projects for active clients: 4 business days

- Turnaround for new/larger client setups: 5 business days

- Consistent visual branding and alignment with creative briefs

- Completion of 30 project deadlines = bonus

- Strong internal collaboration and client feedback



Time Commitment & Logistics

- Part-time freelance role, with flexibility in hours

- Expected workload varies week to week, but timely response required for client-facing projects

- Remote work, ideally with some EST overlap for meetings or updates

- Weekly team check-ins via Slack or Google Meet



Ideal Candidate Profile

- Fast, focused, and quality-driven designer

- Adaptable to changing brand styles and timelines

- Thrives in a creative environment with autonomy

- Prior experience in hospitality or venue design is a major plus

title: SYSPRO to HubSpot Integration Expert Needed
description:

SQL Server direct access experience for SYSPRO reads

HubSpot API v3 experience



Scope of work:



Bidirectional sync: customer master, primary contact, credit status, and
 history

SYSPRO ? HubSpot: sales orders, invoices, and products (via SQL reads)

HubSpot ? SYSPRO: new accounts, contacts, and sales orders (via API)

SYSPRO's single AR contact limitation when HubSpot has multiple contacts per company

Bidirectional customer credit hold status sync

Proper use of Business Objects vs direct SQL writes

Specific SYSPRO project examples

Your technical approach (middleware platform, hosting, architecture)

title: AI Image Generation Specialist - Photos for Social Campaign
description:
We are looking for an experienced AI image generation artist who can deliver high resolution photo-realistic images for a social campaign.  Respondents should be able to follow image guidelines and have a good feel for current clothing trends (primarily for the US market).  Whatever tools you prefer to use are fine.



We are posting this project as a gig but are hoping to establish a long term working relationship with an artist that can quickly and efficiently translate our brand identity into fun and beautiful marketing images.  



We are in a pre-launch stage for our business, which is selling planner notebooks/accessories.  We also have an app that allows users to design their own planner pages.  We anticipate our initial launch to be in about 2 months.



Taste matters for this job.  Please send us your
 so we can send over a JPG with examples of the type of candid lifestyle looks we would like to recreate for this campaign and a link to your portfolio or samples of photo realistic images you have created.



Project Description:



Image Set 1 - 30 photos - candid lifestyle/on the street photos of people in interesting/stylish outfits

               - 15 styles in a Gen Z demographic look (we will provide style guidelines)

               - 15 styles in a Gen X demographic look (we will provide style guidelines)

Image Set 2 - 30 photos -  an outfit flatlay that includes a closed planner + accessories (purse, jewelry, makeup, glasses..)

               - these images coordinate with the 30 Image 1 photos created 

Image Set 3 - 30 photos - an open planner highlighting a planner page layout + accessories (purse, jewelry, makeup,   

                                               glasses..)

               - these images coordinate with the 30 Image 1 and 30 Image 2 photos created



1-develop subject references for 90 required images

2-develop style references for 90 required images

3-develop text prompts for 90 required images

4-select and submit 2-3 options to us for each of the 90 required images

5-re run images to achieve the looks required for the campaign as necessary

6-make edits to images where necessary.

7-incorporate our product photographs into the Image Set 2 and Image Set 3 images (60 images)



Thank you very much for taking the time to review our post.  We look forward to meeting you!



Donique

description:

PLEASE APPLY ONLY, IF you worked for USA Paid ads agency with multiple clients in local services like HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical/Roofing



We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Agency VA Assistant to support our Creative and Paid Ads team with daily operations.

This role is ideal for someone who is organized, proactive, and comfortable managing multiple tasks while keeping projects moving smoothly in Trello.



Our clients place a high level of trust in us, and this position is critical to maintaining quality, organization, and on-time delivery across the agency.



Responsibilities



Support Creative & Paid Ads Workflows



Download and upload graphic files and assets from clients into Google Drive



Gather additional photos and videos from client social channels:






Instagram



Google My Business (GMB)



YouTube



Organize all gathered assets into brand folders in Canva



Properly name videos and images based on content



Keep brand folders clean, structured, and easy to navigate



Ad Review & Organization



After ads are created or updated:



Take
 ad screenshots



Add screenshots to assigned Google Sheets so clients can easily see what ads are running



Proofread
 ad copy for spelling, grammar, and clarity



Review Canva ads for:



Accuracy



Formatting



Brand consistency



Obvious visual or text errors before delivery



Administrative & Team Support



Complete data entry tasks assigned by the team manager



Organize, upload, and manage files in Google Drive



Help ensure deadlines and deliverables are met



Communicate clearly with internal tea
mbers

Requirements



Strong communication and multitasking skills



High attention to detail and strong proofreading ability

Proactive, trustworthy, and able to take initiative without constant supervision



Up-to-date computer and required software



Comfortable handling frequent file uploads and downloads

If you’re someone who takes pride in clean organization, catching mistakes before clients see them, and keeping a fast-moving agency running smoothly — we’d love to hear from you.

title: Link Builder / Off-Page SEO
description:
OSITION: Link Builder / Off-Page SEO Specialist

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: Minimum 7 years of SEO experience



ABOUT US

We are a fast-growing international education company with multiple online training brands in bartending, swimming, and skateboarding. Our focus is on quality education, strong online presence, and continuous growth.



ROLE OVERVIEW

We are looking for an experienced Link Builder / Off-Page SEO Specialist to lead and execute backlink and outreach strategies across multiple domains. This person should have deep knowledge of white-hat link-building, digital PR, and off-page SEO techniques that drive measurable ranking improvements.



REQUIREMENTS



Minimum 7 years of proven SEO experience with a strong off-page focus

Expertise in Google algorithms and white-hat SEO methods

Skilled with Ahrefs, SEMrush, Majestic, and Google Search Console





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Develop and implement off-page SEO strategies to increase domain authority and organic rankings

Identify and secure high-quality backlinks through outreach, guest posting, partnerships, and digital PR

Perform competitor backlink analysis and discover new link opportunities

Manage outreach campaigns through
, HARO, and media contacts

Monitor backlink quality, anchor text diversity, and link profile growth

Collaborate with the content team to develop linkable content assets

Report monthly on link-building performance and SEO metrics







WHAT WE OFFER



Remote work with flexible hours

Competitive pay and performance-based bonuses

Long-term position in a stable, fast-growing company

Supportive, results-driven team environment

title: Rockstar Admin Assistant / Project Manager  — GREAT English Speaking & Writing Skills
description:
We’re a fast-moving, mission-driven media brand building 
ntum through consistent communication, a growing podcast presence, and a public-facing ecosystem of guests, resources, and listings. 



We need a proactive operator who can “run the day,” keeping outreach tight, tasks moving, and the content pipeline organized end-to-end.



This is not a passive admin role. You’ll own execution, follow-through, and coordination so episodes get published on time, clips go out consistently, guests are supported professionally, and nothing falls through the cracks.



|  IMPORTANT!!!  |. Step 1: Submit your 30–60 second video



If a video is not submitted, you will not be considered. Read through the job description and film a 30-60 second video telling us why you are perfect for the position and the Rockstar we are looking for. 





We’re looking for an Operator-type, not a “task taker.” Someone who takes ownership, sees what’s missing, and closes loops without being chased.



You’ll probably be a fit if you’re…



- Ruthlessly organized: you live in checklists, calendars, trackers, and clean folders.

- A fast, clear communicator: strong English, professional tone, no confusion, no drama.

- A closer of loops: you hate loose ends, and you don’t let things die in Slack/DMs/email threads.

- Proactive by default: if you finish early, you don’t wait — you find the next highest-leverage thing and handle it.

- Tech-comfortable: not an engineer, but you can learn tools quickly, follow SOPs, and figure things out without hand-holding.

- Content + ops minded: you understand that consistency wins — publishing cadence, clip workflows, guest follow-up, and posting rhythm matter.

- High integrity + mission-aligned: you care about doing things right, representing the brand well, and moving with purpose.



The personality traits we want:

 

-Calm under pressure

-Quick learner

-Detail-obsessed (in a good way)

-Reliable, not flaky

-Doesn’t need emotional reassurance to execute

-Thinks in systems, not one-off fixes

-If you’re the person who loves being the engine behind the scenes, keeping the train on the tracks while the hosts create, you’ll crush this role.





Schedule & Compensation



Hours: Mon–Wed, 10 am – 2 pm US Eastern (some flexibility for events) | (12-15 hours per week initially with room to grow to full-time)



Compensation: $7/hour + performance bonuses tied to clearly defined milestones (membership growth, revenue/supporter goals, and execution KPIs)





Here are the skill sets you need to win at this role:



1) Communication (English + clarity)



Strong spoken English for calls and voice notes

Strong written English for
/DMs/text (clear, warm, confident)

Ability to summarize, confirm next steps, and keep threads moving

Comfortable following up firmly without being pushy or awkward



2) Operations + Project Management



Task prioritization (knows what matters most right now)

Building and maintaining trackers (pipelines, content calendars, status boards)

Deadline management and “close-the-loop” follow-through

Meeting support: agendas, notes, action items, reminders, replay sharing



3) Podcast + Content Workflow Execution



Managing a repeatable content pipeline: episode ? edit ? clips ? posting ? guest packet

Basic understanding of file types, naming conventions, link management

Posting/scheduling across platforms 

Quality assurance: checking titles, descriptions, links, timestamps, assets, and formatting



4) Research + Data Organization



Web research skills (finding accurate info fast)

Verifying details (names, URLs, bios, contact info)

Updating directory/event listings with clean formatting

Keeping data clean in Sheets/CRM (no sloppy records)



5) Tools + Tech Comfort



Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive) at a high level

Basic CRM/data entry discipline (GoHighLevel/ZoHo are a plus)

Slack/What’s App or similar team comms

Canva familiarity for simple graphics 

Comfortable learning light, checklist-driven tasks in tools like Replit (with guidance)



6) Outreach + Scheduling



Booking guests/partners: scheduling across time zones, confirmations, reminders

Outreach systems: call/text/email follow-up queues and tracking outcomes

Handling inbound interest quickly and professionally



7) Reporting + Accountability



Weekly activity summary creation (what happened, what’s next, what’s stuck)

Simple KPI tracking (posts shipped, clips shipped, outreach volume, booked calls)



Nice-to-Have



-Experience running operations for a small business, nonprofit, or fast-moving team

-Experience supporting a podcast/content operation (posting, coordination, clip workflows)

-Building SOPs/checklists and managing simple databases/directories





The Kind of Person Who Wins Here:



You’re the type who:



-doesn’t wait to be told what to do next

-likes turning ideas and visions into checklists and organization

-communicates clearly and confidently

-closes loops so nothing slips through the cracks

-takes pride in being the reason the machine runs smoothly



If that’s you, submit your video.

title: Guest Experience Virtual Assistant, Sierra Sol Elevated Stays
description:
Sierra Sol Elevated Stays is a locally rooted, family-owned property management company serving Northern New Mexico (Santa Fe, Taos, Angel Fire, and Red River) with over 150 properties. Our love for this region is what led us to build Sierra Sol Elevated Stays, focused on providing elevated stays for our guests and elevated stewardship for our homeowners. Our goal is to grow in a way that celebrates what makes New Mexico special – its people, culture, and enchanted lands – while delivering elevated experiences for guests and thoughtful, reliable stewardship for homeowners.



Tech stack (daily tools): Guesty (PMS + guest inbox), Breezeway (tasks/workorders + cleaning), RingCentral (calls/SMS).

Our Elevated Promises



Everything we do is guided by our Elevated Promises. They are our operating standard and the way we earn five-star stays and trusted, long-term homeowner partnerships.



1. Elevated Guest Engagement: Proactive, elevated hospitality from booking to five-star review. 

We believe vacations are special—something people save for, plan for, and look forward to. Our job is to make every stay feel seamless and memorable. We anticipate needs, communicate early, check in during the stay, and resolve issues quickly with warmth and care. Our guest journey is intentionally crafted to deliver the kind of responsiveness, thoughtfulness, and attention to detail that turns great trips into truly elevated experiences.



2. Elevated Home Stewardship: We care for every home as if it were our own.

As homeowners in these markets, we know what true home stewardship looks like. We operate with a proactive mindset of quality, consistency, and pride. Weekly home checks, rigorous cleaning standards, quality control, seasonal readiness, and preventive maintenance are all part of how we ensure every property is clean, protected, and presentation ready, for guests and for you. We treat every home with the same respect and diligence we expect for our own.



3. Elevated Homeowner Partnerships: We treat each home like our own investment.

Every homeowner has different goals – maximizing revenue, balancing personal use, focusing on long-term appreciation, or simply enjoying peace of mind. Our role is to be a true partner in those goals, not simply a property manager. As owners and operators in this region ourselves, our guidance comes from real-world results, not theory. Through regular business reviews, thoughtful design and amenity recommendations, revenue and pricing insights, and brand-building support, we help each property reach its highest potential.



Our Guest Experience team is one of the biggest ways we deliver these promises. This is hospitality work. You are a core part of our team, not an outsourced call-center function.



Job Description:

As a Guest Experience Virtual Assistant, you own guest communication and coordination. You are the voice of Sierra Sol, a core part of our team, and a key driver of five-star stays. You will manage guest messaging and calls, coordinate workorders and cleaning schedules with our local teams and vendors, and bring elevated hospitality and experiences to every stay.



You will own:

• Proactive outreach and warm guest engagement that drives five-star stays

• Guest messaging and phone communication

• Workorder coordination and task follow-through

• Cleaning scheduling and day-to-day coordination with our local team and vendors



Working Hours

We provide live coverage from 7:00am to 11:00pm Mountain Time (MDT). You will be assigned a consistent shift. On-call after hour coverage (11:00pm-7:00am MDT) is handled by a separate rotation.

Mountain Daylight Time (MDT) ? Philippines Time (PHT):

• 7am–3pm MDT ? 9pm–5am PHT

• 11am–7pm MDT ? 1am–9am PHT

• 3pm–11pm MDT ? 5am–1pm PHT

You will be assigned one shift. Overnight shifts include a differential.

On-call: 11pm–7am MDT is handled by an on-call rotation (separate from daily shift expectations).



Compensation and Incentives

• Base pay: $650-$750 USD per month (full-time, based on experience)

• Night shift (9p – 5a): +$50 per month

• Internet/tech allowance: $20 per month

• 13th month pay: offered in December (prorated for partial years)

• Monthly Bonus: Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool (based on team review quality + individual SLA performance)

• PTO: Accrues at 1 paid days per month (usable after 90 days; no annual rollover)



Monthly 5-Star Bonus Pool

We keep the bonus simple, measurable, and tied directly to delivering elevated guest experiences — the heart of your role.

• Pool funding: $2.00 USD for every 5-star review received during the month.

• Quality gate: Pool funded only if the monthly average rating is 4.85+ and the review rate is 80%+.

• Distribution: The funded pool is divided equally among the Guest Experience Tea
mbers.

• Eligibility: You receive your share when monthly SLA and performance standards are met. Shares are not redistributed from non-eligible members.



Location

These roles are fully remote within the Philippines. However, we are building our core Guest Experience team in Cebu City, and applicants located in Cebu City or nearby areas are strongly preferred.

Concentrating our team locally helps us work more closely, support one another, and build the kind of connected, collaborative culture that lets us deliver truly elevated hospitality. It also allows for optional in-person training sessions, tea
etups, and shared learning opportunities.

Exceptional candidates from other regions will still be considered.



Role and Responsibilities:



Elevated Guest Engagement (Guesty + text/email)

• Answer guest messages (text,
, OTA inbox via Guesty) with warmth, clarity, and genuine care

• Proactively share helpful guidance (arrival, access, weather/roads, home-specific tips) and check in during the stay

• Keep conversations organized and ensure no guest is left waiting or confused

• Ensure every guest experience feels special and elevated



Welcome outreach (required for every reservation)

• Place a welcome phone call to every guest prior to arrival day and send a personalized welcome text

• Confirm access and comfort, offer help, and document any concerns quickly

• Identify opportunities to make the guest’s stay an elevated and memorable experience



Phone support (RingCentral)

• Answer calls quickly and calmly and return missed calls promptly

• Troubleshoot common issues (access, Wi-Fi, amenities, heating/hot tub basics) and escalate when needed



Workorders and coordination (Breezeway)

• Create workorders fast when issues arise and confirm vendor/team acknowledgment

• Track progress, follow up, and close the loop with guests and the local team

• Keep notes and task status clean so handoffs are seamless



Cleaning scheduling and turnovers (Breezeway)

• Coordinate turn cleaning schedules and special requests

• Ensure all turns are scheduled a minimum of one week prior to booking and confirm scheduled cleaner the day prior to a scheduled cleaning and communicate key notes to cleaners



Documentation and handoffs

• Maintain accurate property notes and updates

• Close out open items before shift end and hand off active issues with clear context



Monthly SLA Standards (required for bonus eligibility)

• Guest messages answered within 15 minutes during your shift (text,
, Guesty inbox)

• Phone calls answered within 30 seconds during your shift

• No open guest messages left at shift end; clean handoffs with clear notes

• Workorders created promptly and vendor/team acknowledgment confirmed quickly



Property Listing Management & OTA Updates

• Maintain accurate, up-to-date listings across Guesty, Airbnb, Vrbo, and other OTAs.

• Update photos, amenities, room configurations, access notes, and seasonal details as needed.

• Ensure descriptions reflect the true guest experience with clear, warm, and helpful language.

• Flag inconsistencies, outdated information, or missing details to the Manager for correction.

• Support seasonal updates (ski season, summer events, holiday periods) to elevate guest expectations and reduce pre-arrival questions.

• Ensure every listing reflects our Elevated Promises — clarity, care, and a welcoming tone.



Local expertise

• Become an expert on Santa Fe, Taos, Angel Fire, and Red River, including seasonal rhythms, weather and road impacts, and local norms.

• Learn the best restaurants, cafes, shops, activities, and experiences in each market so you can offer personalized, concierge-level recommendations that elevate each stay.

• Know our homes in detail: complete Matterport and photo walkthroughs; learn layouts, bedding, amenities, quirks, parking, access instructions, and any “good to know” details for guests.

• Stay current on local events and updates by checking event calendars, tourism sites, and community pages (including relevant local
 groups).

• Use your local and property knowledge proactively to help guests plan better stays, avoid common issues, and feel confidently looked after from booking to checkout.



What we look for

• Excellent written and spoken English and a warm, helpful tone

• Hospitality mindset (you enjoy caring for people, not just closing tickets)

• Strong ownership and follow-through, especially on weekends and busy days

• Detail-oriented and eager to learn homes, markets, and local context

• Comfortable learning and working inside Guesty, Breezeway, and RingCentral

• Reliable internet and a quiet, professional work environment



How to apply

Please submit the following:

• Resume/CV

• 2-minute voice recording introducing yourself and your experience (English)

• Speedtest.net result (screenshot)

• Short written samples: How would you respond to the following guest messages?

  - “The hot tub isn’t heating. Can you help?”

  - “Can we request a late checkout tomorrow?”

  - “We’re staying in Angel Fire — any recommendations for a great breakfast spot for our family?”

• Short written samples: These three guests message you at the same time. In what order would you respond and why?

  - “We can’t get into the home, the code isn’t working.”

  - “The Wi-Fi is slow and we need it for work.”

  - “Can we check out one hour later?”

Suggested
 subject line: "NM Guest Experience VA - [Your Name]"

title: Content Researcher (m/f/d) – Reels & Shortform Role: Content Researcher (Remote)
description:
Time Commitment: ~3 hours per day



Deadline: Daily by 18:00 (6 PM) CET



Niches: Gamer Girl & Goth/Dominant



We don’t need "scrollers." We need analytical minds. Your job is to identify the most viral reel concepts globally, dissect why they work, and prepare them for our creators (Lucy & Lola) to recreate and outperform.



???? Your Responsibilities



Deep Research: Use two dedicated research accounts (Gamer Girl / Goth-Dom) to find high-performing formats on Instagram (Priority) and TikTok.



The "Why": You don’t just find links; you provide insights. You identify the hook, the pacing, and the visual triggers that cause a video to go viral.



Optimization: You tell us exactly how we can beat the original.



???? Daily Output Requirements



Quantity: Minimum 50 high-quality reels per day (total across both niches).



Format: Daily PDF delivered via WhatsApp group.



Deadline: Every single day by 18:00 CET (Non-negotiable).



Required Data per Reel:



Direct Link to the reel.



Virality Analysis: Why did this work? (Concrete points: Hook in first 3s, lighting, mimicry, timing, text overlays).



The Upgrade: At least 3 specific points on how we will make it better.



???? Your Profile



Master of Hooks: You understand exactly what stops the thumb in the first 1–3 seconds.



Niche Expertise: You live and breathe the Gamer Girl and Goth/Dom aesthetics.



Analytical Skills: You can explain complex viral triggers in short, clear sentences.



Discipline: 18:00 CET means 18:00 CET. We value reliability above all else.



Note: AI (ChatGPT) is allowed for polishing descriptions, but the content selection must be human-level top-tier.



?? Performance & Evaluation



This is a quality-first role.



If you send 100 random links that don't fit, you fail.



If you send 50 high-conversion reels, you win.



Strict Policy: Low quality results in one warning + training. If the quality doesn't improve immediately after, the collaboration will be terminated.



???? How to Apply



Send us a short profile and your general availability.



MANDATORY TEST TASK: Include 10 Reel Links for the "Gamer Girl" niche. For each link, provide:



The Link.



The Reason (Why did it go viral?).



3 Specific Improvements for our version.



Ready to hunt? Send your test task now.

title: Recruitment Specialist (Creative & Marketing Teams)
description:
About Us



We are a leading provider of respiratory health supplements, dedicated to improving the wellbeing of individuals with breathing difficulties and chronic respiratory conditions. Our commitment is to deliver high-quality products that enhance respiratory health and overall quality of life for our customers.

We’re looking for an experienced Recruitment Specialist to help us scale multiple elite teams across our business, with a strong focus on creative, marketing, and growth roles. Our positions are fully remote, so this role requires someone comfortable hiring internationally and assessing candidates for remote readiness. We need someone who has previously recruited on behalf of clients or businesses, not just internally, and understands how to move fast while maintaining hiring quality. If you enjoy high standards, this is for you.

Your job is to design, run, and continuously improve a hiring system that consistently attracts and selects top-tier talent. You’ll be responsible for sourcing, screening, and coordinating hires across roles such as content creators, designers, editors, media buyers, marketers, and other performance-driven positions. You need to hire right, not just hire fast.



What You’ll Do



Own end-to-end recruitment for multiple roles across creative, marketing, and operational teams

Source talent through various job boards, referrals, and direct outreach

Build a repeatable hiring pipeline for roles, reduce time-to-hire, and deliver quality hires that pass probation

Demonstrated experience hiring for remote roles across different time zones

Screen candidates for skill, experience, and culture fit

Implement structured interviews and scorecards

Support hiring managers through the decision process

Manage multiple open roles simultaneously and meet hiring timelines

Maintain clear communication with stakeholders and candidates throughout the process



Requirements



Proven experience as a Recruitment Specialist or Talent Partner

Proven experience in end-to-end recruiting for remote roles across a variety of positions for clients and external businesses

Strong background hiring for creative, marketing, or digital roles

Experience in hiring for specialist roles, and not just generalists only

Ability to manage high-volume and fast-paced hiring needs

Excellent communication and organizational skills

Comfortable working remotely and independently

Experience recruiting for startups, e-commerce, or performance marketing teams

Familiarity with creative workflows and digital marketing environments

Experience with ATS tools and structured hiring processes



To Apply



Please send a brief overview of your recruitment experience, and examples of roles or teams you’ve hired for (especially creative or marketing).

We’re looking for someone who can move quickly, think strategically, and help us build strong teams at scale.

Please include the color of the sky in your reply so we know you’ve read the post carefully.



Screening Questions



In addition to your application, also make a loom video answering the following questions:

Walk me through how you would hire a
 Ads specialist for a 
 brand. Step by step.

What mistakes do founders make when hiring recruiters?

Share an example of a hard-to-fill role you successfully hired for remotely.

If given 30 days to improve our hiring system, what would you do first?

APPLICATIONS WITHOUT A LOOM VIDEO WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We don't want someone who just follows instructions. We want someone who thinks.

If you're the kind of person who sees a problem three steps before it happens, who asks "why" until you understand the real issue, and who won't settle for "good enough" when excellence is possible—keep reading.



The Role:

You'll be the operational backbone of our business. This isn't data entry. This isn't inbox management. This is operational ownership.

You'll handle everything from customer communication and supplier coordination to QuickBooks invoicing, product research, Shopify catalog management, and documentation creation. You'll also manage our social media presence (~1 hour daily), keeping our brand active and engaging across platforms. You'll manage timelines, track tasks, anticipate needs, and make sure nothing falls through the cracks.

In 6 months, you'll likely be managing a small virtual team and taking on higher-level operational projects. In 12 months, you could be leading entire operational domains with significantly higher compensation.



What You'll Actually Do



- Support daily operations across customer service, vendor coordination, and order management

- Manage product sourcing, procurement research, and catalog updates (Shopify, Amazon, eBay)

- Handle QuickBooks invoicing and transaction support

- Manage social media accounts — daily posting, engagement, and community management (~1 hour/day)

- Coordinate team communication, track hours, and manage internal workflows

- Create and maintain SOPs, documentation, and process systems

- Use tools like Notion, ShipStation, Google Workspace, Clockify, and BitWarden

- Anticipate problems before they happen and solve them before they're asked

- Handle whatever else needs handling—because in a growing company, priorities shift fast





Who You Are

Non-Negotiables:

- 2+ years of virtual assistant experience (ecommerce experience is a major plus)

- Exceptional English — writing, speaking, and comprehension at a native or near-native level

- Available to work EST business hours full-time (40 hrs/week)

- Proactive critical thinker — you don't wait to be told what to do

- Relentless problem solver — "no" is just the beginning of the conversation

- Highly intelligent and detail-obsessed — nothing gets past you

- Outstanding customer service skills — you communicate with clarity and care

- Social media savvy — you know how to create engaging content and build community



What Sets You Apart:



You've used QuickBooks, Shopify, or ecommerce platforms before

title: Virtual Executive / Personal Assistant
description:
Virtual Assistant / Executive Assistant / Personal Assistant (Remote, Part-Time, Full-Time Growth)

 

We’re seeking a proactive, highly organized Virtual Assistant to support an entrepreneur with a dynamic lifestyle and multiple business interests. This role spans travel coordination, financial admin, personal projects, digital content support, and more. Ideal for someone resourceful, tech-savvy, and detail-oriented. This is a remote, part-time opportunity (20 hours/week with growth to full-time within 1-2 months after training), requiring 1-2 hours each weekday of overlap with Pacific Time hours.



 

Key Responsibilities

• Manage calendars, inboxes, scheduling, prioritization, and follow-through

• Coordinate travel including flights, hotels, transportation, itineraries

• Track and organize expenses; maintain spreadsheet-based reports

• Conduct online research for vendors, pricing, products, market data, and personal projects

• Support property-related needs such as scheduling vendors, services, invoices, and monitoring recurring tasks.

• Order essential items, track deliveries/returns, and coordinate gifts and services when needed.

• Book personal appointments (health, wellness, fitness, dining, etc.) and maintain reminders to keep routines organized.

• Maintain confidentiality, handle sensitive documents, and help streamline personal + business systems.

• Learn new tools independently and proactively troubleshoot or research solutions without needing step-by-step instruction.

 

Requirements

• Excellent spoken and written English with clear, professional communication.

• Prior experience with customer service, spreadsheets, research, travel planning, or financial admin is strongly preferred.

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, consistent, and dependable with reliable internet and computer access.

• Strong Google Workspace proficiency—especially Sheets (formulas, formatting, data cleanup; bonus if pivot tables are familiar).

• Resourceful problem solver—able to complete tasks independently, including entirely new tasks by researching how to do them.

• Comfortable using and learning new tools: Google Workspace, online dashboards, Asana, Canva, new tools, travel and scheduling platforms.

• High integrity, ownership mindset, and commitment to delivering accurate, timely, polished work.

• Ability to work autonomously while being accessible for periodic check-ins (e.g., short AM/PM windows).

 

Benefits

• Part-time start (20h first month) with plans to grow into a long-term, full-time role within 1-2 months

• Flexible remote work with weekly check-ins to align the agenda for the week

• Opportunity to learn new systems, take on higher-level projects, and grow with the businesses



Core Values

• Be open, authentic, and communicate with clarity and integrity.

• Take passionate ownership—deliver what you promise, learn from mistakes, and bring solutions.

• Be resourceful, proactive, and committed to customer success.

• Work well with others—show empathy, respect time, and maintain humility with confidence.

• Bloom where you are planted—embrace growth, creativity, and pride in your work.

• Have fun and bring positive energy while striving for excellence.

 

How to Apply

Please submit your application through the form below. Only candidates who complete the form will be considered. Resumes need to be up to date including months + year to show total duration in a role/company.




 





Job description link

title: Real Estate Photo Editor/Quality Control
description:
We are seeking an individual who thrives in a collaborative team environment, demonstrates enthusiasm, and takes initiative. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to provide effective solutions are essential. The ideal candidate should be organized and capable of enhancing our existing systems.



Responsibilities:

Primary responsibility involves meticulously reviewing each image received from our editing house, ensuring consistency and adherence to our brand standards. This entails identifying mistakes or inconsistencies in the editing process to maintain a unified visual style.



If content falls short of our brand standards, the candidate will be required to either send it back with revision requests or make necessary adjustments, including exposure, color correction, cropping, and other enhancements, to ensure a professional and appealing look.



Proficiency in photo editing software such as Adobe Photoshop and Lightroom is a must. A solid understanding of various editing techniques and tools available in these programs is expected.



Effective communication and collaboration with photographers and the scheduling team are crucial. The candidate will closely work with them to comprehend clients' specific requirements, ensuring that the final images align with their vision.



Management and prioritization of a substantial volume of images within tight deadlines is a key responsibility. The candidate should employ efficient workflows and demonstrate strong time management skills to complete editing tasks punctually.



A keen eye for detail is indispensable in identifying and rectifying imperfections or inconsistencies in the images.



Maintenance of an organized file structure and the use of proper naming conventions for edited images are critical. This facilitates easy access, retrieval, and sharing of files with both clients and tea
mbers.



Reach out to clients in a timely manner and effectively response to clients' revision requests is vital for ensuring customer satisfaction.



Required Experience:

Virtual Staging

Proficient in Photoshop and Lightroom

Exposure blending

Luminosity masks

Layer masking

Color correction and grading

Sky replacement

Virtual dusk

--

Monday - Friday 6am-2pm EST

Dont forget to send link of your CVs and your portfolio. Other candidate forgets that. So dont miss it! :) Send it to

title: Graphic Design Artist for a Screen print/Embroidery Shop
description:
Role Summary



Designed In Ink (DII) is hiring a Graphic Artist to take customer art from “almost there” to screen print-ready or embroidery-ready. This role is the communication bridge between sales, production, and the customer, ensuring artwork is properly set up, approvals are captured, and production receives clean, accurate files—on time.



You’ll work inside Deconetwork to manage artwork workflows, request/track approvals, and keep all stakeholders aligned so jobs move smoothly into production.



Key Responsibilities

Customer + Internal Communication



Serve as the main artwork point of contact between sales, production, and customers.



Ask the right questions to finalize art details (placement, sizing, colors, garment type, thread/ink needs).



Provide clear, professional updates to keep jobs moving and prevent bottlenecks.



Collect and document approvals in Deconetwork before production begins.



Screen Print-Ready Artwork



Convert and clean customer-supplied artwork for screen printing.



Vectorize/repair logos, rebuild poor-quality files, and separate colors when needed.



Prepare print-ready files with correct sizing, spot colors, and production notes.



Ensure files meet internal standards for DTF/screen print workflows (as applicable).



Embroidery-Ready Artwork



Prepare artwork for embroidery setup (clean vector art, simplify, define stitch-friendly details).



Create clear embroidery instructions (thread colors, sizes, placement, underlay considerations).



Coordinate with production team on feasibility and adjustments for best sew results.



Provide artwork that is ready for digitizing or handoff to digitizing partner/workflow.



Workflow + Approvals (Deconetwork)



Use Deconetwork to upload proofs, request approvals, track revisions, and route jobs internally.



Maintain accurate job notes, version control, and production instructions in the system.



Keep artwork tasks organized and prioritized to meet production deadlines.



Must-Have Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)



Fluent English (written and verbal)



Consistent availability Monday–Friday, 8:00am–3:00pm Arizona time



Strong proficiency in Adobe Illustrator



Strong proficiency in Adobe Photoshop



Comfortable using online production/project management software, including Deconetwork, for approvals and communication



Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have)



2+ years in a production art role for screen printing and/or embroidery



Experience with:



Vector cleanup, redraws, and color separations



Preparing proofs for customer approval



Apparel decoration terms (PMS, spot colors, underbase, left chest, full front, etc.)



Familiarity with embroidery constraints (minimum line weights, small text limitations, stitch direction awareness)



Strong organization and time management in a fast-paced production environment



Skills & Attributes



Detail-oriented: catches issues before they hit production



Clear communicator: keeps sales, production, and customer aligned



Deadline-driven: understands that art holds up the entire job



Coachable and collaborative: open to feedback and process improvements



Calm under pressure and able to manage multiple jobs at once



What Success Looks Like (First 60–90 Days)



Proofs are sent quickly with fewer revisions due to clear upfront questions



Artwork approvals are consistently captured in Deconetwork



Production receives correct, print/sew-ready files with accurate notes



Fewer production delays caused by missing art details or incorrect file setup

nt, chargebacks are not high-volume, so this role also includes customer service, order monitoring, supplier communication, and cost control. Over time, this position can grow into a full-time, long-term role with more responsibility.

s professionally in fluent English

title: Strategic Affiliate & Creator Partnership Manager
description:
Hi - I own a brand called AnyAge Wear (
) - a clothing brand focused on older women and encouraging them to move - in style  I am looking for a senior level person who has handled Affiliate and Creators/Influencers before. We are looking for outreach to be strategic, with quality over quantity at this stage.  You will be given an
 address from us and need to handle all correspondence, sending them the products, tracking content etc - using Shopify.



READ THIS FIRST: PRE-QUALIFICATION TEST

To be considered for this role, you must include the following two items at the very top of your application. Applications without these will be automatically archived.



The Voice Test: Write a 3-sentence outreach message to a 55-year-old US-based fitness influencer. We want her to try our Summit Skirted Legging. The tone must be "warm, sophisticated, and eye-to-eye"—not "salesy" or "pushy."  I encourage you to read out "About Us" section - we need the creator to know we are more than just clothes and support our mission.



The Strategy Question: If an affiliate is driving high traffic (clicks) but zero sales, what are the first three things you would investigate to "right the ship"?  



ABOUT ANYAGE WEAR

AnyAge Wear is a premium DTC apparel brand built for women 45+ who refuse to be "invisible." We don’t chase trends; we build Confidence in Motion. Our hero products—like the Madison Long Jacket and the Summit Skirted Legging—are designed for real lives, real bodies, and real movement.



THE ROLE

We are not looking for a data-entry clerk. We are looking for a CMO-minded Affiliate Manager who can build a bridge between our brand and the creators our audience trusts. You will own the strategy, recruitment, and management of our creator ecosystem.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

End-to-End Creator Management: Identify, vet, and recruit high-alignment creators (Influencers, Bloggers, Community Leaders) who authentically represent the 45+ US woman.



FB Creator Marketplace Mastery: Proactively navigate the
 Creator Marketplace to find and secure partnerships.



DTC Performance Strategy: Manage the "Value Ladder"—moving creators from one-off gifted posts to long-term high-performing affiliates.



Brand Stewardship: Ensure all creator content follows our Style Guide (Natural lighting, candid expressions, no "overly romanticized" or "forced" poses).



Apparel-Specific Growth: Use your knowledge of the apparel industry to highlight product utility (pockets, modesty, fabric tech) in creator briefs.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

DTC Apparel Experience: You must have worked with a US-based fashion or apparel brand. You understand sizing, fabric benefits, and the "Style that Serves" philosophy.



High-Level Strategic Thinking: You understand ROAS, Attribution, and how to optimize a creator's performance.



US Cultural Nuance: You understand the lifestyle and values of the American woman 45+. You know the difference between "influence" and "noise."



Platform Expertise: Deep experience with affiliate tracking software (Impact, ShareASale, or similar) and Meta's new creator tool.



Flawless Communication: Your written English is elegant, professional, and clear.



WHY JOIN US?

You will be working directly with the founder of a brand that has a clear mission and soul..  We are looking for the best in the Philippines and can pay accordingly. If you are a strategist who wants to help scale a brand that actually matters to its customers, we want to talk to you.

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:

Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.

Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.

WHO YOU ARE

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Data Analyst (Operations Experienced)
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Data Analyst plays a key role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. This position is responsible for building and maintaining Lookr dashboards, creating and automation reliable data sources, and overseeing the company’s daily, weekly, and monthly reporting infrastructure.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, disciplined, accountable, transparent, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

- Producing accurate, insightful reports that drive strategic decisions and improve campaign performance.

- Supporting the Marketing Operations, Sales Operations, and dashboard builders by ensuring seamless data integration, reporting accuracy, and actionable analysis across all platforms.

- Creating and maintaining dashboards that drive data transparency and actionable insights.





OBJECTIVES

- Dashboard Development: Build, manage, and optimize interactive dashboards in both Lookr studio and Power BI to support the marketing team.

- Ensure data accuracy, visual clarity, and usability of all reporting structures.

- Create and maintain reliable data sources, pipelines, and scheduled automations to streamline data collection and reporting processes.

- Collaborate cross functionally with other ops teams to ensure data integrity and scalability.

- Continuously improve reporting efficiency and adapt structures to evolving business needs.

- Present findings and recommendations cleary to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

- Translate complex datasets into digestible insights, visualizations, and narratives that drive clary and action.



COMPETENCIES

- Strong analytical skills, with the ability to extract, analyze, and report data from various sources.

- Proficiency in CRM tools, Zapier integrations, and marketing funnel workflows.

- Expertise in data reporting, KPI tracking, and leveraging analytics to drive marketing growth.

- Skilled in integrating and optimizing marketing platforms such as HubSpot, ClickFunnels, Kajabi, and Shopify.

- Experience with project management tools like Asana to track and organize campaigns.

- Strong problem-solving skills to address challenges in marketing operations and improve efficiency.

- Ability to write clear, compelling reports and presentations for stakeholders at all levels.

- A growth mindset with a willingness to learn and apply new technologies.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

- 3-5 years in a reporting and analytics role.

- Hands on experience creating dashboards in both Lookr studio as well as Power Bi.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of time sitting at a desk and computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY



As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

title: Senior Accounting Advisor (Bookkeeping for Multi-Clients)
description:
Senior Accounting Advisor for US Multi-Client Bookkeeping (Elite Role)



We are seeking a Senior Accounting Advisor with proven experience managing multiple US-based accounts at a professional level.



This role is for candidates who have worked directly with US CPA firms or fintech companies and can confidently handle several US clients at once with accuracy, speed, and strong communication.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

 • Outstanding English communication 

 • Direct experience handling multiple US clients simultaneously (20+)

 • Prior experience with a US CPA firm or fintech company

 • Advanced bookkeeping and general ledger expertise

 • Strong understanding of US accounting standards and workflows

• Phillipines CPA and strong accounting background



This is a high-paying, long-term role for a top-tier professional.



To Apply:



In your application, you must clearly state:

 1. Your experience managing multiple US accounts at a US CPA or Fintech Firm

 2. Your level of English proficiency



Applications without this information will not be considered.

title: Accounting Specialist
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Accounting Specialist to support the day-to-day financial operations of our trucking company. The Accounting Specialist will assist with accounts payable, accounts receivable, driver settlements, and general bookkeeping tasks.



Key Responsibilities

Accounts Payable (AP):



Process invoices



Match invoices with receipts and purchase orders.



Assist with weekly settlement verifications.



Maintain organized and accurate AP records.



Accounts Receivable (AR):



Assist with invoicing customers and brokers.



Update customer payments and reconcile accounts.



Follow up on past-due invoices as needed.



Support billing accuracy and documentation.



Driver & Carrier Support:



Verify driver settlements and pay statements.



Verify trip paperwork, rate confirmations, deductions, and bill of ladings.



Help resolve basic pay or billing discrepancies.



General Accounting Duties:



Enter and maintain financial data in TMS software.



Support the month-end closing activities.



Assist the CFO agency with audits and financial reporting as needed.



Compliance & Reporting Support:



Assist with IFTA fuel tax reporting preparation.



Support recordkeeping for DOT and regulatory compliance.



Help track fuel card transactions and expenses



Qualifications

Required:



High school diploma or GED (Associate’s degree in Accounting or Finance preferred)



Basic understanding of accounting/bookkeeping principles



Strong attention to detail and organizational skills



Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic computer skills



Ability to handle confidential financial information



Preferred:



1–2 years of accounting or bookkeeping experience



Experience with accounting software (QuickBooks, Square, or similar)



Interest in transportation, logistics, or the trucking industry



Strong communication and time-management skills



Skills & Competencies

Accuracy and attention to detail



Basic math skills



Ability to meet deadlines



Willingness to learn and take direction



Team-oriented with a positive attitude

title: Full Stack Web Developer (Junior–Mid Level Welcome) — Multi-Site Infrastructure
description:
Remote Full Stack Web Developer — Multi-Site Infrastructure & Website Operations ($3.50–$4.00/hr Trial - $4.00–$4.50/hr Long-Term Depending on Skill)



I’m building a structured, scalable website ecosystem across multiple brands and domains and looking for a reliable developer who wants long-term ownership over a growing portfolio of websites.



This is not a one-off freelance project.



You’ll become the primary technical operator responsible for building, maintaining, and organizing multiple websites inside a private infrastructure environment.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys clean systems, repeatable workflows, and long-term operational ownership rather than short-term projects.



All business details and workflows will be shared after NDA and hiring.



What You’ll Be Doing (Examples Only – Not Limited To):



• Build and maintain multiple business websites with consistent structure

• Work across front-end and basic back-end workflows

• Implement clean layouts and reusable components

• Maintain SEO-ready formatting and structured content

• Publish blog content when required

• Work inside private hosted infrastructure (SSH familiarity strongly preferred)

• Help standardize workflows and create repeatable systems

• Maintain long-term stability across all websites



You’re a Good Fit If:



• You have a full stack mindset (frontend + backend basics)

• HTML / CSS / basic JavaScript knowledge

• Experience with CMS or static site workflows (WordPress, Webflow, etc.)

• Comfortable working independently without constant direction

• Organized and process-driven

• Experience managing multiple websites long-term is a strong plus

• Experience with Linux environments or command line is a major advantage



Junior-to-mid level developers who are still growing are welcome if you are reliable and committed to learning.



Privacy & NDA Terms



• Signed NDA required before access

• Non-client-facing internal role

• Trusted with private operational infrastructure

• No agencies or subcontracting



Minimum Requirements – Do Not Apply If:



• You are managing multiple client jobs simultaneously

• You require daily step-by-step supervision

• You want short-term freelance work only

• You are part of an agency or outsourcing team



Pay & Commitment:



• $3.50–$4.00/hr — trial period

•With possible increase  $4.00–$4.50/hr after trial based on performance and ownership

• Paid weekly initially ? bi-weekly after onboarding

• Long-term growth opportunity



Schedule:



• Setup phase: 15–20 hours/week (first month)

• Ongoing maintenance: 5–8 hours/week long-term to start

• Additional hours and responsibilities will become available as the website portfolio grows and systems expand

• Work start required 9:00 AM PST



HOW TO APPLY:



Copy and paste:

“Full Stack Developer – [Your First Name]”Include:

• Resume (required)

• Short written introduction (2–5 sentences)

• Weekly availability + timezone

• Confirmation you accept the rate + NDA

• Confirmation you can work within 9:00 AM – 2:00 PM PST

• Links to websites or projects you have built or maintained

• GitHub profile or code samples (if available)

• One example where you improved or organized website workflows



Optional (but preferred):



• Short 1–2 minute video introduction



If you’re reliable, organized, and want long-term ownership inside a growing infrastructure let’s build.



Blue River Management

title: Facebook/Instagram Ad Editor
description:
Looking for a skilled Video Editor who specializes in High-Converting
 and Instagram Ads. You'll be editing short-form videos designed to grab attention fast, boost engagement, and drive viewers toward a specific call to action. 



Some projects will include real footage from my clients while others will require you to source and edit stock footage to create engaging ad-creatives from scratch.



If you understand pacing, hooks, and what actually works in paid social then this role is for you.

title: Construction Takeoff Specialist (Roofing, Siding & Exterior Envelope)
description:
Job Overview:

Monarchy Build, a leading exterior renovation company based in Ottawa, Canada, is looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Takeoff Specialist to join our remote team. You’ll work directly with our Chief Estimator to prepare accurate material and labor quantity takeoffs for roofing, siding, and masonry projects.



Responsibilities:

-Review architectural drawings, plans, and site photos for residential exterior projects.

-Prepare clear and organized takeoff reports for materials and labor quantities.

-Coordinate closely with the Chief Estimator to verify project scopes and ensure accuracy.

-Maintain organized project files and deliver takeoffs within set timelines.



Requirements:

-Minimum 2 years of experience performing construction takeoffs.

-Proficiency in using your own digital takeoff software/tools.

-Familiarity with North American or Canadian construction standards.

-Strong attention to detail and clear English communication skills.

-Reliable internet connection and ability to work independently.



How to Apply:

-Short introduction about your experience.

-Sample takeoff or work example (if available).

-Your expected hourly rate 

-Confirmation that you have access to your own takeoff software/tools.

title: Operations & Admin Assistant
description:
Position: Operations & Admin Assistant (Highly Detail-Oriented / Systems-Driven)

Remote | Beginning Part-Time (20–30 hrs/week to start) then ramp up to Full-Time



Hi!!! My name is Mel, and I own the top Christian speed-dating services in the United States! I’m on the lookout for a new assistant to grow with me. There are countless opportunities for growth, and I’m so excited to find the right person to join the team. I currently have two AMAZING assistants and need a third to keep up with the growth we've been experiencing. Here's a testimonial from one of my assistants:



"I’ve been working as Mel's VA since September 2024, and I genuinely love it. The work is meaningful (helping people find their Godly spouses), fast-paced, and never boring. You’re supporting a business that’s actively scaling. Mel is professional, clear, and respectful of boundaries. I can fully enjoy my days off, travel when needed, and never worry about work piling up. She also pays weekly and always on time. That said, a great client is great for a reason. This role requires great - truly GREAT - attention to detail. Mel has high standards, and rightfully so. If you’re not detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to doing excellent work, this won’t be the right fit. But if you are, working with her is incredibly fulfilling. I’m grateful to be part of her team and to support a leader who is clear, mission-driven, and genuinely good to work with."



Please read carefully before applying



This role is not creative, not social-media strategy, and not “wing-it” work.

This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys:

• Following detailed SOPs

• Working from templates

• Tracking numbers

• Executing conditional logic accurately

• Catching mistakes before they happen

• Doing important but sometimes tedious admin work extremely well



If you are not naturally obsessive about details, this role will feel overwhelming.



About the Role:



We run highly organized, multi-city events with complex ticket logic, conditional
 workflows, and time-sensitive admin tasks. One small mistake can create downstream issues, so precision matters. You will be responsible for executing systems exactly as documented, while also helping improve them over time once you fully understand how everything works. This is a self-directed remote role with clear expectations, clear SOPs, and recurring tasks.



Core Responsibilities:



Admin & Operations (High Attention to Detail)

• Perform data entry and tracking using Google Sheets and internal spreadsheets

• Monitor ticket inventory levels across:

• Men’s tickets

• Women’s tickets

• 1-man + 1-woman tickets

• 2-men combo tickets

• 3-men combo tickets

• Ensure events stay balanced (e.g., targeting 15 men / 17 women)

• Flag issues immediately if numbers are off or approaching limits



This requires comfort with multi-variable tracking and checking numbers multiple times per day. I’m ideally looking for someone with a high "C" & high "S" in the DISC Assessment (please write out your DISC Assessment scores).



Conditional & Logic-Based Tasks

• Execute conditional logic workflows (if-then scenarios), such as:

• Sending different
s to men vs women based on ticket availability

• Triggering follow-ups based on survey responses

• Knowing which template to use based on status, timing, and inventory levels

• Ensure the correct message goes to the correct group at the correct time



Social Media (Execution Only- No Strategy Required)

• Post Instagram Stories from pre-made templates

• Schedule stories using Buffer

• Follow exact posting instructions (timing, captions, tagging)

• No content creation or creativity required — execution only



Community & Event Setup

• Create
 Events

• Post pre-scripted messages into
 groups

• Follow posting rules and instructions exactly



 & Review Follow-Ups

• Send follow-up
s to participants who complete post-event surveys

• Encourage Google Reviews using approved scripts

• Ensure
s are sent only to the correct segments



Tools You Must Be Comfortable Using

• ClickUp (task management required)

• Google Workspace

• Google Docs

• Google Sheets (must be comfortable with complex spreadsheets)

• Instagram (Stories posting + scheduling)

• Buffer (or willingness to learn quickly)

• ChatGPT (for problem-solving, clarification, and drafting)

• Zapier experience is a BIG plus (not required but highly preferred)



Schedule & Availability Requirements

• Remote

• U.S. work hours strongly preferred

• Must be able to check ticket levels morning and evening (U.S. time)

• Weekend availability required 1-3hrs in the morning & evening on saturday & sunday. Please let me know if this works for you in your reply.

- Monday–Friday, you may choose 4-5 days to work 5–7 hours per day. You may opt to work 6 days instead of 5 if you prefer shorter daily hours—I’m flexible- as long as you get time-sensitive tasks finished. Some tasks will be time sensitive, others are flexible.



Hours & Growth

• Start at 25–30 hours/week guaranteed, and then ramp into full-time

• Workload will grow as we:

• Add more cities

• Launch new projects

• Expand operations

• We intentionally do not overload you at the start so there’s room to grow



Who You Are (This Is Important)



You are someone who:

• Is extremely detail-oriented (double-checks everything)

• Enjoys systems, structure, and checklists

• Can follow SOPs without improvising

• Notices inconsistencies others miss

• Is fast and accurate

• Can work independently without constant reminders

• Enjoys improving systems after mastering them

• Is comfortable with repetitive but important work



This is not a good fit if you:

• Prefer creative work

• Dislike repetition

• “Skim” instructions

• Get bored easily with admin tasks



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)

• 13th-month pay

• Birthday bonus

• Unpaid holidays allowed with advance notice (approval required for coverage)



We strongly reward:

• Reliability

• Accuracy

• Initiative

• Trustworthiness



Our Promise



We are building a long-term team. If you do excellent work, grow with the systems, and help the company scale:

• You will grow with us

• Your pay will increase

• Your role will expand



We value people who do quiet, excellent work behind the scenes- and we take care of them.



WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER APPLICANTS THAT ANSWER THIS QUESTION IN THE SUBJECT LINE: What is your favorite food EVER?!



Looking forward to hearing from you and finding the perfect fit to join our team!



Best,



Mel

title: Niche Shopify Store Builder (Brand-Focused)
description:
Niche Shopify Store Builder (Brand-Focused)

Remote | Part-Time | Contract



We are looking for a Niche Store Builder to build our premium brand store: DriveOn OS – Athlete-Grade Wellness. This role focuses on long-term branding and quality, not rapid testing stores.



Role: Niche Store Builder

Hours: 40 hrs/month (10 hrs/week)

Rate: USD $3/hour (USD $120/month)

Payment: Monthly via PayPal (1st of each month)

Start Date: ASAP



Scope:

• Build ONE high-quality branded Shopify store per month

• Focus on premium design, cohesion, and conversion

• Work with product researcher & project coordinator



Growth:

• Month 3+: 60–80 hrs/month ($180–$240)

• Month 6+: Second brand store project

• Revenue-share potential



PERFORMANCE-BASED COMPENSATION (KPI SYSTEM)



Monthly Earning Potential:

• Minimum: ~$240/month (foundation KPIs, pre-validation phase)

• Typical: ~$350–$550/month (Weeks 1–8)

• High Performance: Up to ~$840/month as store scales



How You Earn (Weekly KPIs – 7 total):

• Foundation KPIs (3): Consistency tasks, ~$50/week total

• Performance KPIs (3): Core role metrics, ~$190/week total

• Excellence KPI (1): Stretch goal, ~$75–$120/week



Caps:

• Weekly Cap: $250

• Monthly Cap: $1,000

(Excess goes to backlog, paid as revenue allows)



Revenue Rule:

All team payouts are capped at 15% of net weekly revenue.

If exceeded, earnings are pro-rated, with the remainder added to backlog.



Bonuses (Optional):

• Individual “Home Run” bonus: $100–$500

• Team bonus: 1–3% of team pool

(Not guaranteed, performance-based)



Payment:

• Weekly (paid Mondays for prior week)

• Via Payoneer, Wise, or agreed platform

• KPI report due Sunday 11:59 PM EST



Trial:

• 48–72 hrs unpaid pre-screening

• Required before formal engagement





Apply or send your application to:

title: Appointment Setter & Lead Qualifier
description:
We are a fast-growing, multiple six-figure tutoring company based in Michigan, USA. While we provide academic support across multiple subjects (Math, English, Science, Foreign Languages), SAT prep is our primary focus and core offering.



Due to continued growth in demand for our SAT programs, we are expanding our team and hiring an additional full-time member to support our increasing volume of inbound SAT leads. Although most of our clients are local to Michigan, we proudly serve families across the U.S.



The Role

You will call warm parent leads who opted in through our SAT-focused
 ads and scheduled a 5-minute SAT Accelerator callback. Your primary responsibility is simple and focused:



Have a short, professional phone conversation with parents and secure a 30-minute SAT Skills Assessment via Zoom with one of our SAT Specialists.



• Average call duration: 4–6 minutes.

• Calls are made using the WAVV power dialer in GHL (GoHighLevel), creating a fast, seamless workflow.

• You are not responsible for closing sales or enrolling families into the program.



All calls are made by following a detailed, step-by-step script that we provide. This role rewards clear delivery, confidence, and consistency, not improvisation.



Core Responsibilities

• Call warm SAT-focused parent leads who have already requested information or a callback.

• Use the WAVV power dialer to efficiently move through scheduled callbacks.

• Follow a detailed call script to ensure consistent, professional conversations.

• Build rapport with parents while staying structured and on-script.

• Gather key student background information (grade, testing history, goals).

• Confidently answer common questions using approved SAT talking points.

• Book qualified leads for Zoom appointments with our SAT Specialists.

• Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

• Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).



Performance Expectations

• Expected pace after ramp-up: 16–24 qualified Zoom bookings per day.

• Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

• Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

• Ability to stay composed, persuasive, and efficient on short (4–6 minute) calls.



What We’re Looking For

• Excellent spoken English (clear, fluent, confident; neutral or native-level accent).

• Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

• Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural and conversational.

• Strong rapport-building skills with parents.

• Coachable, reliable, and performance-driven.



Technical & Environment Requirements

• Laptop or desktop with at least 16 GB RAM.

• High-speed, stable internet (backup connection preferred).

• Quiet, professional workspace.

• Noise-canceling headset.

• Ability to work Michigan / EST hours (40 hours per week).

• Backup power or contingency plan for outages (strongly preferred).



IMPORTANT: Please apply only if you already have a second monitor or are willing to set one up within your first 7 days. A dual-monitor setup is essential for this role.



Compensation & Benefits

• 100% remote.

• $5 per qualified Zoom appointment booked.

• Paid every Friday.



A “qualified Zoom appointment booked” means that the parent meets our minimum criteria.



Typical earnings:

• $400/week with 16 qualified bookings per day.

• $600+/week with 24+ qualified bookings per day.



How to Apply

1. Watch this video and follow all instructions carefully:



2. Submit a link to your CV (Google Drive or similar). Please make sure we can access/view it.

3. Include a short audio or video recording of you speaking in English (introduce yourself and explain why you’re a good fit).



Important Notes

• We are hiring freelancers / independent contractors only.

• Attention to detail matters. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not receive a reply.

• Do not message our social media accounts or
 addresses.

• Do not call our company lines or personal phone numbers. Doing so will result in immediate disqualification.



Hiring Process

• Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

• Qualified applicants will be invited to an interview within one week.

title: HubSpot Admin (Sales + Marketing CRM)
description:
We are hiring an experienced HubSpot Admin to design, implement, and maintain a clean, scalable CRM setup across Sales and Marketing. The current system exists but is not usable—this role will fix the foundation and then provide ongoing support.



Responsibilities:



• Design and implement HubSpot CRM structure (pipelines, lifecycle stages, lead statuses, properties)

• Establish naming conventions, required fields, permissions, and data hygiene rules

• Build and maintain workflows and automations (lead routing, tasks, alerts, nurturing)

• Set up and manage HubSpot integrations and resolve sync or attribution issues

• Identify configuration gaps and improve CRM usability and reporting accuracy

• Provide ongoing CRM support, documentation, and workflow optimization



Requirements:



• Proven experience building or restructuring HubSpot Sales & Marketing hubs

• Strong understanding of CRM architecture and process design

• Detail-oriented with a focus on clean data and reporting accuracy

• Comfortable owning both implementation and ongoing support
