title: Lead Generator (List Builder + Instantly Campaign Operator)
description:
Role Summary



The Lead Generator is responsible for building high-quality, targeted lead lists for a pre-determined industry within a specific geographic territory, then launching and managing outbound
 campaigns using our warmed-up sending domains and
 accounts in Instantly.ai. This person’s success is measured by lead quality, clean data, strong targeting, and consistent campaign execution that produces conversations we can nurture into customers.



Key Responsibilities

1) Lead List Building (Primary)



Build highly targeted prospect lists based on:



Pre-determined industry vertical(s)



Required job titles/roles (decision-makers and influencers)



Geographic territory (city/metro/zip/radius as assigned)



Source leads using approved tools/databases (e.g., Apollo, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn, Google, industry directories—based on what we provide/allow).



Verify and enrich contact data (company name, website, location, decision-maker name/title,
, phone when available).



Ensure data accuracy and deliverability:



Remove duplicates



Avoid generic/low-value inboxes when possible 
 
 unless directed



Validate
s (use verification tools and follow our standards)



Maintain list quality standards:



Correct industry fit



Correct geography



Correct contact role/title



Clean formatting and consistent fields



2) Instantly.ai Campaign Setup & Launch



Import leads into our Instantly.ai workspace following our naming conventions and list segmentation rules.



Create and launch campaigns using our provided warmed-up
 accounts:



Apply campaign settings properly (sending limits, schedules, inbox rotation, etc.)



Segment campaigns by industry, geo, company size, or persona when needed



Ensure campaigns are properly prepared for handoff/management:



Correct lead assignment



Proper tags/custom fields



Testing and QA prior to launch



3) Quality Control + Reporting



Track and report on key inputs and outputs weekly:



Leads built (count)



% meeting targeting criteria (industry/geo/title)



Verification pass rate / bounce risk



Campaigns launched and list segments used



Monitor basic campaign health signals (as assigned):



Bounce rates and suppression handling



Reply categorization (positive/neutral/negative) if requested



Identify list-quality issues (bad titles, wrong industry, wrong geo) and correct upstream



4) Process Improvement



Build repeatable list-building SOPs by industry (what keywords, what titles, what filters produce the best leads).



Recommend better targeting angles (common titles, company types, sub-industries) based on what performs.



Success Metrics (What “Good” Looks Like)



Lead Quality: High match rate to target industry + territory + role



Deliverability: Low bounce rates due to verified, accurate data



Campaign Readiness: Lists imported cleanly with correct fields, tags, and segmentation



Consistency: Reliable weekly production and steady campaign launches



Downstream Results Support: Leads generate replies/conversations we can nurture (not just “volume”)



Required Skills & Experience



Proven experience building B2B lead lists (preferably by industry + geography).



Proficiency with Instantly.ai, including:



Lead importing



Campaign creation and configuration



Segmentation/tags/custom fields



Strong attention to detail (data hygiene is everything in this role).



Understanding of
 deliverability basics:



Why verification matters



Avoiding spam traps / risky sources



Managing duplicates and suppressions



Comfortable working from SOPs and also improving them.



Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have)



Experience with tools such as Apollo, ZoomInfo, Clay, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Google Sheets, NeverBounce/ZeroBounce, etc.



Familiarity with basic CRM concepts (pipeline stages, lead status, handoff to sales).



Understanding of buyer personas in B2B sales and how to target decision-makers.



Experience segmenting lists by revenue/employee size, service area, or specialization.



Tools You’ll Use



Instantly.ai (campaigns + lead management)



Google Sheets / Excel (list building, QA, tracking)



Lead sourcing tools (as provided)



 verification tool (as provided)



Optional: CRM (if we connect replies and leads to pipeline)



Data Standards (Expectations)



Follow our required fields and formatting rules (we’ll provide a template).



Every lead must meet industry + geography + persona/title requirements.



Leads must be verified and deduped before upload.



Notes/tags must be accurate (so follow-up and nurture workflows work).



Work Style & Traits We’re Looking For



Detail-obsessed: you catch mistakes before they become bounce problems.



Efficient and organized: you can produce consistently without sacrificing quality.



Coachable and process-driven: you follow the playbook and help improve it.



Ethical sourcing: you use reputable data sources and follow anti-spam best practices.



Position Details (You Can Customize)



Type: Part-time or Per Gig



Pay: Hourly 



Schedule: Flexible, with weekly output expectations



Reporting To: Sales/Marketing Manager or Owner



Remote: Yes

title: Graphic Designer
description:
We are looking for a self-starter Graphic Designer who can execute swiftly, with strong attention to detail, across a wide range of design areas. The right candidate will not only deliver clean, conversion-focused assets, but also bring creative strategy, branding expertise, and execution skills that translate client visions into reality.



This role requires a seasoned designer with a formal design degree (BFA/BA/BS in Graphic Design or closely related design field). Applicants without a design degree will not be considered.



Must be highly focused and fast—our turnaround times are tight and we cannot spend 8 hours on 8 post designs.



Strong, fluent English comprehension is essential; you must be able to read copy, determine the right imagery, and choose a design approach that best communicates the message.



Experience working with U.S.-based companies and comfort working night shift hours (9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. EST) are required.



This is a full-time, remote, hourly role with long-term growth potential for someone versatile in multiple design platforms and styles.



Responsibilities

Design high-quality visuals for marketing campaigns, including:

Lead magnets (fillable + non-fillable PDFs)

Paid media ads (static, carousel, and short animations)

Social media graphics and brand content

Brand identity assets, including logos and vector-based design

Conceptualize and fully execute logo designs, branding, and brand identity systems.

Develop and suggest color pairings, font combinations, and style directions.

Build and deliver comprehensive Brand Guide Strategies (using company templates).

Provide strong image selection, editing, and layout skills for polished outcomes.

Create design layouts that can be executed in WordPress.

Apply UI/UX best practices for digital design in tools like Figma.

Ensure all creative assets align with campaign goals and client vision.

 Additional expectations:

Manage design work for up to 20 client accounts across social graphics, ad creatives, flyers, website assets, logos, and PDFs.

Create from-scratch templates quickly, drop in copy, and deliver production-ready files at speed.



Qualifications

Strong portfolio showcasing logos, branding, digital ads, social media graphics, and PDF/lead magnet designs.

 Seasoned designer with a formal design degree (Graphic Design or closely related design discipline).

 Fluent, stellar English (written & spoken) with the ability to comprehend copy and translate it into the right visual approach and image selection.

 Demonstrated ability to work swiftly and stay focused under tight deadlines; proven experience with U.S.-based companies.

Proficiency in:

Adobe Creative Suite Pro (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)

Canva Pro

Figma Pro or other UI design tools

Vast knowledge of fonts and font pairings.

Excellent eye for color and layout balance.

Experience with fillable PDFs and lead magnet design workflows.

Capable of branding from concept to execution (logo to full brand guide).

Fluent in English (written and spoken) with the ability to understand and follow:

Written instructions

Video instructions

Voice notes/messages

Ability to translate abstract client visions into concrete designs.

Nice to Have (not required):

Drawing skills, animation skills, video editing.

Important — Please Read Before Applying



Do not apply if you:

Do not have a formal design degree.

Are self-taught only or coming from a non-design degree (e.g., engineering) and attempting a switch without formal design education.

Cannot work quickly and precisely, or cannot work 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. EST.

Do not have strong English comprehension for copy-driven design decisions.



How to Apply

Submit your application through OnlineJobs.ph messaging.

Include your portfolio (3–5 samples) that best show your versatility.

To be considered, please make sure your message includes the secret phrase: “Polished + Creative”. Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.

In your message, also confirm (bullet or yes/no):

Design degree + institution (required).

Availability to work 9 a.m. – 5 p.m. EST (required).

Recent experience with U.S.-based clients (required).

Comfort managing up to 20 active client accounts (required).

And more

Send materials to: 

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and industries. If you're passionate about automation and love solving diverse business challenges, we want to hear from you!

title: Executive Virtual Assistant / Operations Manager (Clinical + Membership + Content + Marketing)
description:
Executive Virtual Assistant / Operations Manager (Clinical + Membership + Content + Marketing)



Full-Time | Remote (Philippines Preferred) | US Daytime Hours | Long-Term Role



About the Business



We are a physician-led business with two divisions:



Virtual clinical practice (hormones + GLP-1 patient support, scheduling, refills, compliance)



Coaching and education brand (membership, seasonal challenges, podcast, YouTube, digital products)



The founder creates the content and strategy. You will own implementation, operations, scheduling, systems, and follow-through.



This is not a basic VA job. This is a high-ownership role for someone who thrives on managing details, systems, and execution without constant supervision.



Work Schedule



Full-time



Must work primarily during US daytime hours



Some flexibility may be needed during launches or live calls



Main Responsibilities

1) Executive Assistant + Calendar Ownership



Manage scheduling for clinical, membership, and business commitments



Protect blocked times and prevent double-booking



Send daily schedule text at 8am



Keep the founder accountable and follow up until tasks are completed



2) Clinical Operations Support (ClinicSense + Patient Communication)



Schedule new patients and follow-ups



Create patient charts in ClinicSense



Send and track completion of intake forms



Follow up day prior to appointments to ensure forms are completed



Upload lab results into patient charts



Fax lab slips using SRFax when needed



Coordinate refill requests and route them to NP (batched daily)



Important: You must never provide medical advice.



3) Payment Support + Finance Visibility



Support payments through Stripe (2 accounts)



Enforce strict refill policy: No payment = no order



Track outstanding balances



Track revenue categories (clinical vs coaching/membership)



Maintain a cashflow calendar (credit card due dates, recurring expenses, renewals)



Coordinate with bookkeeper (bookkeeper hired separately)



4) Compliance + Credentialing Management



Track deadlines and organize documents for:



medical license renewals



DEA/CDS renewals



CME requirements and certificate storage



malpractice renewal



ABIM MOC tasks



Lifestyle Medicine + Menopause certification renewals



BLS/ACLS renewals



LLC annual paperwork and filing deadlines



5) Membership & Program Operations (Kajabi)



Membership: SFMD Lifestyle Support Monthly



Create Kajabi events for membership calls



Schedule Zoom links + reminders



Upload membership content + resources



Upload call replays promptly



Handle membership cancellations and customer support



Draft a monthly “Clinical Check-In Newsletter” to drive membership enrollment



6) Seasonal Challenges + Guest Coach Coordination



We run 4 seasonal challenges per year.



You will:



implement challenge content in Kajabi + FB groups



schedule
s and live calls



upload replays and resources



coordinate guest coach “coffee talks”



track testimonials and participant wins



7) Podcast + YouTube Content Pipeline



Podcast is recorded on Riverside and released weekly.



For every episode, you will:



generate transcript (AI tools allowed)



create show notes and episode descriptions (ChatGPT allowed, must be polished)



upload transcript/show notes into shared Google Drive for podcast producer



maintain podcast topic database



upload full video podcast to YouTube



create YouTube thumbnail in Canva



Deadline: assets must be delivered at least 2 weeks before release.



8) Content Repurposing + Short-Form Editing (Opus Clips Required)



You will turn podcast episodes into:



Mindful Monday



SEO blog post (Kajabi blog)



Instagram posts/captions



Reels and YouTube Shorts



Stories content



You must be able to use Opus Clips (or similar) to create polished short-form clips with captions, hooks, and branded overlays.



9) Social Media + ManyChat Ownership



Schedule daily Instagram and
 posts (Meta Business Suite)



Manage stories consistently



Manage DMs and comments (no medical advice)



Build and manage ManyChat automations (comment-to-DM, keyword triggers, weekend autoresponders)



10) ChatGPT Proficiency Required



You must be highly proficient with ChatGPT to maintain consistent founder voice and speed up production.



s must sign off: XOXO, Dr. Stacy

Banned phrases: “doctor bestie” / “doctor cheerleader”



11) Metrics + Reporting



You will track and report weekly:



 list growth, clicks, conversions



funnel performance (Habit Tracker funnel)



membership growth + engagement



social engagement + top posts



clinical refill volume and outstanding balances



weekly revenue snapshot



Required Skills



Excellent English writing and communication



Strong organization and follow-through



Tech confident (Kajabi, Canva, Google Drive, Stripe, Asana, OpusClips, ChatGPT)



Strong social media aesthetic



Able to self-train and troubleshoot



Comfortable owning systems and executing independently



Tools You’ll Use



ClinicSense, Kajabi, Stripe, Canva, Google Drive, Meta Business Suite, ManyChat, Zoom, Asana, ChatGPT, Riverside, SRFax, Opus Clips.



Pay



We are hiring direct (no agency).

? HOW TO APPLY (APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS)

Examples of your work 
s, captions, Canva designs, reels, blogs)

Internet speed + equipment details

title: SEO Specialist (Remote | Contract)
description:
We’re looking for an experienced SEO Specialist to take full ownership of organic search growth across our websites. This is a hands-on role, not theory or “SEO audits that go nowhere.”



If you’re someone who understands search intent, rankings, conversions, and tracking, this is for you.



What You’ll Be Doing:

Local SEO

Time tracking required (tracked hours)



Nice to Have (But Not Mandatory)

Working Conditions:

Remote

Contract role

Hours tracked

Long-term opportunity for the right person



To Apply

A short summary of your SEO experience

Examples of websites or keywords you’ve ranked

Tools you use for SEO



Applications without real examples or results will not be considered.

title: Remote Chat Sales Agent
description:

Compensation:

About the Role



We are hiring remote chat agents to handle live conversations for online businesses. Your role is to communicate quickly and naturally with customers, build trust, keep conversations engaging, and convert chats into sales. This is a performance driven position for people who genuinely enjoy chatting and selling through text.



What You Will Do

Create strong rapport and long term customer connections

What We Are Looking For

How to Apply

title: Remote Desktop Technician
description:
Location: Remote | Full-Time (US Business Hours, CST)

Company: Lockbaud



 - About the Role - 



Lockbaud is seeking a Remote Desktop Technician to provide technical support to a coast-to-coast U.S.-based user base. This role involves frequent live interaction with end users and requires excellent spoken and written English, strong communication skills, and the ability to explain technical concepts clearly and confidently.



The technician will support primarily Microsoft-based environments and must be comfortable learning new systems and troubleshooting a wide variety of issues. One ticket may involve installing a printer driver. The next may require diagnosing a VoIP phone problem. Success in this role depends on curiosity, adaptability, and clear communication as much as technical ability.



 - Key Responsibilities - 



 - Provide remote technical support to U.S.-based end users via ticketing system and inbound phone calls

 - Communicate clearly and professionally with users, setting expectations and explaining technical issues in plain language

 - Troubleshoot and resolve issues on Windows workstations and peripherals

 - Support Microsoft 365 applications, including Outlook, Teams, OneDrive, and user account-related issues

 - Install and configure printer drivers, software applications, and system updates

 - Assist with troubleshooting VoIP phone systems, including device configuration, connectivity, and basic call quality issues

 - Use remote access and RMM tools to diagnose and remediate endpoint issues

 - Document troubleshooting steps, findings, and resolutions accurately in the ticketing system

 - Escalate complex issues with clear context and supporting details

 - Collaborate with Lead Technician and Dispatch to maintain efficient ticket flow



 - Required Skills & Traits - 



 - Excellent spoken and written English, with the ability to communicate confidently over the phone

 - Strong customer-facing communication skills; ability to work directly with a U.S.-based user population

 - Willingness to learn and take ownership of unfamiliar technical issues

 - Experience in a technical support or service desk role, or equivalent hands-on technical experience

 - Working knowledge of Windows operating systems

 - Ability to remain calm, clear, and professional (and upbeat) during live support interactions



 - Preferred Qualifications - 



 - Familiarity with Microsoft 365 environments

 - Basic understanding of networking concepts (connectivity, DNS awareness, VoIP fundamentals)

 - Prior experience providing phone-based technical support to U.S. customers

 - Familiarity with VoIP phone systems and endpoint hardware

 - Experience supporting printers and peripheral devices

 - MSP or multi-client support experience

 - Clear, neutral, or American-accented English (for phone-based support roles)



 - What Success Looks Like - 



 - Users understand what you’re doing and why

 - Issues are resolved efficiently without unnecessary escalation

 - Documentation is thorough and useful to other technicians

 - You handle unfamiliar problems methodically instead of freezing



 - Why Lockbaud - 



This role offers hands-on experience supporting real users in real environments. You’ll work directly with U.S.-based customers, gain exposure to Microsoft platforms, printers, and VoIP systems, and develop your technical and communication skills alongside experienced technicians.



 - How to Apply - 



 - Include “ExcitedToStart!” at the beginning of your application

 - Submit a resume highlighting technical experience and customer-facing work

 - Include a short voice recording to demonstrate phone communication skills

title: Experienced Video Editor
description:
We partner with medical practices and doctors to build dominant digital presences through strategic content and paid advertising. We capture high-quality video content in quarterly shoots and transform that raw footage into organic posts and high-converting video ads that position our clients as the leading authorities in their medical markets. We’re now expanding our team to meet growing demand. I’m looking for an absolute expert in video editing.



Role & Responsibilities

As our Video Editor, your main responsibilities will include:

- Reviewing and organizing hours of footage

- Adding B-roll, subtitles, and appropriate music to talking head videos

- Editing multiple short-form reels for Meta ads and organic content

- Creating eye-catching, scroll-stopping content

- Managing multiple projects while meeting deadlines

- Proficiency in CapCut Pro and Adobe Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator)

- Working with a reliable internet connection and a computer capable of handling video editing software

- Comfortable communicating and collaborating through Asana and Slack





What We’re Looking For

You should have:

- Advanced English language skills

- An upbeat, helpful attitude

- 100% honesty and transparency

- Attention to detail (e.g., include your favorite food in the subject line!)

- Advanced knowledge of hooks and viral video techniques

- Advanced understanding of Meta ads

- Optional but valuable: Graphic design skills (thumbnails, social media graphics, motion graphics)

- If you cannot commit to daily output of 5–10 videos, please do not apply.



What We Value Most

- Good taste in design and content

- Timeliness and reliability

- Honesty and integrity

- Continuous desire to improve

- Asking questions and seeking clarification when needed

- Ability to follow step-by-step instructions

A self-starter mindset and fearlessness in learning and helping





Work Schedule

- 5 videos edited per day

- Flexible hours; we care about quality and turnaround



Why Join Us?

You’ll be on the ground floor of helping our clients grow amazing businesses. Having had challenging bosses in the past, I’ve dedicated my career to creating a respectful, supportive, and growth-focused environment. You’ll be highly valued, and together, we’ll push each other to improve. We’re excited to work with someone who is as passionate about video editing and digital marketing as we are!



How to Apply

Please send the following when applying:

1. Your portfolio showcasing your video editing work, including reels, ads, and social media videos

2. Your resume, with references if possible

3. Test Assignment (provided separately)
